texts.es: El Sr. Mario tiene 49 años, tiene  3 hijos que son de las edades de  21, 19 y 16 años,  todos estudiando, El Sr. Mario se dedica al servicio de construcción, el trabaja en las distintas construcciones realizando el pintado de interiores y exteriores este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Mario va a usar este préstamo para  la compra de material como pinturas de distintos colores y brochas ya que le hace mucha falta para realizar las obras, El Sr. Mario enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la dependencia de cada trabajo ya que tiene que cumplir con el contrato por cada casa a la que va  a trabajar en la construcción  y va seguir utilizando los beneficios en comprar herramientas y materiales que necesita para la realización de un buen trabajo que implica muchos más contratos y por ende más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Sr. Mario is 49 years old and has three children (ages 21, 19, and 16), all of whom are in school. He works in the construction sector on various projects in which he handles the interior and exterior painting. This loan is his first transaction with Emprender.

Sr. Mario will use the loan to buy materials, such as brushes and paints in different colors, since he is severely lacking in supplies needed to do his work. He faces challenges in the construction business, such as having to depend on other contractors to finish their jobs before he can begin painting each house. Sr. Mario will use his profits to buy tools and materials that he needs to perform a good job. This will enable him to gain more contracts so that he can earn more income.

loans.use: to buy brushes and paints in different colors.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all her children go to school. She has three additional family members (a sister and her daughter and a cousin).

She operates a beauty salon at the market on a retail basis. She gets additional income from providing outside catering services. She has been in this business for the last 11 years. She works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT–SACCO to buy hair treatments, relaxers, shampoo, rollers and a hand dryer. Her major business challenge is electricity. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication, rent and food.

loans.use: to buy more hair treatments, relaxers, shampoo, rollers and a hand dryer

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
This is Elisa, 41, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Leonardo, a mason/carpenter, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elisa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Elisa dreams to expand this business and hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna is a 51-year-old married woman and the mother of two grown-up children. She is engaged in the buying and selling of bananas. She has been in the business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income.

Paterna is asking for a loan to buy more bananas. In the future, Paterna hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members.

She sells fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail basis. She gets additional income from selling piped water. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT–SACCO to buy bunches of sweet bananas, pineapple, watermelon, greens and cabbages. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication and food.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of sweet bananas, pineapples, watermelon and cabbages

loans.name: Narynkul

texts.ru: Нарынкуль 59 лет, замужем. Основная деятельность семьи Нарынкуль – животноводство и полеводство. В 2009 году, Нарынкуль решила расширить свою деятельность за счет откорма и перепродажи скота, вложив в первоначальный закуп скотины 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, хозяйство Нарынкуль насчитывающее 4 коровы и 1 кобыла приносит ежемесячный доход в сумме 10,000 сом.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нарынкуль обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Нарынкуль планирует направить на реконструкцию дома.
texts.en: Narynkul is 59 years old and married. The primary occupation of her family is raising cattle and growing crops. In 2009, Narynkul decided to expand her business by getting into fattening and selling cattle, investing 10,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS) to make her first purchase of cows. Currently, her farm, which now includes 4 cows and 1 mare, brings in monthly earnings of 10,000 Som. For the purpose of further developing her farm, she has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 Som to buy sheep. She plans to use the income generated by this loan to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Miguel Gilberto

texts.es:
MIGUEL tiene 32 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con la pareja y con el hijo en la ciudad de Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

Pertenece a la VRC SAN JUAN BAUTISTA se encuentra formada y creada en la ciudad de Tambanal a una distancia de 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperatva, La actividad económica es la agricultura, crianza de animales.

MIGUEL se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol,además se dedica a la crianza de ganado y cerdos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado, vacuna y alimentación. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar el ganado. La compra la realizará en Chillanes.

El sueño es tener terrenos propios para poder sembrar maíz. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la presencia de plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar de las fiestas de la comunidad y del carnaval.
texts.en:
Miguel is 32 years old, is in a common law marriage and has one son. He lives with his partner and son in the city of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar. He is a member of the San Juan Bautista Communal Bank, which was formed and is located in the city of Tambanal, which is 40 minutes from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. He works in agriculture, raising animals such as cattle and pigs. He also grows corn and beans.

Miguel is requesting this loan to buy a cow, vaccination and feed. He plans to buy the cow in Chillanes. His dream is to have his own fields to grow corn. The challenges he faces are the pests and diseases that harm his crops. In his free time he likes to enjoy community festivals and the carnival.

loans.use: to buy a cow, vaccination and feed.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, solicita un nuevo crédito porque necesita capital de trabajo en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, así obtener más producción. Este lo invertirá en la comprar de abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas  para el cultivo.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo para la compra de insumos agrícolas y con las ganancias ha hecho aporte a su familia. Las circunstancias han mejorado ya que los hijos siguen estudiando y además espera prepararlos  profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Julio is requesting a new loan because he needs work capital for his corn and bean crops, so through this he will produce more.  He will invest the loan in buying fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and pesticides for his crops.

His previous loan helped him buy agricultural inputs and with the earnings he has been able to support his family.  His circumstances have improved now and his children continue studying and in addition to that plan to prepare themselves professionally.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides for crops.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.ru:
Икромчон житель района Шахритус, расположенный в юго-западной части Таджикистана. Икромчону 28 лет. Он женат и у него двое маленьких детей - сын и дочь. Жена Икромчона занимается куплей и продажей миндаля. Сам Икромчон до этого времени иногда работал мастером по ремонту домов, иногда уезжал в Россию на заработки.
Теперь Икромчон хочет начать свой бизнес. Для этого он выбрал сферу животноводство, так как благоприятный климат его района прекрасно позволяет разводить скот. С этим намерением Икромчон обратился за кредитом. Он просит кредит для купли и продажи крупно-рогатого скота. За счет прибыли с новой деятельности Икромчон планирует провести торжество по случаю обрезания сына.
texts.en: Ikromjon lives in the Shahrituz region, which is located in the south-western area of Tajikistan. He is 28 years old, married, and has 2 children, a son and a daughter. His wife sells almonds for a living. Until now, Ikromjon has sometimes worked providing home repairs, and has sometimes gone to Russia to earn wages. Now he wants to start his own business. He has chosen to get into animal husbandry because the climate in his home region is very conducive to raising cattle. For this reason, he is now seeking a loan so he can begin buying and selling cows. He plans to use the income generated by his new business to host a ceremony for his son's circumcision.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
This is Annaliza, 35, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Joey, her business partner, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Annaliza operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy scrap garments from a textile factory and sells them with a little profit. Her products are used in making rugs and doormats. Customers are attracted to buy, due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are rug-makers from her local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Annaliza is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional stocks of textile items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Annaliza dreams of having more sewing machines and hopes to have their own house and lot. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Jura

texts.ru: Чура 30 лет. Он женат и у него двое маленьких детей - сын и дочь. Чура живет со своей семьей в районе Шахритус в юго-западной части Хатлонской области Таджикистана. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Чура занимается животноводством более 5 лет. Климат и природа его района благоприятствует здесь разведению скота. Чура разводит крупно-рогатый скот для потребления семьи и мелко-рогатый скот для продажи. Сейчас Чура запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи мелко-рогатого скота. За счет прибыли он хочет провести торжество по случаю обрезания сына.
texts.en: Jura is 30 years old, married, and has 2 small children, a son and a daughter. He and his family live in the Shahrituz area in the southwestern part of Khatlon region in Tajikistan. His wife is a homemaker. For the past 5 years, Jura has been raising cattle as the climate and environment of his region are conducive to animal husbandry. He raises cows for his family's use, and small livestock for the purpose of selling them. Now he is seeking a loan to buy and sell livestock. He wants to use the income generated by this loan to host a ceremony for his son's circumcision.

loans.use: to buy and sell livestock

loans.name: Sarkis

texts.en:
Sarkis is 28 years old. He lives in Kianeti village, Bolnisi District with his 31 year old wife Evgine. 

On several occasions, Sarkis requested a loan from local financial institutions for his family business start-up, but was not successful. His loan request was rejected because of his low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

Sarkis's family owns a small plot of agricultural land where they grow wheat. The harvested wheat is sold at the local markets. In addition, Sarkis is working as a security guard and gets paid a small monthly salary.

Sarkis requested a loan from Credo for his start-up family business. His loan request was approved by the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing credit and soft repayment conditions to the country's rural poor to allow them to fund their start-up businesses.  The rural poor do not have access to credit since they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income. 

Sarkis will use the loan to purchase calves. He will raise the calves and later sell dairy products at the local markets. This will significantly increase his family's income. Sarkis hopes the profit will allow him to provide better living conditions for his wife and himself as well as develop their agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase calves to start a dairy business

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a resident of Kitale, where he lives with his family in their rural home. He is married with two children, aged 17 and 3 years. 

He has five solid years in the farming business, with his farm produce like milk and eggs being sold within the local market. He runs his farm with the help of one farmhand.

George has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy and insure a dairy cow. He plans to run a farm of at least four dairy cows and ranks among the best suppliers for the local market.

George says animal diseases remain a major challenge in the farming business due to the high cost associated with them.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John  is a 31-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be honest and an intelligent man. He operates a retail store where he sells items such as flour, cooking oil, sugar, margarine, Colgate's toothpaste, etc. His business is located at a densely populated area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

John will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy daily-use items to sell. His business goal is to be a wholesaler  within five years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM after taking out previous loans of Kes 20,000, 50,000 and 150,000 which he managed to repay successfully.

loans.use: to buy daily-use items for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine is a 28-year-old. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboang Del Sur. Geraldine provides her two children's needs from the little amount of 20,000 PHP she has earned monthly from her own piggery business for two years, as an aid to the income earned by her husband. However, in 2007 she became a member of GDMPC, and she applied for a loan with GDMPC micro finance of 25,000 PHP to buy feed supplies. Geraldine wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: To buy feed supplies

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya, a region known for being the grain basket for the country. He is aged thirty-seven years and has been in active farming for seven successive years, milk, poultry and maize being his main produce for the local market.

Geoffrey has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy and insure a dairy cow. He says this additional dairy cow will help boost his farming income hence improve his family's living standards as well. He plans to establish a cereals processing business in the local market to supplement his farming income.

He notes animal diseases and lack of adequate finances as the main challenges in the farming business.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Félix De Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Félix de Jesús vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja en una universidad  de Managua en el área de servicios generales conocidos por sus compañeros como una persona respetuoso con una estabilidad laboral de 22 años.

Está solicitando un crédito a kiva por medio de ceprodel para la compra de zinc y perlines ya que necesita hacerle el cambio de techo a su casa que está en mal estado y quiere hacerlo antes que empiecen las lluvia.

Don Félix manifiesta su agradecimiento  con ceprodel porque con los crédito a mejorado su casa poco a poco y sus condiciones de vida han cambiado.
texts.en: Félix de Jesús lives in Managua and works at the University of Managua in the general services area.  He is known by his peers as a respectful person with twenty-two years of job stability.  He is requesting a Kiva loan through Ceprodel to purchase zinc and purlins because he needs to replace the roof of his home as it is in a state of disrepair and he wants to do it before the rain begins.  Félix expresses his gratitude to Ceprodel.   With the loan, he has gradually improved his home and changed his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase zinc and purlins.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Shyhrete

texts.en:
Shyhrete is 29 years old and an Ashkali woman from the vulnerable ethnic minority community. She is married and has three children. They all live under extremely poor and unhealthy conditions. Shyhrete’s family owns a small old house, and it has not had any repairs or renovation. She is a housewife and her husband is a construction worker.

Shyhrete is requesting a loan for the first time to renovate her old house and to repair the flooring. After repairing the house, Shyhrete will be able to create better living conditions for the family. Shyhrete appreciates all Kiva lenders and thanks them for the help!

loans.use: To renovate house and install flooring

loans.name: Urejesho Group

texts.en:
Urejesho is a group of 21 farmers in Webuye District represented by Violet. The group has 15 women and 6 men. Violet is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potatoes, millet and sorghum. Violet first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Violet joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices, and One Acre Fund also promotes healthy water by providing chlorine for farmers.

Violet described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and save for the future. Violet’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 10.5 acres of sweet potatoes, millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 42-year-old married man. He has two children, 6 years and 13 years old. He describes himself to be ambitious and a visionary man. He operates a rental houses business where he provides accommodation services. He has been involved in this business for nine years. His business is located at a densely populated area. 

Charles describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 95,000 loan to pay for the renovation of the rental houses. His business goal is to buy another piece of land and expand his rental houses business by constructing more houses to rent out within five years. In addition, Charles runs a grocery store where he sells fruits and vegetables. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of his rental houses

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema's business is on the rise. The items were bought in time and this enabled her to repay the loan on time. She would like to invest more into the business and is applying for a loan of 43,150 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of textiles including bed sheets, curtains, etc. 

Rehema is optimistic and looks forward to a good business season ahead.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of textiles including bed sheets, curtains, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Eric Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two members, Eric and Mercy. They sell slippers and yams in the community, respectively. They reside  in the Dansoman community. They have been together from 2010 to date and are still doing very well.

Eric is a 40-year-old slipper seller. He is married to Florence a 33-year-old trader. He has two children. 
 
He has been with ID Ghana for the past three years and is doing very well. He has been in this business activity for seven years now. He sells from Mondays to Saturdays. 

This is his 6th loan and he needs an amount of GHS 1,000 to buy more slippers to sell to his customers. He has been able, through his business, to provide his children with quality education. He is grateful to ID Ghana. 

They need a total amount of GHS 1,350 to buy more merchandise to sell to their customers in the Dansoman community.

loans.use: to buy more slippers to sell to his customers

loans.name: Maria Fernanada

texts.es:
La Clienta María vive en Guayaquil.  Ella comenzó vendiendo productos básicos, y como le fue bien en la ventas decidió ponerse un bazar en su casa para así poder cubrir algunos gastos de los que se le presentan en su casa.

Ella realiza esta labor junto a su esposo los dos atienden el bazar. Las enfermedades son un factor importante en su trabajo ya que le impiden realizar su trabajo con normalidad, ya que en temporada invernal en Ecuador hay muchas enfermedades. Ella tiene esposo están en unión libre, y tiene un pequeño hijo de 1 año de edad el cual no estudia. 

Con el prestamo quiere comprar articulos de bazar, armazones, viveres, cuadernos. Sus metas para un futuro son; hacer su casa mas grande, y ya el próximo año lograrla hacer de 2 pisos.
texts.en: María lives in Guayaquil.  She started out selling basic items and doing well decided to open a bazaar at home to cover some of the household expenses that came up.  She works with her husband; both of them tend to the store.  Illness is an important factor at work because it prevents them from doing their work under normal conditions because during the winter in Ecuador there is much illness.  She and her husband are in a common law marriage and she has a one-year-old little boy who does not attend school.  She wants to use the loan to buy merchandise, shelving, food items and notebooks.  Her future goal is to enlarge her house; next year she’ll manage to make it two stories.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise, shelving and food items.

loans.name: Iliana Irene

texts.es:
La Señora Iliana vive en Guayaquil, ella pasaba la mayor parte del día en su casa, y fue entonces cuando decidió ponerse un pequeño bazar en su domicilio.

Ella atiende su local sola, en su casa, el invierno atrae muchas enfermedades y es la única dificultad que se le presenta en su trabajo que no le permite realizar su trabajo con normalidad. Ella es soltera, no tiene hijos.

Con el préstamo ella va a comprar mercadería para su negocio como: cuadernos, útiles escolares, plumas. Etc.  Sus metas para un futuro es tener un bazar mas grande, para así poder tener más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Iliana lives in Guayaquil; she spends most of the day at home so she decided to open a small store at home.  She tends to it alone at home.  Winter brings many illnesses and that’s the only difficulty she faces at work in that they keep her from being able to do her work with normalcy.  She’s single and has no children.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise like notebooks, school supplies, pens, etc.  for her business.  Her future goal is to have a larger store in order to earn higher income.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, geometry sets, pens, etc.

loans.name: Majukumu Group

texts.en:
Alex is a member of Majukumu Group in Webuye District. He is pictured with 15 One Acre Fund farmers, 5 women and 10 men. Alex is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Alex is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to rest assured of reliable input delivery and grow enough food for the family.

Alex managed to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, he hopes to harvest even more. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and repair his home. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Alex’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 7.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is a 60-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children from Valencia, Bohol. She earns a living through her 'sari-sari' or variety store business.

Paz is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies and biscuits, cooking seasonings, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to cater for her customers and sell more products, thus increasing her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies and biscuits, cooking seasonings, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a father of four children, all of school-going age. He resides with his family in their rural home in the Kitale area of Western Kenya which is known for heavy consumption of poultry products. He has been in farming for six years, producing milk, maize and poultry for the local market.

Nelson has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo and says he will channel the loan to boost his poultry business. He hopes to run a farm of 3000 birds. He says the proceeds will help him in giving his children the best level of education.

He mentions recurring poultry diseases and non-genuine animal feeds as  the main challenge in the farming business

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Arzygul

texts.ru: Арзикгул 48 лет, имеет 4 детей. Двое детей школьники и двое детей Студенты. Арзигул в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи 18 лет назад начала свой бизнес в полеводстве и животноводстве. Благодаря упорному труду Арзигул  на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 головы крупного рогатого скота, 1 теленка 1 одна лошадь, выручка в продажи молока и молочных продуктов и перепродажи скота составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). Также Арзигул обрабатывает 2,12 га земли, где она выращивает фасоль и картошку. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Арзикан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота - 3 дойные коровы, для увеличения доходов от продажи молока. Доходы от кредита Арзигул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и обучение детей.
texts.en: Arzygul is 48 years old and the mother of four children--two school-aged students, and two in university.  While searching for a source of income for her family 18 years ago, she started her own farming and livestock business.  Thanks to her hard work, Arzygul today has 2 head of cattle, 1 calf and 1 horse.  The revenue from the sale of milk, dairy products and selling animals is around 12,000.  She also plants 2.12 hectares of land where she grows beans and potatoes.  With the goal of further developing her business, Arzygul has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 120,000 to buy 3 dairy cows to increase her income from milk sales.  She plans to use the income from the loan to increase her herd and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy 3 cows

loans.name: Denis Alexander

texts.es:
Denis, solicita un nuevo crédito  porque necesita más capital de trabajo y por la buen atención que la institucion  le proporciona. Este le permitirá pagar el arrendamiento de la tierra y para comprar abono para el cultivo de maíz y frijol.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, para el cultivo y aporte a su familia para  la alimentación. Las circunstancias han cambiado ya que le ha permitido ayudarle a sus hijos para estudiar y mejorar la vivienda.
texts.en:
Denis is asking for a new loan because he needs more working capital and because of the good service the institution provides him.  This will make it possible for him to pay the lease on the land and to buy manure for his corn and bean crops.

The previous loan helped him to buy farm supplies for his crops and to contribute towards his family’s food.  Circumstances have changed and now he’s able to help with his children’s education and to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to pay land lease and to buy manure.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya .She is aged twenty-six years and married with two children. She has been in active farming for six successive years, producing mainly milk and poultry products for the local market.

Damaris has made a request for a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. She will use the loan to buy and insure a dairy cow. She plans to run a farm of at least five dairy cows and is confident she will be able to meet her family needs as well as improve her farming business.

She mentions animal diseases as the main challenge in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Norhol

texts.ru: Норхол жительница района Шахритус, расположенного в юго-западной части Хатлонской области Таджикистана. Ей 57 лет. Она вдова с четырьмя детьми. Все ее дети уже обзаведены семьей. Норхол живет с младшим сыном и невесткой, которые работают учителями в средней школе. Сама Норхол домохозяйка. Однако сейчас Норхол хочет начать свой бизнес. Ей интересна животноводческая деятельность, так как местность, где она живет благоприятствует разведению скота. Норхол запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи крупно-рогатого скота. За счет прибыли с новой деятельности Норхол хочет провести торжество по случаю обрезания своего внука.
texts.en: Norhol is a resident of Shahrituz, in the southwestern part of the Khatlon region of Tajikistan.  She's 57 years old, a widow, and has 4 children.  All her kids already have their own families, and she lives with her youngest son and daughter-in-law.  They work as teachers at a middle school.  Norhol herself is a homemaker.  However, she would now like to start her own business.  She is interested in livestock since the area where she lives is a great environment for it.  Norhol is asking for a loan to start buying and selling cattle.  She wants to use the profits to have a celebration of her grandson's circumcision.

loans.use: to buy and resell cattle.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a father of five adult children, save for the last one, who is still in school. He is himself aged sixty years and has been farming for over twenty years. He resides with his family in their rural home in Kitale where he carries out farming. Milk, poultry and vegetables are the main products which he sells to the local markets.

Lawrence has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help boost his poultry business. He remains optimistic that the loan will help him have a stable income to educate his last born child as well as improve his farming business.

Lawrence says the main challenges in farming come from the high cost of feed and animal diseases.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Ruhan

texts.en:
Ruhan is 32 years old, divorced, and has two children, 7 and 4 years old. For more than 10 years, Ruhan has been providing transportation services, the only source of income for his family. His business and client base are growing steadily, and he has a good reputation in the community.

Ruhan is in need of a loan to register his vehicle and to pay for his work permit as a taxi driver. He hopes to increase the number of vehicles in his fleet to provide better transport services to his passengers. Ruhan hopes to stay in good health and to keep making his own living in order not to have to ask for help from others. His goal is to provide a better education for his children considering that education will lead to his children’s better future. He is very grateful for this opportunity!

loans.use: To register his vehicle and  pay for work permit as a taxi driver

loans.name: Cathie

texts.es:
Cathie es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Juana Azurduy de Padilla de la ciudad de El Alto.
Cathie terminó el nivel secundario y ahora trabaja confeccionando chamarras en su domicilio, en la ciudad de El Alto.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima (cuero, cierres y forros), incrementar y mejorar su producción y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Cathie es tener una empresa textil.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Cathie is single and has no children. He lives at the home of his parents, which is located in the District of Juana Azurduy de Padilla in the city of El Alto.

Cathie finished secondary school and now earns a living by making jackets at his home in the city of El Alto. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy raw materials (leather, zippers, and linings) so that he can increase and improve his production. This will allow him to improve his quality of life. His dream is to own a textile business.

This is the first loan he has requested from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy leather, zippers, and linings for making jackets.

loans.name: Gabriel Marcelo

texts.es:
GABRIEL tiene 53 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los unos familiares en cghillanes Provincioa de Bolívar.

Pertenece a la VRC SAN JUAN BAUTISTA se encuentra formada y creada en la ciudad de Tambanal a una distancia de 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperatva, La actividad económica es la agricultura, crianza de animales.

GABRIEL se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol,además se dedica a la crianza de ganado.
Solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar el ganado. La compra la realizará en Chillanes.

El sueño es tener terrenos propios para poder sembrar. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la presencia de mucha lluvias daña los cultivos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el boly, indor. y disfrutar de la comunidad y de las festividades.
texts.en:
Gabriel is 53 years old and is single with no children. He lives with some relatives in Chillanes, Bolívar Province.

He is a member of the communal bank VRC SAN JUAN BAUTISTA. This communal bank came together and was set up in the city of Tambanal, at a distance of 40 minutes from the cooperative’s office. The economic activities carried out are agriculture and animal rearing.

Gabriel works in agriculture. He sets maize and beans and he also rears livestock.

He is requesting this loan to buy livestock. With the help of this loan he will be able to buy one animal. He will purchase it in Chillanes.

His dream is to have his own land to sow. One of the challenges for him is the heavy that damages his crops.

In his free time he likes to play sport, especially indoor bowling, and he enjoys living in his community and the festivities held in the area.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Katherin

texts.es:
Katherin tiene un puesto de jugos, su nivel de educación es de secundario, vive en casa de sus padres ocupando dos  habitaciones de acabado de ladrillo y piso de machimbre en la ciudad de La Paz.
Katherin vende  jugos de avena con leche, quinua, linaza y wilcaparu. Para muchas personas resulta más saludable consumir jugos naturales y frescos elaborados al momento como uno de los productos que ella ofrece. La ventaja de consumir estos jugos radica en que las personas se exponen cada vez menos a productos dañinos, elaborados con conservantes y químicos que afectan la salud, ella vende sus productos desde las de 5:00 hasta las 8:00  de la mañana donde sus principales clientes  son universitarios y personas que están en dirección a su trabajo. En consecuencia, se está ofreciendo al público consumidor una producción más limpia.
El trabajo de Katherin le permite cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, pago de servicios básicos y otros.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de insumos como ser quinua, avena, azúcar, linaza y wilcaparu que los comprará por mayor y así mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.

El sueño de Katherin es que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Katherin has a juice stand.  Her level of education is secondary school.  She lives in her parents’ house occupying two rooms with brick walls and wood floor in the city of La Paz.  Katherin sells juices made from oats with milk, quinoa, flax and wilcaparu [type of maize].  Many people believe it’s healthier to consume fresh, natural juices that are made on the spot like the ones she makes.  The advantage of consuming such juices is that people are less exposed to harmful products containing conservatives and chemicals that can affect their health.  She sells her products from 5am until 8am and her main customers are university students and people who are headed to work.  As a result, the public consumer is getting a much cleaner product.  

Katherin’s work makes it possible for her to cover food, utility and other costs.  She needs the loan to buy ingredients like quinoa, oats, sugar, flax and wilcaparu at wholesale thus to increase her income and as a result her quality of life too.  Katherin’s dream is that her business grows.

loans.use: to buy food preparation supplies.

loans.name: Mohsin Haider

texts.en:
Mr. Mohsin Haider lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is 24 years old and a hardworking man. He is a very responsible man and has an elderly parent. 

He has been running a crockery business in a big market which is the only source of income for his family. He wants to generate more income by purchasing crockery for the shop. For that he has requested for a loan amount of Rs.100,000 from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase tea cups, plates, glasses, etc. By doing so, he will be able to increase his net income and savings. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase tea cups, plates, glasses, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 28-year-old married woman, mother of three children. She has been working at selling used clothes since 2010, to help her husband in making their living and providing their children with the best education they can have.

Fatima's business is going on just fine, and she puts much effort into developing it and expanding her working sectors. The diversity in her clothes attracts customers' attention, and that's why she is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua for her second loan cycle, in order to increase her merchandise with a specially released spring and summer collection. 

Fatima has a very good reputation in her area, and she is very thankful for that because it is a positive point to help her improve her business and increase her income. She hopes to keep on expanding her business as much as she can in order to keep on pleasing her customers.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise with a specially released spring and summer collection

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente vive en Guayaquil (isla trinitaria), ella tiene 60 años de edad.  Ella empezó vendiendo binchas y moños fuera de una escuela, después aprendió a coser, y actualmente tiene un taller, y un pequeño bazar con el cual sustenta sus gastos y ayuda a su familia.

Ella trabaja de 9:00 de la mañana a las 21:00 de la noche, trabaja en el taller y  atiende el bazar y lo hace sola, las dificultades que se le presentan en su negocio es la situación de su salud, ya que en ocasiones no puede cocer y solo se dedica al bazar.
 Ella no tiene esposo, y tampoco tienen hijos.

Con el préstamo la clienta va a comprar materiales y artículos para su  bazar como papeleria, cuadernos, utiles escolares, y también utilizara en su costura, los sueños de la clienta para el futuro son de tener salud, y poder brindar una mejor vida a su familia, y tener su casa más cómoda con sus negocios en ella.
texts.en:
This client is 60 years old and lives in Guayaquil (Isla Trinitaria). She began selling headbands and bows outside of a school, but when she learned how to sew, she established a workshop and a small bazaar so that she could help her family with the expenses.

The borrower works from 9:00 A.M. to 10:00 P.M. She works in her shop and manages the bazaar by herself. The difficulties she faces with her business include having to deal with her health situation. On a few occasions, she is not able to sew, so she only looks after the bazaar. She does not have a husband or any children.

With this loan, the borrower will buy materials for her sewing workshop and merchandise for her bazaar such as stationery, notebooks, and school supplies. Her dreams for the future include being healthy, providing a better life for her family, and having a more comfortable house so that she can run her businesses.

loans.use: to buy stationery, notebooks, school supplies, and sewing materials.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos pequeños , a los que cuida en la casa de madera que construyó hace algunos años. Sus padres se han dedicado a las labores agrícolas, la cual era su única fuente de ingresos económicos, pasaron los años y Eva se enamoro de un agricultor muy trabajador y sobre todo responsable. Eva se dedica a la siembra y venta de cítricos y aunque otra veces les compra la fruta a sus vecinos ya que esto es muy conveniente y la inversión es menor. Lo que también hace es comprar plátanos verdes, los que cuestan muy baratos y ya mediante el tiempo maduran y los revende a un precio superior.Este es el tercer crédito con KIVA y está agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe ya que le permitira avanzar en su actividad económica, por eso está segura de pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Eva, invertirá los S/. 1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Eva, 35, is married and has two small children she cares for in the wood house she built a few years ago.  Her parents worked in agriculture and that had been their only source of income.  Years passed and Eva fell in love with a very hardworking and, above all, responsible farmer.  

Eva works growing and selling citrus fruit although she also sometimes buys them from neighbors because that’s more convenient and the investment is smaller.  She also buys green plantains that are very inexpensive and in time they ripen and she resells them at a higher price.

This is her third loan with Kiva and she’s grateful for the financial support she gets because it makes it possible for her to advance in her economic activity which is why she’s sure to make her payments punctually. Eva will use the 1,500 soles to buy organic manure to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Carlos Miguel

texts.es:
CARLOS  tiene 24 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.

Pertenece a la VRC SAN JUAN BAUTISTA se encuentra formada y creada en la ciudad de Tambanal a una distancia de 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperatva, La actividad económica es la agricultura, crianza de animales.

CARLOS se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol,además se dedica a la crianza de ganado y cerdos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado, vacuna y alimentación. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar el ganado. La compra la realizará en Chillanes.

El sueño es tener terrenos propios para arrendar. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el mal clima mucha lluvia.

En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el boli y el futbol.
texts.en: Carlos is 24 years old and single.  He has no children and lives with his parents in Chillanes, in Bolívar province.  He belongs to the “San Juan Bautista” [John the Baptist] Communal Bank. The organization was formed and created in the city of Tambanal, which is located forty minutes from the cooperative’s office.    The members are engaged in agriculture and raising livestock.  Carlos is engaged in farming ad grows corn and beans, and also raises livestock and pigs.  He is requesting the loan to purchase livestock, vaccines, and feed.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to purchase livestock.  He makes his purchases in Chillanes.  His dream is to have his own lands to lease.  The challenge he faces is the bad weather as it rains a lot.  In his free time, he enjoys playing sports, especially volleyball and soccer.

loans.use: to purchase livestock, vaccines, and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy insecticide

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak lives with his parents and is the family's main breadwinner. He is involved in beekeeping. Currently, he keeps thirteen beehives. He likes beekeeping very much and would like to keep more bee colonies, which would allow him to make more honey. 

Artak will use this loan to purchase ten bee colonies as well as hives where he will keep these colonies. Artak is very excited about developing his beekeeping business as it will give him an opportunity to earn more income and save money to purchase more beehives. Selling more honey is important for Artak because it sustains his family.

loans.use: to pay for ten colonies of bees and hives

loans.name: Nazik

texts.en:
Nazik is from Yeghegnut Village in the Armavir Region of Armenia, and is involved in agriculture. Her farm currently includes two cows and five pigs. Nazik also cultivates tomato and eggplant. She works hard to gather a good harvest, sell it in the local market and earn income to sustain her family. Nazik lives with her husband, mother-in-law and son, who travels abroad to financially support his family.

Realizing that the income from agriculture is very important for her family, Nazik would like to expand her farm. This loan will help her pay for two bulls and buy forage (plants) to feed them, fertilizer and tomato seeds. The loan is very important for Nazik to increase her income from agriculture and ensure a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy two bulls, forage to feed them, fertilizer and tomato seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase stationery items to sell.

loans.name: Inna

texts.ru:
Инна продолжает работать рыночным предпринимателем на рынке в своем родном городе Мелитополе. Она торгует чулками, колготками и носками уже 17 лет. Торговая точка – в ее собственности. 
Инна обратилась к КИВА за финансовой поддержкой в размере 21 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить товар к сезону, а именно дополнительную партию чулочно-носочных изделий.
texts.en: Inna continues to work as a market entrepreneur at a market in her city of Melitopol.  She has sold stockings, socks and tights for 17 years.  She owns the space where she sells her goods.  Inna has turned to Kiva for financial support, asking for a loan of 21,000 grivens in order to buy season inventory, namely an additional lot of hosiery.

loans.use: To buy seasonal hosiery inventory

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена – предприниматель из Мелитополя. Она продает женскую одежду на местном рынке. Елена торгует с собственного торгового места, опыт работы составляет 12 лет. 
Елена планирует вложить полученные от КИВА средства в размере 5 000 гривен в приобретении партии сезонной женской одежды под реализацию на рынке. Она хочет закупить футболки, кофты, юбки, брюки и платья на финансовые средства КИВА и выгодно их реализовать этой весной.
texts.en: Yelena is an entrepreneur from Melitopol.  For 12 years, she has sold women's clothing at a local market from a space that she owns.  Yelena plans to use the funds received from Kiva (5,000 grivens) to purchase an inventory of seasonal women's clothing to sell at her market.  She wants to buy t-shirts, sweaters, skirts, pants and dresses with her Kiva loan and sell them profitably this spring.

loans.use: buy t-shirts, sweaters, skirts, pants and dresses

loans.name: Khakakho Group

texts.en:
Jane’s group, Khakakho, has twenty-three farmers and is located in Webuye District. Jane is pictured on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Jane is pictured amongst the five men and eighteen women of her group. She will receive input loans for planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and sweet potato. Jane joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains of 2010 and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Jane joined One Acre Fund so that she could grow enough food for her family and use increased profits to send her children to school.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Jane was only able to harvest eight bags of maize per acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains of 2012, she was able to harvest eighteen bags per acre. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and perhaps buy a cow. 

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Jane’s group will receive 11.5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 57-year-old married man, with three children all of school-going age. He has worked as a farmer for twenty years, growing maize and beans. He also runs a hardware store selling timber. His business challenges include animal diseases, and poor prices on the local market.

Jackson has asked for a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Kiva's partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to help him expand into poultry farming. He hopes that he will be able to generate more income through this expansion, and establish a bigger and better farm. His vision is to have a farm of six acres within five years time.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Esi Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two members namely Esi and Munnet. They sell food stuffs and shoes at Last Stop in the Dansoman community. They have been a group since 2012.

Esi is 33 years old and sells food stuffs (cassava, plantain, vegetables). She is married to Yussif, a 34-year-old trader. They have two children. She has been selling for the past seven years. She works from Monday to Sunday from her home, selling to her customers. This is her second loan; she needs 700 GHS to buy food stuffs to sell to her customers. 

The group needs a total amount of 1,400 GHS to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: to buy more cassava, plantains, and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена занимается фермерским хозяйством, выращивая ранние овощи на своем участке в с. Великая Знаменка. Этим бизнесом она занимается уже 17 лет. Елена живет с мужем в своем доме. Доход с огорода – постоянный и стабильный.  
Елена планирует вложить 24 000 гривен в расширение своего хозяйства и постройку новой теплицы из поликарбоната для высадки большего количества помидор, огурцов, редиса и получения дополнительной прибыли. Елена хочет развиваться и в следующем году надеется сделать отопление ещё в одной из теплиц.
texts.en: Yelena works in agriculture, growing vegetables on her land in the village of Velikaya Znamenka.  She has had this business for 17 years.  Yelena lives with her husband in their own home.  The income from the garden is consistent and stable.  Yelena plans to invest 24,000 grivens into expanding her efforts and building a new greenhouse out of polycarbonate in order to plant a large number of tomatoes, cucumbers, and radishes which will increase her profits.  She wants to expand and next year she hopes to install heating in one of her greenhouses.

loans.use: to build a new greenhouse

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Doña Rosa María vive en la capital de Managua, es una persona trabajadora, madre soltera con dos hijos a su cargo actualmente labora en una universidad del estado con más de veinte y cuatro año de servicio como afanadora.

El  crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para  invertirlo en compra de materiales de construcción tales como cerámica boom, para poner piso ya que es de tierra su vivienda. 
 
Este financiamiento  mejorara el nivel de vida de su familia, con esta oportunidad que  le ofrecerá  kiva y Ceprodel estará  muy agradecido, ya que es el único sostén de su hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa María lives in the capital city, Managua. She is a very hardworking person. She is a single mother with two children in her care. At the moment she works in a state university. She has more than 24 years of service as a cleaner.

She will use the loan that she is requesting from CEPRODEL to invest in the purchase of building materials, such as tiles and Boom (fast curing expanding foam used in construction), to put in a floor, as her house is built of clay.

This finance will improve her family’s quality of life. She is very grateful for the opportunity and Kiva and Ceprodel are giving her, as it is the only way to sustain her household.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Yohalmo Israel

texts.es:
Yohalmo, solicita de un nuevo crédito, porque quiere seguir mejorando en el negocio de las gallinas ponedoras. Le será de mucha ayuda porque invertirá en la compra de gallinas, concentrado, granza entre otros.
Con el préstamo anterior, le permitió mejorar la productividad y las instalaciones donde están ubicadas las gallinas. Los ingresos económicos han mejorado ya que tiene mejores ventas de huevos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Yohalmo raises laying hens and he is requesting a new loan because he wants to continue improving the business.  The loan will be of great help to him because he will invest in the purchase of hens, concentrated feed, and chaff [seed coverings removed by threshing] and other items.  The previous loan allowed him to improve productivity and the facilities where the hens are housed.  His income has improved because his eggs are better and he has a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase hens, concentrated feed, and chaff, and other items.

loans.name: Denis Del Milagro

texts.es:
Denis, tiene un charlet y pupuseria. Ella está casada, tiene dos hijos sus edades de 8 y 9 años de edad; no tiene familiares en el extranjero. Denis, hizo apertura al negocio como una fuente de ayuda para el sustento de su familia, este lo aprendió de su madre y lo realiza de 6:00 am a 4:00 pm. 
El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de productos para el charlet tales como: bebidas, churros, galletas, entre otros. Este le permitirá incrementar su inventario, aumentar la clientela y así la venta.
Su objetivo es ampliar el negocio, generar mayores  utilidades y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Denis has a small store and a pupusa business.  She's married and has two children, ages 8 and 9.  She has no family members living abroad.

Denis opened her business as a source of help to support her family.  She learned the work from her mother and does it from 6 a.m. until 4 p.m.

She'll invest the loan in beverages, churros [fried dough], cookies, and other products for her store.  This will allow her to increase her inventory and her clientele, and therefore her sales.

Her goals are to expand her business, generate more profit, and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beverages, churros, cookies, and other products

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Mario, requiere de un nuevo crédito, porque necesita más capital de trabajo y por la buena atención que se le brinda en la institucion. Dicho crédito le permitirá pagar el arrendamiento de tierra para el cultivo de maíz y frijol de este año.
El préstamo anterior, le permitió comprar, insumos agrícolas para el cultivo y con la cosecha ha ayudar a su familia. Su objetivo es poder ayudarles siempre a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando y tener una mejor vida.
texts.en: Mario is requesting a new loan because he needs more working capital and because of the good service provided by the institution.  This loan will permit him to pay for the leasing of land  for growing corn and beans this year.  The previous loan allowed him to purchase farm inputs for planting and harvesting and in this way, help his family.  His goal is to always be able to help his children continue their studies and have a better life.

loans.use: to pay for the leasing of land to grow corn and beans.

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
Marthe is a 53-year-old Cameroonian who is married and has 6 children. The oldest is 30 years and doing her university studies, while the youngest is 15 years old and currently in a secondary school. 

Marthe has been in this vegetable and fruit business for the past five years, which makes her very experienced and stable. This loan will enable her to increase her stock by 40 percent and her output by the same amount. Her standard of living will increase as well.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Kaen

texts.en:
Kaen is 33 years old and from Gaza. He is married and has three children: two boys and a girl. He has owned a small clothing shop since 2009 and has one employee.

He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a small automobile; he hopes that this loan will help him decrease his transportation costs and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a small automobile

loans.name: Hosea

texts.en:
Hosea (pictured here with his dairy cows although he's requesting a poultry farming loan) is a resident of Kitale where he carries out farming business producing mainly maize, beans and milk for the local market. He has five solid years in active farming. He is married with one child aged four.

Hosea has requested a loan of 35,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy more poultry birds. He plans to grow his farming business and rank among the leading poultry products supplier in the area. He says the farming produce will mainly go into educating his children.

Hosea has mentioned records keeping and poor prices for the farm produce within the local markets as the major challenges.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Huruma Group

texts.en:
James is pictured on the right with his hand raised amongst his Huruma Group members. The 15 of them, 8 women and 7 men, are farmers in Webuye District. Farming inputs will be delivered to James on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum. James first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 long rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 long rains season. James joined One Acre Fund in order to rest assured of reliable input delivery and grow enough food for his family.

James described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and perhaps save for the future. For the 2013 long rains season, James’ group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 7.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Viv Group

texts.en:
Viv's Groups consists of two partners, Vivian and Lily, who reside in Dansoman. They have been a group since 2011. Vivian is a seamstress and Lily sells materials. 

Vivian is 29 years old, married, and has one child.  Her husband is a photographer. She is requesting her fourth loan from ID Ghana for 700 GHS, which she will use to purchase materials for her sewing business.  She has been with ID Ghana for two years.  

The group is requesting 1,200 GHS to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers in and around community.

loans.use: to purchase materials.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito, requiere de un nuevo préstamo, por la necesidad de comprar alimentación para el ganado, como lo es harinilla, pasto, tusa, etc.,  debido a que en esta  época no hay pasto.  
Con el crédito anterior le permitió crecer en el cultivo de maíz, al mismo tiempo en el negocio de la ganadería, ya que hoy cuenta con más terneros y vacas lecheras, lo que significa que ha obtenido mayor ingresos.
texts.en:
Benito needs another loan to buy feed for his livestock such as corn flour, grass, corncobs, etc., because there's no grass this time of year.

With the previous loan he was able to expand his corn crop as well as his livestock business, and today he has more calves and dairy cows, with which he has earned more income.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Baraka Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of Baraka Group in Teso District. She is pictured with her group of 16 One Acre Fund farmers, 10 women and 6 men. Elizabeth is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for half an acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Elizabeth first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 long rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 long rains season. Elizabeth joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and also One acre fund has the best farming education.

Elizabeth described her harvest as excellent last year as a One Acre Fund farmer and hopes for another good year in the 2013 long rains season. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and perhaps save for the future. For the 2013 long rains season, Elizabeth's group members will take input loans of half an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 8 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Miguel Rogelio

texts.es:
MIGUEL tiene 22 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar comunidad Tambanal.

Pertenece a la VRC SAN JUAN BAUTISTA se encuentra formada y creada en la ciudad de Tambanal a una distancia de 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperatva, La actividad económica es la agricultura, crianza de animales.

MIGUEL se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol,además se dedica a la crianza de ganado, pollos  y cerdos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado vacuno. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar el ganado. La compra la realizará en Chillanes.

El sueño es tener terrenos propios para poder arrendar y un poco sembrar. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el bajo precio de los productos y el mal tiempo.
En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar de las fiestas de la comunidad y del carnaval.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 22-year-old single man with no children.  He lives with is parents in the community of Tambanal in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar.

He is a member of the community bank San Juan Bautista, which is in the city of Tambanal, which is 40 minutes away from the cooperative farm where he works growing plants and raising animals.  He grows corn and beans, and he also raises cows, pigs and chickens.

He is seeking a loan in order to buy a cow.  He will make the purchase in Chillanes.  His dream is to have his own land that he can rent out and also use for his own crops.  He faces challenges such as low prices for his products and bad weather.  In his free time he likes to enjoy community festivals and carnivals.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
La señora Karina es empleada; trabaja como asesor legal, su nivel de educación es superior, vive en la casa de sus padres  ocupando 3  habitaciones en un acabado de fino y piso de machimbre (madera).

Karina trabaja  8 horas al día, para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, luz, agua, educación de su hija y otros gastos mensuales.

El crédito lo requiere para los gastos de obtener su título en provisión nacional de Abogada y así mejorar su nivel de ingresos.

El sueño de Karina es que sus tres hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Karina works as a legal advisor.  She completed a higher education.  She lives in her parents' house in three rooms with fine finishing touches and wood floors.

Karina works eight hours a day to cover food, electricity, water, her daughter's education, and other monthly expenses.

She needs the loan to cover the costs for her national certification as a lawyer and improve her income level.

Karina's dream is for her three children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to pay the costs for her national certification as a lawyer

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
Justo tiene un taller de elaboración de todo tipo de artículos elaborados con bronce, su nivel de educación es de secundaria, vive en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones con acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la ciudad de La Paz.
Justo recicla desechos de bronce para la transformación de productos artesanales como ser pendientes, adornos de pared y otros. A través de esto obtiene su principal materia prima de excelente calidad, a menor costo y  además con un alto ahorro de energía.
El trabajo de Justo  le permite cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, pago de servicios básicos y otros.
El crédito lo requiere para la ampliación de su taller, comprara ladrillo, cemento y otros materiales de construcción y  así mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida y al mismo tiempo mantendrá el alto nivel de limpieza en sus productos.

El sueño de Justo  es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y además que su taller crezca.
texts.en:
Justo has a shop in which he makes all types of bronze items.  He completed secondary school.  He lives in the city of La Paz in his own brick three-room house with a cement floor.

He recycles bronze scrap metal to create artisanal products such as pendents, wall adornments and other items.  In this way he is able to obtain excellent raw material at a low cost.  Further, this saves a great deal of energy. The income from his work covers his costs for food, utilities, and other expenses.

He is seeking a loan so that he can expand his shop.  He will buy bricks, cement and other construction materials.  He will thus be able to increase his income and his standard of living and at the same time maintain a high degree of purity in his products.

His dream is for his children to complete their studies, and also for his business to grow.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and other materials so he can expand his shop where he makes bronze crafts and other items.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina, decide optar por un nuevo préstamo por la facilidad de pago que la empresa le otorga y que le genera beneficios en las ventas. Dicho préstamo le servirá para comprar ropa, camisas, faldas y ropa interior. 
Con el crédito anterior obtuvo más ganancias porque había mercadería para la venta. Las circunstancias familiares han mejorado y mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Catalina has decided to seek a new loan so that she can generate more income, and also because of the favorable terms that she has been offered.  This loan will enable her to buy clothes for resale, such as shirts, skirts and underwear.

With her previous loan, she obtained greater profits since she had the merchandise she needed.  Her family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as shirts, skirts and underwear.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a married woman. She has two children, aged 10 and 16 years. She describes herself as a dedicated and organized woman. She operates a retail tailoring store, where she sells items such as skirts and dresses, and repairs worn-out clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located at a general public area, and her customers are primarily local residents.

She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fabric and other materials, for making new clothes. Her business goal is to run two more retail tailoring stores within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes material, for making new clothes to sell

loans.name: Huruma Group

texts.en:
Huruma Group is located in Webuye District. It is a group of 12 women and 3 men, led by Rodah, who is pictured on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Rodah first joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and now she is enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Rodah joined One Acre Fund so that she could grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send her children to school.

Rodah described her last year's harvest as very good, but she believes she can have an even better one this year. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and, perhaps, buy a cow. Huruma Group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 7.5 acres of sweet potato, millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of one-half acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe, se dedica a  comercializar ganado, cerdos, caballos y granos básicos. Él vive con su esposa, tiene cuatro hijos de 12, 10, 6 y 1 año de edad, tres de ellos estudian y dependen de el  mientras que el otro se encuentra en el extranjero. 
El se dedica a las actividades agropecuarias  y al comercio de ganado, cerdos, caballos; dicho trabajo lo aprendió  de sus padres, lo cual lo realiza desde hace 22 años.  Solicita un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de 4 silos metálicos para guardar maíz y el resto en la compra de cerdos.
Esta inversión le será de  mucha utilidad, ya que podrá tener el maíz guardado y sacarlo a la venta cuando el precio de este mejore. El Riesgo que se puede tener es una plaga en el maíz y se pueda dañar. Su objetivo es seguir luchando para mejorar sus condiciones de vida personal y familiar, crear un negocio más rentable, que le permita incrementar sus ingresos económicos, para aportar a sus hijos con el estudio y alimentación.
texts.en:
Felipe raises and sells cows, pigs, horses and grain crops.  He lives with his wife, with whom he has four children aged 1, 6, 10 and 12.  Three of them are in school and depend on him, while the other child is living in a foreign country.

He learned the business of farming from his parents, and he has been doing this work for 22 years.  He is seeking a loan to invest in four metal silos for storing corn.  He will use the rest for the purchase of pigs.

This investment will be very useful, since he will be able to store his corn and take it to the market when the price is better.  A possible risk is that the corn could be suffer crop disease and become damaged.  

Felipe's goal is to continue fighting to improve his family's standard of living, and to create a more profitable business.  This will enable him to increase his income so that he can feed and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy pigs and four metal silos.

loans.name: Katamakisi Group

texts.en:
Katamakisi is a group of 17 farmers in Teso District, represented by Celestine. The group has 12 women and 5 men. Celestine is on the right of the photo, with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum. Celestine first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send her children to school.

Celestine described her harvest as very good last year, but she believes she can have an even better one this year. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and repair her home. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Katamakisi Group will receive 8.5 acres' worth of inputs, on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy scrap for her husband's scrap-selling business.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en: Minda earns a living by running her sari-sari (variety) store, selling various goods to the people in her place.She has been in the business for more than a year.  Minda is asking for a loan to buy more goods to sell, like canned goods, candies, biscuits and chips, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store. In the future, Minda has hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell, like canned goods, candies, biscuits and chips, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Tuungane Group

texts.en:
Tuungane Group is located in Webuye District. It is a group of 14 women and 2 men led by Rabecca, pictured on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Rabecca first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Rabecca joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, and also because their group work makes working easier.

Rabecca described her harvest as very good last year, but she believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and, perhaps, buy some more land for farming. Tuungane Group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for 8 acres of sweet potato, millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Dunia

texts.en:
Dunia is a 24-year-old, single woman who has been working as a hairdresser since 2008. In 2011, Dunia moved her business outside of her house to make sure that her customers will be more relaxed and because she needs to develop her business to increase her income.

Dunia is a three cycles loan borrower from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development. Through her previous loans, she was able to buy the necessary tools and machines she needs to move, expand, and develop her business. 

Through this youth loan she has applied for, Dunia will make necessary maintenance and add decorations to her beauty salon, in addition to buying new closets and doors.

Dunia is very excited for this loan because she will be able to make her salon comfortable and attractive, which will pamper her customers in a very special way.

loans.use: to make necessary maintenance and add decorations to her salon.

loans.name: Kangombe's Group

texts.en: Kang'ombe is a sixty-five year old widow, having lost two husbands. She takes on jobs, such as working on other people's farms and burning charcoal, to earn money for her family -- however, farming is seasonal work. Kang'ombe is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program, so that she can build her dream house with the profits from her tree farm.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Baraka Group

texts.en:
Baraka Group has 18 farmers and is located in Webuye District. The group is represented by John, pictured on the right of Baraka Group with his hand raised. There are 6 men and 12 women in the group. John will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and sweet potato. John joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. He joined One Acre Fund so that he could grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send his children to school.

John described his harvest as very good last year, but he believes he can have an even better one this year.
