He plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and, perhaps, save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre's worth of agricultural inputs on credit. Baraka Group will receive 9 acres' worth of inputs, on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 44 years old. She lives in Samtredia District with her husband, retired father-in-law, and son, who is going to school. Tamar requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Tamar is a teacher. She teaches math at the local school and also has private students. Her husband is working at the railway station, and they both get small monthly salaries.
 
Recently, Tamar requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Credo approved her loan request, in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions, to rural poor people who do not have access to other credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit, Tamar will start trading in second-hand clothing. She will buy at the wholesale prices and resell with price mark-ups, among her fellow villagers. Tamar hopes that this business will be profitable, and that she will be able to use part of the profit for reinvesting in the business and another part for providing better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To start trading in second-hand clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sandals and different shoes for women and men

loans.name: Ann. Maa Bhuyani Self Help Group

texts.en:
Ann. Maa Bhuyani Self Help Group is a group consisting of 14 members, all of whom are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. A few years back, they all were facing the same kind of situation of poverty, so they planned to start a grocery shop where they can provide the basic household consumables to their customers. 

One of them is Mrs. Kamala, who was selected as their president. Kamala is a 40-year-old lady living with her husband and her two children, who are schooling. The lady in the navy blue saree standing fourth from the left-hand side is Kamala. 

Kamala’s husband works as a labourer in a factory situated near to her village. Kamala runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. 

Kamala has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers, for which she has requested a loan to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables.

loans.use: to purchase rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Mealii

texts.en:
Mealii lives Changamwe area of Coast province. She is married and has five children, of whom four attend school. She owns a medical clinic, a business she has been operating for ten years now.

She learned about Milango through a friend, who invited her to the group. She joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenge she is facing is the effect of the high cost of living on the service.

Mealii is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to buy medical supplies, like drugs, syringes, and so on. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings and used to pay school fees for her children. Her future plan is to open a referral hospital.

loans.use: To buy medical supplies, like drugs and syringes

loans.name: Sitha's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, Sitha is a 23-year-old mother of two children. The main sources of her family’s income are from rice farming on two-hectares of farmland and duck-raising, which she has been doing for five years. With her current business, she can earn about KHR 50,000 per day to spend for daily expenses. 

This is the seventh loan for Sitha with VisionFund Cambodia while the other member has been with VisionFund Cambodia for one cycle. Now Sitha is leading her group to apply for a loan of KHR 1,100,000 each. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy more ducks to raise. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland and ducks to raise.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is a 46 year old married woman. She has 3 children whose ages range from 14 to 23 years. She describes herself to be an optimistic and humble woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a local residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of clothes. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy clothes to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM after taking a loan of Kes 30,000 which she managed to pay successfully. In addition, Stella works as a school teacher which adds to her income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Getty Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of 3 partners, Getrude, Christiana and Mabel. They have been working together since 2012. They reside in the Dansoman community in Ghana. They trade in slippers, second hand clothes and herbal medicine.

Getrude is a 36 years old and married to Robert, a 44 year old business man. They are blessed with 2 children. She has been with ID Ghana for the past year and doing very well in her business.

She has been operating this business for 6 years. She is grateful to ID Ghana for the financial training she has received which has motivated her to save money in order to achieve her dream. 

This is her 2nd loan and she is requesting GHS 350 to buy more slippers to sell to her customers.  

The group needs a total amount of GHS 1,000 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more slippers to sell.

loans.name: Neema Group

texts.en:
Timothy’s group has 15 farmer members and is located in the Webuye District of Kenya. Timothy is pictured on the right of Neema Group with his hand raised. Timothy is pictured amongst the 2 men and 13 women of his group. He will receive loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and sweet potatoes. Timothy joined the One Acre Fund during the Long Rains of 2010, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Timothy joined the One Acre Fund so that he could grow enough food for his family and use the increased profits to send his children to school.

Timothy described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He plans on using the future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and repair his home. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Timothy’s group will receive 7.5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Margaritha

texts.en:
Margaritha, a 24 year old woman is married to Yan, who is 36 years old. They are blessed with 2 children: Dimar, 8, is in the 3rd grade of elementary school, and Gio is 6 months old.

Margaritha is running a food stall business. It is close to the bus station so her business is always crowded with customers. 

Margaritha intends to improve her business by adding different menu items. She has requested a loan of IDR 4,000,000 from TLM. She has planned to buy more rice, meat, vegetables, chicken etc. Margaritha hopes that TLM is willing to assist her in improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, meat, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Soery's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province in Cambodia, Soery is 55 years old and married.

She and her husband have one son. She and her husband earn a living through rice farming and also through working for others for a fee and they have been in this business for 10 years. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 14,000KHR per day to support her family.
 
This is the fifth loan for Soery with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has successfully paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family with enough food. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan of 1,000,000KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on the labor costs in plowing her field. She hopes to increase her crop yield and sell it for a good price so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Ing's Group

texts.en:
Ing, originally from Kror Kor district of Pursat province, is a widow and mother of five children. Currently, only two children are still under her dependency -- one of them is still in school and the other is too young for schooling. 

To deal with daily cost of living, Ing grows rice as the main source of her family’s income. She supplements her income via dessert-selling and a pig-raising business. With 16 years' involvement in the current business, she is able to earn up to KHR 19,900 per day.  

Including this cycle, she is a third-time borrower with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loans wisely to upgrade her living, especially so she can buy a decent motorbike to support her living, as well as her business. 

Now, Ing forms a group of two to apply for a new loan with VisionFund Cambodia. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to pay for plowing fees for her farmland. She greatly hopes that she can gain more yield and gain more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees for her farmland.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana, surge la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo ya que requiere comprar más mercadería para la tienda. Este le permitirá invertir en la adquisición de productos de la canasta básica, como lo son frijoles, arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón entre otros.
Con el crédito anterior logro incrementar las utilidades e invirtió el dinero  en la compra de medicina para su compañero de vida, porque se encuentra enfermo. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado y ha fortalecido el inventario de su mercadería.
texts.en:
Mariana has decided to take a new loan, since she needs more merchandise for her store.  This will allow her to invest in grocery items such as beans, rice, sugar, oil, soap and other goods.

With her previous loan she was able to increase her profits, and she invested this money in medicine for her common-law husband, who is ill.  Her financial situation has improved, and she has re-stocked her store with merchandise.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, oil, soap and other items.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe DANAYA sont essentiellement des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42  ans,  3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur quinzième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
IVONE, au bout de la photo à droite,  fait la teinture à dans ce groupe de femmes DANAYA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt des pagnes bazins, des colorants, des fils et de la soude caustique. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville.
Elle revend ses bazins teintés sur commande et fait ses prestations à domicile (Hamdallaye) un des quartiers populaires de la ville  de Sikasso. Sa clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the group DANAYA are essentially married women who average 42 years of age and three children each living for the most part in polygamous families in HAMDALLAYE, a working-class district in Sikasso City. 

The women are on their 15th loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy customer need. The previous loans were correctly paid back. 

IVONE, at the far right in the photo, is the one who dyes cloth in this group. She intends to use her loan to purchase lengths of damask cloth, dyes, thread, and caustic soda. She gets her supplies from the big market in Sikasso City. 

She resells her dyed damasks by special order and provides such services at her home (Hamdallaye, a working-class district in Sikasso City). Her customer base is composed of men and women. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used to repay the loan with interest, and the other part is for savings.

loans.use: to purchase damask cloth, dyes, thread, and caustic soda

loans.name: Inyokha Group

texts.en:
Eunice is a member of the Inyokha Group in the Webuye District. She is pictured with 15 One Acre Fund farmers: 13 women and 2 men. Eunice is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for a ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Eunice joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012 and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Eunice joined One Acre Fund so that she could gain access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer and the best input prices.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Eunice was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize per acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 18 bags per acre. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and repair her home. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Eunice’s group will receive 7.5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana earns a living through her food-vending business selling home-cooked snack foods to the people in her town. Susana is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients like flour, butter, sugar, cooking oil, milk and other items. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more to the people in her town, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients like flour, butter, sugar, cooking oil, milk and other items

loans.name: Akiba Group

texts.en:
Everline is pictured on the right with her hand raised amongst her Akiba Group members. The 19 of them, 11 women and 8 men, are farmers in Webuye District. 

Farming inputs, consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum, will be delivered to Everline on credit. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Everline’s first season with One Acre Fund. She joined this year in order to rest assured of reliable input delivery and to be able to grow enough food for the family. 

Everline thought her harvest last year was poor. She hopes that, as a One Acre Fund farmer, she can have an excellent harvest. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and perhaps buy a cow. 

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Everline’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 9.5 acres of land.

The field officer is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Rida

texts.en: Rida, a 24-year-old married father of one, lives in Gaza where he has owned  a fruit and vegetables food stall since 2011. Rida has requested this youth loan from Ryada to buy a small automobile to reduce his transportation costs, allowing him to save more of his income.

loans.use: to buy a small automobile.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shop goods (notebooks, Nido, salt,...) to resell, so as to earn a living

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy ingredients for her husband's food-selling business

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
Anita como es conocida muy popularmente en el municipio de El Sauce por su carisma y buen corazón, es casada, madre de dos hijas, tiene más de veinte de años de dedicarse a la labor de maestra, la que le ha permitido educar de la mejor manera a sus dos hijas de las cuales una de ellas está estudiando una carrera universitaria y la otra está por culminar la educación secundaria.

Como madre responsable ha tratado de dar lo mejor a ellas para que se preparen profesionalmente y sean mujeres de bien que se defiendan en la vida cuando sus padres les falten.

Por tal motivo está solicitando un crédito a los inversionistas de Kiva para pagar la universidad de su hija en lo que se refiere a aranceles y material didáctico, con el fin de que esto no sea un obstáculo para logre culminar su profesión.

Agradece a estas personas de buen corazón que apoyan a miles de personas sobre todo de escasos recursos a que cumplan sueños que no se puede llevar a cabo con los bajos salarios que se ganan en Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Anita is well-known in the El Sauce municipality for her charisma and her good heart.  She is married, and she has two daughters.

She has been a teacher for over 20 years.  This has allowed her to educate her daughters in the best way.  One of them is studying for a university degree.  The other is about to complete her high school education.

As a responsible mother, she has tried to give them the best in order for them to prepare professionally and so that they become good women who can get by in life when their parents are not there.

That is the reason she is requesting a loan from the Kiva lenders.  She wants the loan to be able to pay for her daughter’s university expenses.  She wants the loan to pay for fees and instructional materials so that these are not obstacles to her daughter getting her degree.

She is grateful to those with  good hearts who support thousands of people, especially those with scarce resources, to fulfill their dreams.  They are not able to do so with the low salaries they earn in Nicaragua.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various goods (packs of water, tomatoes, salt,...) to resell, so as to earn his living

loans.name: Jasho Group

texts.en:
Jasho is a group of 16 farmers in Webuye District, represented by Felisters. The group has 14 women and 2 men. Felisters is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum. Felisters first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, and to grow enough food for the family.

Felisters reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about two bags of maize per ½ acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested nine bags per 1/2 acre. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and to save for the future. Jasho Group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for 8 acres of sweet potato, millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe SOUTOURA sont essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33  ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les  familles polygamiques à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
MARIAM, au bout de la photo à droite,  vend de la friperie à dans ce groupe de femmes SOUTOURA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  une balle de friperie. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville.
Elle les revend de façon ambulante et à domicile (Hamdallaye) un des quartiers populaires de la ville  de Sikasso. Sa clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The six members of the group SOUTOURA are essentially married women who average 33 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in HAMDALLAYE, a working-class district of Sikasso City. 

The women are on their sixth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to the needs of their customers. The previous loans were correctly paid back.

MARIAM, at the far right in the photo, sells secondhand clothing in this group of women.  She intends to use her loan to purchase a bale of secondhand clothing. She gets her supplies from the big market of Sikasso City.

She resells the merchandise by going door to door and at her home (Hamdallaye, a working-class district in Sikasso City). Her customer base is composed of men and women.  

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used to repay the loan with interest, and the other part is for her savings.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Toch's Group

texts.en:
Toch is 33 years old and married. She has been blessed with five children, who currently are studying at the local state school in the area. She manages one hectare each of cassava and rice cultivation. She has been in this business for 15 years, and she earns about 23,600 KHR per day.

Toch has been with VisionFund for five previous loan cycles and has completely repaid her past loans with success. The loans have provided her sufficient decent daily food for her kids and improved her living conditions, at a good pace. Now Toch is in a group of two, to apply for a new loan. She and her co-borrower are seeking the amount of 1,400,000 KHR, each. As group leader, Toch will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay the plowing fee for preparing her farmland. She has high hopes that she can increase her crop yield and sell her cassava and rice at high prices, to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay the plowing fee for preparing her farmland

loans.name: Hat's Group

texts.en:
Hat, a 53-year-old married mother of four, lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. The family’s main source of income is rice farming, which she has been engaged in for 10 years. Low crop yield is still a main challenge for her family’s business.

Hat has been with VisionFund for two loans, both since repaid and both very important in improving her likelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000KHR each. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully so as to expand her rice paddy.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Sophat, 52 years old and married, is a local resident from Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. She has four children, one of whom is still in school and counts on her. 

To strive for a living, she does rice cultivation, with support from her husband. To better feed the family, her husband also works for others for a fee, during his spare time. Engaging in the current business for ages, Sophat is able to earn up to KHR 25,000 per day. 

Sophat’s prior loan was her original loan with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She managed to gain a good yield from her crop, due to the prompt loan, which she has fully repaid. 

Now, Sophat is seeking a new loan to buy a small computer for her son. She hopes that she can supply the study materials for her child in order to boost his knowledge.

loans.use: to buy a small computer for her son.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo crédito, por la  necesidad de invertir más en la agricultura, en el maiz y pipián. Esta inversión le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, herbicidas.
Con el préstamo anterior logro obtener mejores ingresos y cubrir los gastos del hogar. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado, ya que tuvo un incremento en la productividad.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan because he needs to invest more in his corn and pumpkin crops.  This investment will allow him to buy agricultural supplies, pesticides, insecticides, and herbicides.

With the last loan he managed to get better income and to cover the household expenses.  His financial condition has improved because he had an increase in productivity.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, pesticides, insecticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36  ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les  familles polygamiques à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieures ont été correctement remboursés.
KANDIA, en complet bleu sur la photo, fait le commerce de bazins teintés à dans ce groupe de femmes KOTOGNOGONTALA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt des pagnes de bazins qu’elle fait teinter. Elle s’approvisionne dans au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso et souvent à Bamako la capitale du Mali.
Elle revend teintés sur place à domicile au quartier d’Hamdalaye de Sikasso et souvent sur commande à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’homme au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the group KOTOGNOGONTALA are married women who average 36 years of age and five children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in HAMDALLAYE, a working-class district of Sikasso City. 

The women are on their 8th loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers. The previous loans were correctly paid back.

KANDIA, wearing blue in the photo, does commerce in dyed damask fabrics in this group of women. She intends to use her loan to purchase lengths of damask, which she dyes. She gets her supplies from the big market of Sikasso City and often in Bamako, the capital of Mali.

She resells the dyed fabrics locally at her home in the Hamdalaye district in Sikasso and often by special order. Her customer base is composed of men and women paying cash.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used to repay the loan with interest, and the other part is for her savings.

loans.use: to purchase damask cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and gas.

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
SEGUNDO tiene 52 años de edad es soltero tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos y con unos familiares. 

Pertenece a la VRC SAN JUAN BAUTISTA se encuentra formada y creada en la ciudad de Tambanal a una distancia de 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperatva, La actividad económica es la agricultura, crianza de animales.

SEGUNDO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol,además se dedica a la crianza de ganado, pollos y cerdos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar el ganado. La compra la realizará en Chillanes.

El sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el mal clima.

En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar de las fiestas de la comunidad y del carnaval.
texts.en:
Segundo is 52 years old.  He is single, and he lives with his three children and some other relatives.

He is a member of the community bank San Juan Bautista, which is in the city of Tambanal, which is 40 minutes away from the cooperative farm where he works growing plants and raising animals. He grows corn and beans, and he also raises cows, pigs and chickens.

He is seeking this loan so that he can buy a cow.  He will make the purchase in Chillanes.

His dream is to improve his standard of living.He faces challenges such as bad weather. In his free time he likes to enjoy community festivals and carnivals.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fence in her house.

loans.name: Narin's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village in the Dambae district of Cambodia, Narin is 44 years old and married with two children. She and her husband are hard-working farmers who make a living by growing rice. In this business for 10 years, they can earn about 20,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Narin has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three loan cycles, and all loans have been repaid. They have helped her family’s business significantly. Now leading her group to request a loan of 1,000,000KHR each, Narin, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Reyna Lizzette

texts.es:
Reina,  requiere de un nuevo crédito, por que se encuentra sin ingresos y necesita dinero. Este lo invertirá en la compra de pantalones, blusas, vestidos y ropa interior para su negocio, espera con esta inversion darle estabilidad al negocio.
El préstamo anterior le genero ganancias, porque del mismo negocio cancelo dicho préstamo. Las circunstancias familiares han mejorado un poco y su comercio se mantiene en el mercado, agradece de ante mano le concedan  el crédito porque lo necesita.
texts.en:
Reyna needs a new loan, since she is currently without income and needs to make money.  She will in invest the funds in pants, blouses, dresses and underwear for her business. She hopes that this investment will bring stability to the business.

With her previous loan she was able to make profits with this same business.  Her family circumstances have improved a little, and she has been able to maintain her business, since she was able to get the credit that she needed.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, dresses and underwear.

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa,  solicita un nuevo crédito porque necesita  incrementar en su negocio y por la buena atención que la institucion le brinda. Le ayudara para la compra de tomates, zanahorias, manzanas, uvas y otros productos más. 
El crédito anterior le permitió fortalecer el negocio y con las ganancias a podido aportar para su familia. Su negocio esta creciendo cada dia y además necesita para apoyar a si hija en todo lo que pueda.
texts.en:
Rosa is seeking a new loan because she needs to grow her business.  She also appreciates the good service that she receives from this institution.  This loan will help her to buy tomatoes, carrots, apples, grapes and other products.

Her previous loan enabled her to restock her business, and with her profits she has been able to support her family.  Her business is growing every day, and she needs to support her daughter in every way she can.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, carrots, apples, grapes and other products.

loans.name: Heab

texts.en:
A local villager from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Heab is a married, 29-year-old mother of one schoolboy.  To support her living, she is involved in farming cassava and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. She has been involved in the current business for four years and it earns her about 26,500 KHR per day.

Heab, the first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and is seeking a loan for 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer for her cassava. She hopes to increase her income so that she can build a new home for her child.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad y deseo de seguir fortaleciendo el negocio y también por la atención que le brinda la empresa en sus deficiencias económicas. Este le permitirá comprar gaseosas, jugos, yogurt entre otros, todo lo relacionado a la bebida. 
Con el crédito anterior obtuvo buenos ingresos y le fue de mucha ayuda ya que le aporto a su hija en los estudios.
texts.en:
Sofia is seeking a new loan since she wants and needs to keep strengthening her business.  She also appreciates the support that this institution provides her business when she is in need of financial help.  

This loan will enable her to buy sodas, juices, yogurt and other items related to the sale of drinks.  With her previous loan she was able to obtain good income, and this was very helpful since it allowed her to support her granddaughter in her studies.

loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, yogurt and other items.

loans.name: Atubokina Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is a member of Atubokina Group in Teso District. She is pictured with 24 One Acre Fund farmers,14 women and 10 men. Rosemary is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Rosemary first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Rosemary joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

Rosemary described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to repair her home and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Rosemary’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 12 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en:
Sophorn is 41-years-old and married. She lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province and has two children. To make a living, she has been in rice farming for several years earning about 17,000 KHR per day. 

Sophorn’s group consists of two members who are all female and she has been with VisionFund for four cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She has used the past loans successfully to support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Wilian Wilfrido

texts.es:
WILIAN tiene 22 años de edad es soltero no tiemne hijos, vive con los padres en el cantón Chillanes, provincia de Bolívar, Comunidad Tambanal.

Pertenece a la VRC SAN JUAN BAUTISTA se encuentra formada y creada en la ciudad de Tambanal a una distancia de 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperatva, La actividad económica es la agricultura, crianza de animales.

 WILIAN se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol,además se dedica a la crianza de ganado. Solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado, vacuna y alimentación. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar el ganado. La compra la realizará en Chillanes.

El sueño es terminar los estudios y trabajar por cuenta propia no depender de los padres. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la baja de producción por efectos naturales.

En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boli y el futbool.
texts.en:
Wilian is 22 years old.  He is single and has no children.  He lives with his parents in the Chillanes district, in the Bolívar province of the Tambanal community.

Wilian belongs to the "San Juan Bautista" communal bank which was created in the city of Tambanal - 40 minutes away from the cooperative office.  The communal bank works in the fields of agriculture and raising animals.

Wilian makes a living in agriculture, growing corn and beans, and also by raising cattle.  He is applying for a loan to buy cattle, vaccinations and feed.  With the help of this loan he will be able to buy the cattle in Chillanes.

Wilian's dream is to finish his studies and work independently so that he does not have to rely on his parents.  One challenge that he faces include low production due to environmental factors.

In his spare time Wilian likes to play volleyball and football.

loans.use: to buy cattle, vaccinations and feed.

loans.name: Jose Job

texts.es:
Don José tiene 51 años de edad,  es casado, tiene 6 hijos, vive en una aldea del Municipio de la Flecha, Santa Barbará
Don José desde hace 30 años se dedica a realizar trabajos de agricultura, cultiva café, maíz, frijoles y algunas hortalizas. Don José manifiesta que de esta actividad a podido mantener a  su familia dándoles todo lo necesario a sus hijos. Estos productos los comercializa en el mercado local y los vende a buen precio.
El esta solicitando un préstamo de 15,000 lempiras para invertir dándole mantenimiento a los cultivos, comprara abano y fertilizantes. Esto le ayudara a que sus cultivos tengan mayor asistencia y lograr una mejor producción.
La meta de el es seguir trabajando en su finca y tener siempre los ingresos para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 51 years old. He is married and has six children. He lives in a village in the municipality of Flecha, in Santa Barbará. For 30 years José has been working in agriculture - he grows coffee, corn, beans and some vegetables. José says that with this work he has been able to support his family and provide everything that his children need. He sells the products for a good price at the local market. José is applying for a loan of 15,000 Lempira to invest in maintaining his crops. He will buy manure and fertiliser. This will help him to give his crops more attention and he will have a higher crop yield. José's goal is to continue working on his land and always to have an income to support his family.
.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and manure to maintain the crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corncobs, flour, chicken, oil, firewood and leaves.

loans.name: Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Marie is 30 years old. She is married, with three children aged between seven months and seven years. 

Marie is a group leader of 'Twitezimbere Group' which means “let us develop” in English. She owns a general store for which she has been running for eight years. She wants to buy more salt, cooking oil, and rice to sell. With the profits from the business, Marie would like to provide food for the family. 

In the photo, Marie holds a blue book to be identified from the others.

loans.use: to buy more salt, cooking oil, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Sithorn

texts.en:
Sithorn is 37 years old and a single lady, from Kampong Cham province. She earns a living via rice cultivation and tailoring clothes. These are the businesses that she has been with for 18 years.

Sithorn has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one previous loan cycle. She has repaid her past loan. She used it wisely to manage her tailoring business, making good progress. She was able to buy a mini tailoring machine, which makes her work go faster and increases her productivity. Now she is applying for a new loan to buy fabric, to support her tailoring business. She hopes that she can increase her income even more, and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fabric to support her tailoring business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en: Age 50 and a citizen from Sangke district of Battambang province, Oun is married and has four children—two are schoolchildren and two are paid-workers. For her family’s sake, she grows rice on a hectare of farmland and her husband helps to supplement the family’s income from working for others for a fee. This is a business that she has been engaged in for 25 years. Including this new loan, she is in the fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After the successful past loan which she has completely repaid, Oun feels confident that that she can stabilize her living condition. Now, she is in a group of two to apply for a new loan. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can gain more yield and make more income, so that she can buy a water pump for her rice

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more second hand clothing to sell to their customers

loans.name: Altanchimeg

texts.en: Mrs.Altanchimeg is 35-years-old and lives with her husband and 3 daughters in an apartment in Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband Hurelbaatar, age 38, works at a local company as driver. Her daughters Nomin, age 14, Michid, age 12 and Margad, age 5 go to the local school and kindergarten. The borrower has been working as a hairdresser since 2001. She is now planning to start her own barbershop in a rental place and is requesting 3,500,000 MNT to purchase seats and other necessary equipment. She is hardworking, friendly and a strong woman.

loans.use: to purchase seats and other necessary equipment for her business

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 21-years-old from Gaza. He is a carpenter and has three years experience working as an employee in carpentry. He asked Ryada for a  start-up loan in order to start-up his own carpentry business and to buy tools, such as a cutting machine for his new projects. He hopes that this loan will help him start his own business and provide him with a sustainable income.

Ryada's Startup Loan is exclusively for borrowers who are beginning new enterprises, not for existing projects. To qualify, a borrower must show a clear business plan and realistic potential for success. The borrower must also invest their own money and resources into at least 50 percent of the startup enterprise. Ryada believes strongly in the potential of these borrowers and grants them a three month grace period to help them get their business off the ground.

loans.use: to start up his own carpentry business and to buy tools, such as a cutting machine for his new projects

loans.name: Amgalanbayar

texts.en:
Amgalanbayar is a 50-year-old widow who lives with her two children in an apartment in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her daughter, Monhmandah, age 24, works at a local company and her son, Byambatsogt, age 21, studies at the university. 

Amgalanbayar has been running a tailoring service business since 2000. She has gained lot of experience and regular customers over the years. 

She is now requesting loan of MNT 1,200,000 to pay her son's next fall semester tuition fee. She is a hard-working, responsible, and friendly woman.

loans.use: to pay her son's next fall semester tuition fee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a fence.

loans.name: Jesus Gerardo

texts.es:
JESUS tiene 32 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijo, vive con los padres en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar Comunidad Tambanal.

Pertenece a la VRC SAN JUAN BAUTISTA se encuentra formada y creada en la ciudad de Tambanal a una distancia de 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperatva, La actividad económica es la agricultura, crianza de animales.

JESUS se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol,además se dedica a la crianza de ganado.
Solicita el crédito para comprar ganado, vacuna y alimentación. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar el ganado. La compra la realizará en Chillanes.

El sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida y tener buena producción. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son los fenomenos naturales afectados al desarrollo de las plagas y su producción.

En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar de las fiestas de la comunidad y del carnaval.
texts.en:
Jesus is a 32-year-old single man who has no children.  He lives with his parents in the city of Tambanal in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar.

He is a member of the community bank San Juan Bautista, which is in the city of Tambanal, which is 40 minutes away from the cooperative farm where he works growing plants and raising animals. He grows corn and beans, and he also raises cows, pigs and chickens.

He is seeking this loan so that he can buy a cow as well as animal feed. He will make the purchases in Chillanes.

His dream is to improve his standard of living and to increase his production. He faces challenges such as the natural phenomena including crop disease than can affect his harvests.

In his free time he likes to enjoy community festivals and carnivals.

loans.use: to buy cows and animal feed.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe DANAYA sont  essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33  ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les  familles monogamiques à OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieures ont été bien dénoués.
SALIMATA  2ème à gauche sur la photo fait le commerce de pagnes wax à dans ce groupe de femmes DANAYA, sa renommée en la matière fait d’elle une vendeuse très sollicitée. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  17 pièces de pagnes wax. Elle les revend de façon ambulante et en famille au comptant et à crédit à sa clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et souvent au grand marché de Sikasso ville.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The six members of the Danaya group are married women aged on average 33, with an average of three children. Most of them live in monogamous families in Ouayerma, one of the popular areas in the city of Sikasso.
They are on their sixth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy their customers' needs. Their previous loans have been repaid in full.
Salimata, second from the left in the photo, does business selling pagnes (colorful wax cloth). Among the Danaya women's group, her reputation in her area makes her a frequently asked for salesperson.
She plans to buy 17 pagnes with her loan. She resells them as a traveling salesperson and at home, for cash and credit, to a clientele made up for men and women. She stocks up in Bamako and often at the big market in the city of Sikasso.
She envisions making a monthly profit of 37,500XOF, a part of which will be used to pay back the loan and its interest and the other part of which will be put into savings.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (colorful wax cloth)

loans.name: King M.

texts.en:
King M. is 40 years old and lives in Logan Town, one of the early communites in Liberia that are well-known. He is married and has four children between the ages of 7 and 13. They are presently in school and live at home. King M. is a high school graduate, and for the past 16 years he has been running a medicine store, where he sells items like quinine, paracetamol, cough syrup and blood tonic. He started this business at the time he worked at a hospital, with the little money that he earned from the hospital. He managed to established his business with little money, and he learned the ways of selling from his friends. He is very happy with his business, because he makes a lot of profit and it keeps him busy. Most interestingly, he has learned some different local languages.

King M. is requesting a loan to buy more inventory items, like quinine, paracetamol, cough syrup and blood tonic, to expand his business. His plans are to expand his business and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more pharmacy items, like quinine, paracetamol, cough syrup and blood tonic, to expand his business.

loans.name: Fatuma's Group

texts.en:
Fatuma's group is comprised of 3 hard working women. Fatuma is 20-years-old and lives in the town of Birungi in the region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 2 years, Fatuma has been working hard to manage her salon, which does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Fatuma has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair products, dryers and extensions for the salon, and will help Fatuma to generate greater profits and provide her family with basic needs. Fatuma hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Fatuma is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more hair products, dryers and extensions for the salon

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Constitué exclusivement de 4 femmes mariées, les membres de groupe BALIMAYA vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce : vente de beignets et de condiments.
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégrés  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame SIGA (1ère  à gauche sur la photo) est la vendeuse de condiments du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une importante quantité de  condiments (ail, poivre, concentrée de tomate et du sel de cuisine).
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Madame SIGA compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 21.750 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son mari dans  certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Made up exclusively of four married women, the Balimaya group lives mostly in traditional families with an average age of 44 years and an average of 4 children. They all live in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali) and met each other through family ties, marriage, and their neighborhood. 
The members of the group run small businesses selling beignets and seasonings.
With the goal of increasing their business, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle. Madame Siga (first on the left in the photo) is the seasoning seller in the group. She counts on using her loan to buy a large quantity of seasonings (garlic, pepper, tomato paste, and cooking salt).
She stocks up from wholesalers and sells retail, for cash and credit, at home and in the market, to a clientele of men and women.
Madame Siga counts on making a monthly profit of 21,750XOF with this loan, which will be used to reinvest in her business and to help her husband with some of the family's spending.

loans.use: to buy seasonings

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 44 years old. He lives in Vani District with his 33-year-old wife and two children, who are going to school. The family is living in a special area, populated by persecuted people. Robert requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
 
The main source of income for the family is their agricultural activities. They own a plot of land, where maize is grown. They also have beehives, with bee colonies, and gather honey. The harvested maize and the honey are sold locally at the markets, so Robert can get a small monthly income with which to feed his family.

Recently, Robert requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Credo approved his loan request, in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credit with soft conditions, to rural poor people who do not have access to other credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit, Robert will purchase a truck, with which he will start trading in potatoes. He will buy potatoes at the wholesale price, bring them to the capital city, and sell them with the price markup. Robert will use the profit for reinvesting in the same business. This will significantly increase the family income, and they will be able to have better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a truck with which to begin a new business line, trading in potatoes

loans.name: Boris

texts.en:
Boris is 55-years-old and lives in Lchashen village in the Gegharkunik area with his wife. His children are married and live separately from their parents. Boris is a cook and for many years has worked in some catering facility. In 1998 he launched his own business. He provides services for funeral rituals and different ceremonies. He has rented a building where he performs his activities. He is pleased, as this brings him more income. He is also engaged in animal-husbandry. Boris’s wife helps him with the animal breeding.   

Now Boris is requesting a loan to add to the number of chairs and tables, and do some repair work to his building. Boris says that since 1998 the building has never been repaired and in order to increase the number of clients and special orders he must do some repair work. Now he wants to replace his chairs and tables, and create more comfortable and modern conditions for his clients.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables and do some repair work in his restaurant

loans.name: Vagharsh

texts.en:
Vagharsh is 24-years-old and lives in Sevan city. He is a future promising lawyer. He works in one of the Armenian party's regional office in Sevan city as an organizer and at the same time studies in Gavar State University in faculty of Law. He likes his profession very much and dreams in the future of  becoming a successful lawyer.

Vagharsh lives with his mother and brother. His brother works as a letter sorter at an Armenian organization; and his mother is a nurse at a mental hospital. They both work very hard in order to improve their family's living standard. With the loan from Kiva Vagharsh will pay his tuition fees for this semester.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for this semester

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with six children and none of them attend school. She does not look after any other family members.

She has been selling second-hand clothes door-to-door for three years. She works six days a week. She does not have any other source of income.  

She has requested a loan of USHS 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy more second-hand clothes to sell. Her business challenges include seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of used clothes in Uganda. Her dream is to get a place where she can sell from instead of moving from place to place and also to start importing used clothes.  She joined MCDT because the organization welcomes people with a small or no business and without demanding for collateral.  She rents a house without access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Burmakan

texts.ru: Бурмакан 45 лет,вдова. Бурмакан имеет среднее образование, по характеру очень спокойная и хозяйственная женщина. Бурмакан в качестве основного дохода для ее семьи, с 2001 года занимается животноводством и  полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 50,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бурмакан, на сегодняшний день у нее имеется 2 голов КРС, 8 голов МРС. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 7,000 сом.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурмакан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на закуп скота. Доходы от кредита Бурмакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса посредством увеличения хозяйства, а на следующий год сделать ремонт и женить сына.
texts.en:
Burmakan is a 45-year-old widow. Burmakan has a high school education, but by nature she is a very quiet and economical woman. 

As a main source of income for her family, Burmakan since 2001 has been engaged in raising animals and crops, starting with a sum of 50,000 KGS. Through hard work, Burmakan today has two heads of cattle and eight heads of sheep. Her monthly income is about 7,000 som. In order to further expand her business, Burmakan turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 65,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock. 

Burmakan plans to invest income from the loan to further increase her business by expanding her farm, and the following year to make repairs and to marry off her son.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана живет и работает в Мелитополе. Она зарабатывает на жизнь тем, что реализует сезонную женскую обувь, а также сумки и головные уборы на местном рынке. Свое торговое место она арендует, работая в этой сфере вот уже 6 лет. 
Сумма в размере 15 000 гривен нужна Светлане для того, чтобы закупить сезонную женскую обувь. Имея большой опыт работы в этой сфере торговли, Светлана сталкивалась со спадами покупательской способности, кризисом и колебаниями курса валют, но она справилась и смогла сохранить бизнес, продолжая постепенно его развивать.
texts.en:
Svetlana lives and works in Melitopol. She earns a living by selling seasonal women's shoes, as well as bags and hats in the local market. She rents her retail space and has been working in this sphere for six years.

An amount of 15,000 hryvnia is needed by Svetlana to buy seasonal women's shoes. Having great experience in this sphere of trade, Svetlana confronted the recession in purchasing power, a crisis, and currency fluctuations, but she coped and was able to keep the business, while continuing to develop it gradually.

loans.use: to buy seasonal women's shoes

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de 7 femmes toutes mariées, les membres de groupe Danaya vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce, d’encens, de bois, gingembre et de pagnes wax-bazins. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégrés  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 11ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame AMINATA (3ème à gauche sur la photo, rang de derrière) est la vendeuse de wax et bazins du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 4pièces de pagnes wax et 2 pièces de pagnes bazins. 
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Madame AMINATA compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son mari dans  certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Made up of seven married women, the members of the Danaya group live mostly in traditional families and are on average forty years old and have three children. They all live in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali) and met through family ties, marriage, and their neighborhood.
The members of the group have small businesses, selling incense, wood, ginger, and pagnes (wax and brocade cloth).
With the goal of growing their businesses, the members of the group joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their eleventh group loan cycle.
Madame Aminata (third from the left in the photo, back row) is the pagne seller in the group. She counts on using her loan to buy four wax pagnes and two brocade pagnes.
She stocks up at the wholesaler's and sells retail, for cash and credit, at home and at the market, to a clientele made up of men and women. Madame Aminata counts on making an average monthly profit of 45,000XOF through the loan, which will be used to reinvest in her business and to help her husband with some of the family's spending.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (cloth in wax and brocade)

loans.name: Run's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Run is 39 years old and a widow with two kids. She tackles her family’s hardship via one hectare of rice growing, a half hectare of cassava planting, and working for others for a fee during her spare time. The current business returns Run about 15,200 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Run. She formed a group of three to apply for a new loan, and she is the group leader. Run will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava and to buy wooden boards to renovate her house. She hopes to gain more output from her crops and make more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava and to buy wooden boards to renovate her house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Battsetseg is 30-years-old and lives with her husband and son in an apartment in Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband Tserendorj works at a local market as a salesperson. Her son Togoldor goes to a local school. The borrower has been working as a sales person since 2005. She is now starting her own business of clothing retail in a rental counter of a local market. She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory from Beijing, China. She and her husband both have a lot of experience in the business.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory from Beijing, China

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en:
Lasha is 27 years old. He lives in Sachkhere district with his retired parents and brother. Several times, Lasha requested a loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. Each time, his loan request was rejected because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Lasha is an artisan working on private orders and his brother is a driver. They both earn small, monthly salaries. Additional income for the family is from his parents’ pension.

Lasha requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of low income. 

With the received credit, Lasha will purchase a stock of groceries. He has built a mall building and he renovated it himself. Now he wants to purchase all the needed equipment and groceries, so he can start his business.  

Lasha is a very hard-working man and he will try his best to make the shop successfully work. Profit will be used for reinvesting, to add more groceries. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of groceries and equipment for starting a grocery shop.

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Enhtsetseg is 45 years old and lives with her husband and a son in a ger in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Myagmardalai, helps his wife to run her clothes-selling business in a rented counter of the local market. His son, Enhdalai, age 21, is a junior student at the university. She started her clothes-selling business in 2011. She has been successful since. She is now requesting 1,400,000 MNT to pay her son's university tuition fee. She is a hardworking, honest and responsible woman.

loans.use: To pay her son's university tuition fee

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children, both of whom attend school. She is not looking after any additional family members.  She has been selling second-hand clothes from her home for ten years while working six days a week. She also sells medicine to earn extra income.

She has requested a loan of USHS 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to purchase more clothes to sell. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to grow her business to wholesale. She also wants to educate her two children up to a university level.  She joined MCDT because of their timely loans. She owns a home without access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad is 38 years old from Gaza. He is married and has 4 children. He has owned a grocery store since 2009. He has asked Ryada for a loan in order to buy a refrigerator and some goods for his store. He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and some goods for his store.

loans.name: Sendiya

texts.ru:
Сендия уже один раз обращалась за финансовой помощью к КИВА. Использовав предыдущий кредит по развитие бизнеса, она смогла увеличить свой доход и сменить свою торговую точку на более крупную новую. 
В этот раз Сендия надеется использовать кредит в размере 4 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести ещё одну морозильную витрину.  За счет расширения и дополнительной витрины Сендия сможет выложить больше товара и быстрее его реализовать, тем самым обеспечив более высокую ликвидность товара.
texts.en:
Sendiya has once already applied for financial assistance from Kiva. Using the previous loan for business development, she was able to increase her income and to change her retail location to a much bigger new one.

This time Sendiya hopes to use the loan of 4,000 hryvnia to buy another freezer showcase. By expanding to an additional showcase, Sendiya can stock more goods and implement it more quickly, thus providing more liquid goods.

loans.use: to purchase another freezer showcase

loans.name: Sunatullo

texts.ru: Сунатулло  молодой парень в возрасте 24, женат, детей пока нет. Он занимается куплей продажей скота. В этом деле ему помогает жена. Также он имеет небольшую мельницу, где перемалывает пшеницу жителей села за оплату. Основной доход у них в семье от откармливания скота и он хочет получить кредит в сумме  2000 сомони на 6 месяцев для покупки еще одного бычка для откорма.
texts.en: Sunatullo is a young man of 24, married, and does not yet have children. He is engaged in buying and selling livestock. In this work, he is helped by his wife. He also has a small mill, where he grinds wheat for other villagers at a cost. The main source of income for their family is from fattening cattle and he wants to receive a loan of 2,000 somoni for six months to buy another calf for fattening.

loans.use: to purchase one goby

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Madame Adama est une femme mariée de 31 ans et mère de 2 enfants. Elle vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
Après les études secondaires où elle obtient son diplôme en art  plastique, elle est restée très longtemps sans emploi. 
Afin de s’insérer dans le tissu économique, elle décide de s’intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente d’habillements, de tissus et de mèches qu’elle a appris auprès de sa sœur jumelle.
Avec une expérience de 11 ans, elle maîtrise cette activité dans laquelle elle est très sollicitée. Dans le souci de satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse,  elle décida d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter 10 pièces de pagnes et 30 paquets de mèches. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et à Bamako capitale de la république du Mali.
Ses marchandises sont vendues en espèce dans le quartier et en crédit à certains fonctionnaires de la place. Sa clientèle est composée pour la majorité des femmes.  Elle est à son quatrième avec Soro Yiriwaso et ses précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Avec ce prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA.
Elle envisage avec ce bénéfice agrandir son entreprise et à assurer certaines dépenses de la maison.
texts.en:
Madame Adama is a 31 year old married women and mother of two children. She lives with her husband and her children in the Torakabougou area of Bougouni.
After her secondary studies, when she received a diploma in art, she remained jobless for a long time.
In order to enter the local economy, she decided to take an interest in revenue generating activities such as sales, selling clothing, fabric, and hair extensions, a business that she learned alongside her twin sister.
With eleven years of experience, she has mastered this business in which she is well respected. In hopes of satisfying her growing customer base, she decided to join the loan program at Soro Yiriwaso in order to buy 10 pagnes (colorful wax cloth) and 30 packages of hair extensions. She stocks up in Lome and Bamako, the capital of Mali.
Her merchandise is sold for cash in the area and on credit to some government employees. Her clientele is made up mostly of women. She is on her fourth loan with Soro Yiriwaso and her previous loans have all been repaid in full. With this loan, she counts on make a monthly profit of 40,000XOF.
With the profits generated by this loan, she envisions growing her business and providing for some household expenses.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (colorful wax cloth) and hair extensions

loans.name: Phillies

texts.en:
Phillies is 20 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in Uganda. For the past two years, Phillies has been working hard to manage her business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Phillies has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes to sell, and will help Phillies to generate greater profits and provide her family with basic needs. Phillies hopes that in the future, she will be able to open up a retail shop. 

Phillies is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a 22-year-old single woman, who has been working as a hairdresser for the past six years. In 2008, she opened her own beauty salon to develop her business, and attract new customers.  Zahra was only 16-years-old when she started working, to help her parents in making their living.

She is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's Partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a tattoo machine with all the necessary inks and needles needed. This machine will improve her business a lot and it will surely increase her income.  Tattoos are highly requested among her customers, and she makes sure to respond to their needs as much as she can.

This is Zahra's fourth cycle as Al Majmoua borrower with a good standing payment history.

loans.use: to buy a tattoo machine with the necessary inks and needles needed

loans.name: Vrej

texts.en: Vrej is from Armavir region. Upon returning from two years of service in the army, Vrej at the age of 25, found a means to make a living by running a farm. He keeps livestock which currently includes 2 cows, 2 pigs and 17 little pigs and also grows apricot, cherry and plum trees. As the main bread winner of the family, Vrej would like to expand his farm. He has applied for this loan to purchase fertilizer, forage for feeding the livestock, and seeds for cultivation. This will allow him to gather more agricultural income and sustain his family. Additional money from the loan will be used to repair the tractor which is too old and is very important to Vrej in cultivating the land. Vrej lives with his parents and does his best to ensure better living conditions for them.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, forage for feeding the livestock, seeds for cultivation and the repair of a tractor

loans.name: Nyamgal

texts.en: Mr. Nyamgal is 41 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in Ger in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Bolormaa works at a local company. His daughter Buyanzaya, age 9, and son Buyandelger, age 7, both go to local primary school. Mr. Nyamgal has been running a traditional boot manufacturing business at home since 2009. He is requesting a loan of 550,000 MNT to purchase authentic leather from a manufacturer at a lower price. He is a hardworking, diligent and welcoming man.

loans.use: to purchase authentic leather from a manufacturer at a lower price.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 22-year-old married man and the father of one child. He has worked as an electrician for nine years, since he was only 13 years old, to help his parents make a living. In 2010, Ali started his own business to increase his income and improve his quality of life. Ali is a hard worker who puts much effort into attracting new customers. He is applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy a car that will better facilitate his business and widen his working zone. He hopes to keep on expanding his business to make sure that his family will have a better life.

loans.use: to buy a car for his electrician business.

loans.name: Sharaf

texts.ru: Шараф работает в службе скорой помощи старшей медицинской сестрой в течении 36 лет. Ее муж является пенсионером, они вместе с мужем живут более 30 лет. У них двое прекрасных детей. Один из сыновей собирается уезжать в Россию на заработки. Ее сын неженат и Шараф с мужем  хотят женить его в этом году. Сын также планирует заработать на свадьбу в Росии и в конце года провести свою свадьбу. Но Шараф не может оплатить полностью стоимость авиабилетов и для этого она обратилась за кредитом в Арванд.
texts.en:
Sharaf has been working in an ambulance service as head nurse for 36 years. Her husband is retired. They have been living together for more than 30 years. They have two beautiful children. 

One of their sons is leaving for Russia to find work. Her son is unmarried and Sharaf and her husband want to get him married this year. Her son is similarly planning to earn for his wedding in Russia and at the end of the year to hold his wedding. But Sharaf can not pay all the costs of air travel and for that she has applied for a loan from Arvand.

loans.use: to purchase an airline ticket

loans.name: Agim

texts.en:
Agim is 42 years old, married and has five children. He lives in a village in the southern part of Kosovo. His wife is a housewife, taking care of the house and children. 

Agim makes a living by raising cows and sheep, which is the main source of income for his family. In this way, he was able to reduce the cost of milk and milk products. He also sells cheese in his area and, as he said, he generates a lot of money from this business.

Agim now is in need of a loan in order to buy food and cereals (grains) for the cows and sheep. In this way, he can secure the food for a long period.  

Agim hopes to improve the conditions of life for his family. He hopes to expand his farm and save for his youngest child’s university expenses. He is aware that, without Kiva lenders, his goal will be difficult to achieve. 

Agim is very appreciative for the help!

loans.use: to buy food and cereals (grains) for his cows and sheep.

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik is a young farmer from Argina village. He keeps 4 pigs, 5 bulls and cultivates barley.  Arayik lives with his mother who helps her son with running a farm. For their family of two, agriculture is the only source of income, so it is very important for them to expand the farm.

Arayik has applied for this loan to purchase 2 bulls, fertilizer, watermelon seeds and fuel. The loan is very important for Arayik to be able to cultivate more fruits and vegetables, and to buy fuel in order to take the gathered harvest to the market. This will significantly increase his income and will give him an opportunity to improve his and his mother's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for 2 bulls, fertilizer, watermelon seeds and fuel

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more second hand clothing to sell to customers

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando tiene 48 años de edad, esta casado con Emilia con quien tiene 2 hijos , junto a ellos reside en una vivienda construida a base de adobe adquirida hace muchos años.Es propietario de un negocio consistente en la venta de comestibles.Inicialmente se desempeñaba en diversos trabajos eventuales el cual le permitió acumular dinero e iniciarse en su actual negocio.
Desempeña su labor en un ambiente habilitado en el primer piso de su vivienda en donde puso sus andamios logrando adquirir inicialmente mercadería básica y con su posterior venta consolidar de a pocos su negocio como el principal sustento de su familia.Tiene como apoyo su esposa quien es la encargada del negocio.
En su negocio se puede encontrar productos de primera necesidad tales como arroz, azúcar y cereales además de abarrotes, los cuales son adquiridos al por mayor para generar mejores ingresos.
