No obstante es necesario abastecer su negocio de manera permanente esperando tener una buena afluencia de clientes.Tiene en mente trabajar con la motivación que lo caracteriza para lograr con el tiempo ampliar su negocio y porque no iniciar la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble esperando mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia .Este es su primer crédito con Kiva motivo por el cual  se siente muy agradecido por la oportunidad ya que era necesario contar con un respaldo económico para continuar con su trabajo.
Para esta oportunidad desea contar con S/.4,000 nuevos soles e invertirlos en la compra de comestibles para su negocio el cual incluye sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, cereales, conservas de pescado, golosinas y demás productos con buena salida.
texts.en:
Armando is 48 years old, and is married to Emilia with whom he has two children. He lives with them in an adobe house bought many years ago. He owns a business selling foodstuffs. Initially, he made a living in various temporary jobs which enabled him to save money and set up his current business.

He works in a room fitted out for business on the first floor of his home, where he set up, initially acquiring basic merchandize, and later managing to consolidate his business into his family's main livelihood. He is supported by his wife, who manages the business.

His store sells basic goods such as rice, sugar and cereals and groceries, which he buys wholesale to make higher profits.However, he needs to keep his store fully stocked in case of a large number of customers. He plans to work with his usual motivation so that, over time, he manages to grow his business and build his home using stronger materials, to improve his family's quality of life. 

This is his first loan with Kiva, and he feels very grateful for this opportunity, since he needs financial support to continue his work. This time, he would like 4,000 soles to invest in buying foodstuffs for his business, including bags of rice, sugar, cereals, fish sauces, candy and other products that sell well.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Yun's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Cham province, where rice farming is one of the common businesses in the area, Yun is married and a 51-year-old mother of four children. She does rice-cropping, whereas her husband raises ducks to supplement the family income. 

Yun and her joint borrowers have never been with VisionFund before. All of them are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As group leader, Yun will use her loan portion to purchase fertilizer and rice seed for the upcoming replanting season. 

Yun hopes that she can grow her rice timely and fruitfully, so that she can increase her income and expand her business in a gradual manner.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and rice seed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 18 years old and from Gaza. He is working on a start up project and owns a grocery store. He asked Ryada for this start up loan in order to buy a refrigerator and some goods, as well as install shelves. He hopes that this loan will help him start his own project and increase his income.

Ryada's Startup Loan is exclusively for borrowers who are beginning new enterprises, not for existing projects. To qualify, a borrower must show a clear business plan and realistic potential for success. The borrower must also invest their own money and resources into at least 50 percent of the startup enterprise. Ryada believes strongly in the potential of these borrowers and grants them a three month grace period to help them get their business off the ground.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and some goods, as well as install shelves for his start up

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en: Jumagul is 24-years-old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Jumagul is a very sociable and kind woman. She had an opportunity to enter the university and that is why she learned to sew women's dresses. She has ‘golden hands.'  She sews very wonderful dresses. She wants to organize a new business to sew national dresses. She studied a course ‘To Get Ahead’ at a woman's organization and got a certificate. She will manage the business alone. She is planning to organize her business at her home. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy a sewing machine and fabrics necessary for her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabrics necessary for her new business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 38-year-old, married woman. She has five children, with ages ranging from 4 to 18 years. She describes herself as a social and talkative woman. She operates a farm stand, where she sells tomatoes. Her business is located at an agricultural area, and her primary customers are local residents.

She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to purchase seedlings and to pay school fees for her children. Her business goal is to expand her business, so as to create job opportunities for the people in her area, within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She managed to pay her previous loan of KES 10,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, and one of them is attending school. She is not looking after any additional family member. She has been selling second-hand clothes in the market, at retail, for the past six years, working six days a week. She does not earn any additional income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO, to enable her to buy more second-hand clothes to sell. Her challenges include seasonality and transport. Her dream is to start selling bales of clothes at wholesale, only. She joined MCDT because of convenient terms and the timely loans. She stays in her husband`s house, with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and transport.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio, 62, and Florentina live in the village of Santa Cruz, in Belize’s southernmost district of Toledo. The couple is raising three children, all of whom live in and are currently enrolled in school. The family manages a four-acre cacao farm with around 1,200 trees. 

A cacao farmer of 27 years now, Julio says he enjoys every part of the process of farming cacao. A more challenging part of cacao for him is the fermentation and drying, especially in the rainy season. Belize has two seasons – rainy and dry – with the rainy season typically going from June to November. The Toledo district receives most rainfall of all of Belize. Moreover, with climate change, the seasonality has become less predictable, with rains occurring in the dry season and vice versa. The family is happy to now be able to sell fresh cacao in place of having to dry it themselves. 

Florentina has been an active participant in farm management. She oversees and organizes harvesting with other ladies in her village, hiring three women to help with harvesting every two weeks during the productive season. Cacao trees in Belize produce all year round, with peak seasons from February through May. Besides caring for the children and helping on the farm, Florentina makes local Maya crafts from woven Jippi Jappa palm leaves. 

In the future, the family hopes to continue improving their cacao farm by expanding and diversifying into other crops that can be planted alongside the cacao trees. An interplanted farm yields some kind of crop all year round, creating more stable income for the farmers. Ideally, the children will finish school and take over the farm. “If they want, it would nice if they could continue to run the farm business, if not, somebody will take care of it,” Julio told Maya Mountain Cacao laughingly. 

The family is requesting this loan to prepare for expanding their farm and to hire help for harvesting. Expanding cacao requires buying and filling bags with topsoil and seeds in order to raise cacao seedlings. Moreover, to prepare land for planting, farmers need to clean the underbrush and mark where the trees will be planted. Seedlings are ready for transplanting into the ground when they have four or more leaves, usually about six months after they are bagged.

loans.use: To clean and expand cacao farm.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio, 52, and his wife live in the village of San Antonio, on the under way highway that will connect southern Belize with Guatemala. The family, besides managing 3 acres of cacao, has raised 10 children, five of whom live in at the moment. The children are aged nine to 30, and two of them are still enrolled in school. The older kids have moved out, and some of them have followed their dad’s example and begun their own cacao farms. 

With the help of his wife, Antonio tends to around 1,300 cacao trees that were planted five years back with the help of a local association of cacao growers. Cacao trees typically take about four to five years to become productive, and the family is happy most of their hard work five years ago is now paying back. Antonio says cacao farming is no trouble once the trees are grown and producing. The hardest thing about cacao for Antonio is the two-year period right after planting new trees. “You have to clean it often, not let the bush cover it, because the branches don’t make it through the bush,” he told Maya Mountain Cacao in perfect English, his second language after the native Maya Mopan language spoken in the village.

Besides cacao, the family grows corn and beans for home use. The two main sources of income for Antonio is a job as security officer for a local airline and cacao. In the future, he hopes to retire from the side job and focus on the farm and possibly expand it. The family puts a lot of focus on providing their children with the opportunity of education. “I put my other three boys to school even without me having a job,” said Antonio, adding that cacao and his job have helped save enough to put the rest of the children through school if they want to. 

Antonio is requesting this loan to hire help with cleaning the three acres of cacao. Cleaning is the process of cutting underbrush surrounding cacao trees to clear access to them for harvesting and pruning. Cacao requires shade, and is typically grown among timber trees and underbrush. To keep their farms manageable, cacao farmers in southern Belize clean their fields about three times in a given year. The job at hand for Antonio will require and create about 12 days worth of work in the community.

loans.use: Clean three acres of cacao.

loans.name: Maa Narayan Self Help Group

texts.en:
Pratima, 22, is married and lives with her family in a village in the Nayagarh district. She has three children. To make a living, she has been farming rice on one hectare of farmland for two years. The current business earns her family about 6000 INR per month.

Pratima’s group Maa Narayan Self Help Group consists of ten members who live in the same village. She is in her first loan cycle with Peoples Forum. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer, pesticides, seeds for her farmland and also use a portion of it for labor costs in water pumping. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her field business so as to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and to pay labour costs for her farmland

loans.name: Chelangat

texts.en:
Chelangat is a married lady, aged 37, and her children are aged between four and 10, and all are school-going children.  She has been in a retail business for the past two years, earning an income of 10,000 KES.

This is her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, and she intends to purchase sugar, tea leaves, salt, cooking fat, wheat and maize flour for her retail shop.  The profits she gets from her business will be put back into her business.

Her dream is to see her business expand and have a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, tea leaves, salt, cooking fat, wheat, and maize flour

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 29-year-old married man, and father of one child. He has been working in the agriculture business since 2008. His business is doing just fine depending on the market's needs, but his family's requests are increasing. To cover their needs, Imad and his wife considered applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to start a small business for his wife. She likes to sell beauty cosmetics at her house, because she has a lot of friends, neighbors and relatives who are interested in such products.

He is very optimistic about this step because he believes in his wife's skills and customer service. He hopes that the future loan will be invested in opening a shop for his wife instead of working from home.

loans.use: to start a new business for his wife

loans.name: Zahara's Group

texts.en:
Zahara's group is comprised of 7 hard working women. Zahara is 21-years-old and lives in the town of Iganga in the region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, 2 of them are currently in school. For the past 3 years, Zahara has been working hard to manage her clothing business. 

To help expand her business, Zahara has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell, and will help Zahara to generate greater profits and provide school fees for her young children. Zahara hopes that in the future she will be able to own a shop were she can sell her clothes. 

Zahara is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Oyunsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyunsuren is 45 years old and lives with her husband and son, in a rented house in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Bat-Ochir, used to run an organic vegetable sales business in a rented counter of a local market.

Borrower has been helping her husband, and now they are planning to start a used clothing sales business in a rented place. Oyunsuren is requesting to borrow 1,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of used clothing, to sell to local customers. She and her husband are optimistic and hard-working people.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of used clothing to sell to local customers

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 31-year-old married man who has been in the poultry business for 17 years. In 2006, he opened his own business for chicken butchery and sale. Ahmad is well-known in the region for his chicken’s quality and cleanliness; his clients range from friends to neighbors and even tourists.

Ahmad is applying for his first loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy more chicken and increase his sales. In the future, he seeks to own a big butchery servicing the majority of the people in his region. With his independent and entrepreneurial spirit, Ahmad is optimistic about his success.

loans.use: to buy more chicken and increase his sales

loans.name: Nyamaa

texts.en: Mrs. Nyamaa is 54 years old and lives with her husband in an apartment in Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Oyuntungalag, aged 57, works as a driver at a local company. The borrower's children have gotten married and live separately. She has been running a used shoes sales business in a rental place. She has gained a lot of experience and built close relationships with suppliers. She is now requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase used shoes from suppliers to sell to local customers. She is a hardworking, helpful and friendly woman.

loans.use: to purchase used shoes from suppliers to sell to local customers

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 43-year-old single Palestinian man who owns a mobile phone store. Besides cellular phones, he also sells their accessories, mobile recharging cards, and offers software programming. Mahmoud’s business start-up was difficult due to a lack of capital; however, with his ambition and business-oriented mind, he succeeded.

Mahmoud is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua. He will invest the money in buying more phones, accessories and recharge cards; this will considerably increase his revenues. Mahmoud’s client base is wide and can expand more given the high demand for this industry in Lebanon. Mahmoud hopes that one day he can become a local dealer for the Nokia brand in Lebanon.

loans.use: to purchase more phones, accessories and recharge cards to sell; this will considerably increase his revenues

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 33-year-old married man and father of one child. Over a period of 15 years, he has developed a wide experience in the electronics sales and repairs’ business. Two years ago, Ali decided to open his own shop, selling used electric parts, televisions, and power supplies, while offering repairs and satellite installation services.

Ali is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, with which he will buy merchandise for his shop, mainly power supplies, satellite dishes, and channel receivers. Though his business start-up was challenging due to lack of capital, Ali is optimistic about his future. He intends to expand his business further and increase his range of offerings.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his shop, mainly power supplies, satellite dishes, and channel receivers

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Don Gonzalo tiene 46 años de edad,  es casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive en una aldea del Municipio de la Flecha, Santa Barbará
Don Gonzalo desde hace 30 años se dedica a realizar trabajos de agricultura, cultiva café, maíz, frijoles. Don Gonzalo manifiesta que de esta actividad ha podido mantener a  su familia dándoles todo lo necesario a sus hijos. Estos productos los comercializa en el mercado local y los vende a buen precio.
El esta solicitando su tercer préstamo de 15,000 lempiras para invertir dándole mantenimiento a los cultivos, comprara abano y fertilizantes. Esto le ayudara a que sus cultivos tengan mayor asistencia y lograr una mejor producción.
La meta  es seguir trabajando y de las ganancias que obtenga poder comprar un carro para trabajar en el negocio.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is 46 years old, married, and has 3 children. He lives in a village of De la Flecha municipality in Santa Barbara. For some 30 years now, Gonzalo has been dedicated to working in agriculture, cultivating coffee, corn, and beans. Gonzalo tells us that with this activity, he has been able to maintain his family, providing everything necessary for his children. His produce is sold in the local market at a good price.

Gonzalo is soliciting his 3rd loan of 15,000 lempiras to invest in crop maintenance, purchasing manure and fertilizers. This will help him provide better assistance and achieve higher production.

His goal is to continue working and, with the earnings he obtains, Gonzalo hopes to be able to buy a car for use in the business.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and manure for crop maintenance.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Self Help Group

texts.en:
Basanti, a citizen from a rural village located in the Nayagarh district, is age 30 years and married with three children; all of them are dependent on her and still in school. For the last four years, she has been farming rice and selling vegetables. Her husband supplements their income by working as a laborer. With the current business, she can earn about 5,000 INR per month and save 2,000 INR per month for future needs.

Basanti is a member of Peoples Forum, which has enabled her to better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds for her farmland and also use some of it to buy more vegetables to sell. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing fertilizers, pesticides, seeds and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maa Santosi Self Help Group

texts.en:
Sanjulata is 41 years old, married and has two children. She lives in the  Nayagarh district of Odisha, India. Sanjulata is a housewife who is very happy and responsible. She alternates her household activities with her work in her business. She has a business growing vegetables and paddy rice and selling them in a market of Khurda district of Odisha, India. She has already had this business for five years, and it is going very well. At this time, Sanjulata is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming. She says that this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demand. 

This group is made up of neighbours and friends who formed the group together. The members of the group have selected Sanjulata as their president. The lady sitting in the middle wearing a red saree in the photo is Sanjulata. The common goal of the group is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming.

loans.name: Shinehuu

texts.en: Mrs. Shinehuu is a 53-year-old widow and lives with her 2 children in an apartment in Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her daughter, Oyundari, age 21, studies at the university and her son, Oyunbold, age 15, studies at a local school. The borrower has been running her clothing sales business since 2001. Her business has been the only income source for the family for years, and she manages to cover all of the expenses including her children's education. She is now requesting 800,000 MNT to purchase underwear and socks to sell at her counter. She is a hardworking, tough and responsible woman who has a good previous loan record at XacBank.

loans.use: to purchase underwear and socks to sell at her counter

loans.name: Bee Group

texts.en:
BEE group consists of 4 partners all from Dansoman. They are Bernice, Matilda, Rebecca and Mavis. Their professions are hairdresser, drink sales, cereal sales and 2nd hand cloths sales, respectively. They have been together since 2012. 

Bernice is a 39-year-old hairdresser. She has 3 children. She needs GHS 700 to buy more creams and wigs to serve her customers with.

She has been in this business for the past 5 years and is doing very well. She is very loyal and truthful with the loans she took from ID Ghana and is now applying for her 2nd loan to meet her customers’ demands. 

The entire group needs an amount totaling GHS 2,350 to expand and buy more goods to meet the demand of their respective customers.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products (wigs, weavon and cream) to serve her customers with.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 45-year-old, married man, and the father of five children. He previously worked as a truck driver. Then, one year ago, he got a job at a car garage located in a very strategic area, crowded with clients. Fadi’s work comprises two services: wheel repairs and lubrication. 

Fadi is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua. He will use the money to buy a new stock of wheels. This is Fadi’s first loan from Al Majmoua, and he is optimistic about this experience. In the future, he intends to open his own business, and he believes that by then, he will have sufficient market knowledge and expertise for this purpose. This will help Fadi provide a better living standard for his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy a new stock of wheels

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 50-year-old, married man, and the father of seven children. Two years ago, he opened his own electricity supply station, and now he employs three permanent workers. In a country where electricity is not continuously provided, Ibrahim’s business can be quite profitable. The concept is that the people in the village subscribe to Ibrahim’s service and pay a monthly fee for the supplementary electricity they are getting.

Since his business mainly relies on the motor generators he has, Ibrahim is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, to repair one of his three generators. This would increase his productivity, and consequently, his electricity supply and revenues. Though his business didn’t start well because of his weak experience in the field, Ibrahim was able to progress due to his market-oriented thinking, his integrity and competitive prices.

loans.use: to repair one of his three generators, which will improve his ability to supply electricity and earn revenue

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 39-year-old married man and father of four children. He has 18 years of experience in grocery sales, mainly potato and onions. Fadi is famous in his neighborhood for the quality of the vegetables he sells, as well as his honesty with the customers.

Fadi is applying for his first loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua. He will use the money to buy a large amount of potatoes and onions to accommodate the increasing demand from his customers. Fadi hopes that he can expand his sales and increase his business revenues in order to support his family and provide them a respectful standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of potatoes and onions to accommodate the increasing demand from his customers

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 47-year-old married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 18 years. He describes himself to be a hard-working and strict man. He operates a carpentry business where he sells chairs. He has been involved in this business for 17 years. His business is located in a stiff competition business environment, and his primary customers are village dwellers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the shortage of timber for making furniture to sell. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy timber for making furniture to sell. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy timber and carpentry equipment

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Salem is 29 years old and is from Gaza.
He is married and has three children.
He has owned a grocery store since 2011.
He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a display fridge, stands, and shelves.
He hopes that this loan will help him to increase his sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a display fridge, stands, and shelves.

loans.name: Poghos

texts.en:
Poghos is 32-years-old. He is married with 2 little kids and is involved in land cultivation. Specifically, he cultivates wheat and sunflower. Due to his hard work, Poghos gets good harvests and sells it in the local market. 

As the only breadwinner of the family of 6 (he lives with his parents, sister, wife and two children), Poghos would like to expand his agricultural activities. He has applied for this loan to pay for fertilizer, sunflower seeds and to cover cultivation costs. This loan is very important for Poghos to expand the cultivation of sunflowers and gather a good harvest. This will significantly increase Poghos's income, and he will be able to ensure a better life for his big and beloved family.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, sunflower seeds and cover cultivation costs

loans.name: Tony

texts.en:
Tony is a 26-year-old, married man. He has one child, who is two years old. He describes himself as an ambitious man. He operates a retail store, where he sells mobile phone accessories. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located at a busy urban town, and his primary customers are nearby residents. He says his biggest business challenge is the high prices of phone accessories.

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy phone accessories to resell. His business goal is to improve his business within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He managed to repay his previous loan of KES 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories to resell in his shop

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, and one of them attends school. She is not looking after any other members of the family.

She has been selling shoes in the market at retail for four months, working six days a week. She also keeps animals and poultry as other sources of income.

She has requested a loan of UShs 200,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more shoes for sale. Her challenges include the unstable seasonality. Her dream is to expand her business, accumulate profits and buy a piece of land. She joined MCDT because she realized that she would not be able to realize her dream without increasing her capital.  She rents a house that is without access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and electricity bills.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sale

loans.name: Loay

texts.en: Loay is 33 years old and from Tulkarem. He is married and has one child. He owns a small cow farm in which he has three cows. He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy more cows for his farm. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income and provide his son with the best education.

loans.use: To buy more cows for his farm

loans.name: Tserendulam

texts.en: Mrs. Tserendulam is a 57-year-old female and lives with her daughter in an apartment in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her daughter, Otgonsaihan, is a university student. She has been running a traditional costume tailoring service since 2000. She has lot of regular customers and suppliers now. She is now requesting 1,500,000 MNT to pay her daughter's university tuition fee for the fall semester. She is a hardworking and responsible woman.

loans.use: To pay her daughter's university tuition fee for the fall semester

loans.name: Paata

texts.en:
Paata is 47 years old. He lives in the Marneuli District with his wife, Ina, and two sons: 25-year-old, Guram, and 14-year-old, Otar, and they all go to school. Paata requested a loan from some local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of having a low income and his family’s poor living conditions.
 
Paata is an artisan. He is working on some private-order renovations. In addition his older son, Guram, is a distributor, and they both get a small monthly income that is not enough to feed the family. 

Paata requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Paata plans to open a restaurant. As he has a commercial space, Paata will not have to pay the rent. He will only need to purchase some materials for the renovation, which will be done by him. This will reduce the cost, increase his profit, and Paata will have a source of income. This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase some materials for the renovation of a commercial space and open a restaurant

loans.name: Angel Bolivar

texts.es:
ANGEL  tiene 55 años de edad es casado tiene seis hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

Pertenece a la VRC SAN JUAN BAUTISTA se encuentra formada y creada en la ciudad de Tambanal a una distancia de 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperatva, La actividad económica es la agricultura, crianza de animales.

ANGEL se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol,arveja, además se dedica a la crianza de ganado, cerdos y gallinas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado, vacuna y alimentación. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar el ganado. La compra la realizará en Chillanes.

El sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida, vivir mas cómodo, mejorar o arreglar la casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos, baja a producción.

En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar de las fiestas de la comunidad y del carnaval.
texts.en:
Angel, age 55, is married and has six children.  He lives with his wife and children in the Chillanes canton in the Bolivár province.  He belongs to the San Juan Bautista communal bank, which was formed in the city of Tambanal.  This is 40 minutes from the Cooperativa office.  The business activity here is farming and raising animals.

Angel is a farmer, and he grows corn, beans, and peas.  He also raises cattle, pigs, and chickens. 

He is requesting the loan to buy cattle and feed.  With the help of the loan he will be able to buy livestock.  He will make his purchase in Chillanes.

His dream is to improve his living conditions, to live more comfortably, and to improve or fix the house.

The challenges he faces are the pest infestations and crop diseases that lower production.

In his free time he likes to enjoy the community celebrations and the Carnival festivities.

loans.use: to buy cattle and feed.

loans.name: Tsolmonbaatar

texts.en:
Tsolmonbaatar is 44 years old and lives with his wife and 2 sons in a house in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife Javzandolgor, age 46, helps her husband's business of manufacturing traditional boots from home. His sons Bavuusuren, age 20, and Baatarsuren, age 18, are university students.

Tsolmonbaatar has been running his traditional boots manufacturing business at home since 2004. He and his wife have gained a lot of experience and customers over the years. He is now requesting 3,500,000 MNT to pay his sons' university tuition and dormitory fees. He and his wife are both hardworking and modest people.

loans.use: to pay his sons' university tuition and dormitory fees.

loans.name: Wisdom Group

texts.en:
Wisdom, Deborah, Juliana and Grace makes up this group. They reside in the Dansoman community. They sell electrical appliances, food stuffs, vegetables and utensils. They have been together as a group since 2009 and are still doing very well.

Wisdom is a 32-year-old electrical appliance seller. He has been with ID Ghana for the past 4 years and he is doing very well. He has been engaged in this business activity for five years now. He works from Monday to Saturday. 

This is his ninth loan. He needed the amount of GHS 2,000 to buy more electrical goods to sell to his customers. He is grateful to ID Ghana. 

Wisdom, Deborah, Juliana and Grace need a total amount of GHS 5,500 to buy more inventory to sell to their customers in the Dansoman community.

loans.use: to buy more electrical appliances to sell to customers

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is a 26-year-old single man, who has worked in construction since 2006. He is a hard worker and his business is mobile.

Haidar dreams of building his own house, making for his own family one just like he makes for others. That's why he is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy building materials needed to build his own house. Haidar is a hard worker, well known in the region for his skills and good reputation.

Haidar hopes that future loans will be invested in expanding his business, through buying necessary tools and materials.

loans.use: to buy necessary building materials requested to build his own house

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is a very hardworking woman from Goris, Armenia. She lives alone and does everything by herself. She tends 35 sheep and does her best to earn enough income to sustain her living costs. It is very difficult for her to cover basic needs. 

Karine has applied for a loan to increase her sheep flock by purchasing 27 sheep and the forage for feeding them. This loan is very important for Karine to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 27 sheep and forage to feed them.

loans.name: Sakti Maa Santoshi Self Help Group

texts.en: The group Sakti Maa Santoshi Self Help Group (SHG) has 11 members who are all from the same neighborhood. The lady sitting third from the left hand side, wearing a blue sare in the photo is Saroswati who is the leader of the group. Saroswati is a 41-year-old woman married to a worker in Angul district in Odisha, India. The couple has two children who are in school. Saroswati lives with her children and, together with her husband, takes care of all the household expenses. In order to help with all the family expenses, Saroswati has been involved in selling rice to the nearby market and to the dealers of rice in the district super market, for the past eight years. She purchases rice directly from the farmers. Then she supplies it to the rice dealers and sells it in the nearby market. In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demand, Saroswati, together with the group Sakti Maa Santoshi SHG, is requesting a loan from Peoples Forum to purchase rice in bulk to store in a warehouse for fulfilling future demand and to cover their operational costs. Their goal is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: to purchase rice in bulk

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 21 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the  region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Hawa has been working hard to manage her charcoal sales business. 

To help expand her business, Hawa has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. This will help Hawa generate greater profits and provide her family with basic needs. Hawa hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a cloth business. 

Hawa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en:
Mr. Bat-Erdene is 34 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in a house in Arhangai province of Mongolia. His wife Zolzaya, age 29, studies at university. His son Javhaamandah, age 7, goes to a local school and daughter Enhmandah goes to a local kindergarten. 

Bat-Erdene has been working as a craftsman at a local company since 1996. He is now starting his own business since he has already built a close relationship with his customers and suppliers. He is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase bulk silver to craft silver jewelry to sell to his customers. He is a hardworking, fast and responsible man.

loans.use: to purchase bulk silver to craft silver jewelry to sell to his customers

loans.name: Smajl

texts.en:
Smajl is a 59-year-old man living in an Ashkali community in the southern part of Kosovo. He is a widower, raising eight children. Smajl works at carrying goods for others. His existing house is very old and damaged; the furniture is old and uncomfortable. He dreams of seeing his home just as beautiful. Unfortunately, now he can see only the things that need immediate renovation work. 

His pay is only enough to support his family and he would like to improve their living conditions. Smajl is requesting a loan to purchase building materials to renovate his house. With this loan, Smajl will be able to renovate his house. The family's living conditions will be improved and they will be able to live in a comfortable environment. 

Smajl is grateful to Kiva lenders for improving the family's living conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase building materials for renovation

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en:
Mr. Bat-Erdene is 26 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Oyuntsetseg, works as a saleswoman in the local market. His son, Temuulen, goes to the local kindergarten. 

This borrower has been running a taxi service business in town since 2012. He has gained a lot of experience over time, however, his car has been consuming a lot of gas and he needs a replacement. He is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly vehicle to provide his taxi service business with lower costs in order to increase his profits. He is hardworking and diligent.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly vehicle to lower costs for his taxi service business

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
Mazen is a 26-year-old single man who has been working in selling mobile phones, accessories, and prepaid cards for the past four years. In 2012, he opened his own shop to increase his income and develop his living. 

Mazen is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to increase his mobile phones and prepaid cards capital. Mazen is very excited about this loan, and he hopes that he can keep on replying to his customers' needs. Most of Mazen's customers are his neighbors, friends, and relatives. Mazen is willing to keep on expanding his business, to improve his social and financial living, and to plan to make a small family of his own in the future.

loans.use: to increase his mobile phones and prepaid cards capital

loans.name: Ematiete Group

texts.en:
Ematiete is a group of 14 farmers in Kakamega North District. The group is represented by Belinda. The group has 10 women and 4 men. Belinda is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant half an acre of sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum. Belinda joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains of 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains of 2013 season. Belinda joined One Acre Fund so that she could access the best input prices and grow enough food for her family.

Belinda described her harvest as good last year as a One Acre Fund farmer and hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and save for the future. Belinda’s group members will each receive input loans of half an acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 7 acres of sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet and sorghum

loans.name: Vitali

texts.en:
Vitali is 52 years old. He lives in Kobuleti, West Georgia with his 42-year-old wife Bella and two sons who are going to school. Vitali requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Vitali is an artisan. He works on private orders on house renovations and gets a small monthly income. In addition, his family has seasonal income from renting rooms.

Vitali requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Vitali will purchase all the tools to install parquet floors. He will be able to offer better services to the people who need house renovations. This will increase the family income and Vitali will be able to provide better living conditions for his family and provide for his sons' future education.

loans.use: To purchase tools to install parquet floors

loans.name: Elunyu Group

texts.en:
Richard’s group has 11 farmers and is located in the Kakamega North District. Richard is pictured on the right of Elunyu Group with his hand raised. Richard is pictured amongst the two men and nine women in his group. He will receive input loans capable of planting ½ acre with sorghum and millet. Richard first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Richard joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and use the increased profits to send his children to school.

Richard reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about one bag of maize per ½ acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested four bags per 1/2 acre! He plans to use future profits from the harvest to buy a cow and send his children to school. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Richard’s group will receive 5 1/2 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his mobile money transfer agency business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bedroom for her house.

loans.name: Enhbayar

texts.en:
Mrs.Enhbayar, 42, lives with her husband and 2 children in a house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. Her husband, Uuganbayar, 43, helps her run their driver training business and works as a teacher. Her daughter Enhjin, 5, and son Behbat, 10, attend school.

Enhbayar has provided driver training instruction since 2010. She was a teacher in a local driver training company. She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly, automatic electric simulator for her car to reduce the vehicle's emissions rate. She is a hardworking, positive and responsible woman.

loans.use: to repair the car used for her driver training business.

loans.name: Emmy Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of 5 members who have been accessing loans from ID Ghana since 2012. They are Emelia, Hawa, Comfort, Zinabu, and Forgive. They live at in Dansoman. They sell edible oil, toilet rolls, charcoal, and provisions. One member is a seamstress.

ID Ghana has been of great service to the group, since they have been able to grow their small businesses through the credit scheme. 

Emelia is a 53-year-old edible oil seller. She has 6 years' experience and works 6 days a week (from Monday to Saturday). She is constantly working to improve her business capital. This is her third loan with ID Ghana and she is requesting a loan for GHS 1,000 to buy more oil to sell to her customers in the community.

The entire group needs a total amount of GHS 5,300 for business expansion and to meet customers’ demands.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sisa Group

texts.en:
Sisa is a group of 15 farmers in the Webuye District. The group has 13 women and 2 men. The group is represented by Henrietah. Henrietah is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant half an acre of sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum. Henrietah first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Henrietah joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for her family and to learn better farming techniques.

Henrietah described her last year's harvest as very good, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to buy cattle and perhaps save for the future. Henrietah’s group members will each receive input loans of half an acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 7.5 acres of sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Maa Gojabayani Self Help Group

texts.en: Basanti is a 39-year-old lady who has three children. She lives in the Angul district of Odisha, India with her husband and her children. A few years back, she started a business making and selling spices, such as turmeric powder, chili powder, dry mango powder, cardamom powder, cinnamon powder, coriander powder, mixed spices for curry etc. She makes these powders with the help of grinders. She makes a variety of spices depending on the demand for spices in the market. She is requesting a loan of 250,000 INR to buy more supplies such as asafoetida, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, black pepper etc. With this investment, she will expand her business so that she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family. She is requesting in a group of 10 members who are all women and all live in the same community.  They named their group Maa Gojabayani Self Help Group, which is situated in the Angul district of Odisha, India.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make spices.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be a determined and ambitious woman. She operates a farm business where she sells maize, tomatoes, cabbages, etc . She has been involved in this business for 16 years. Her business is located in a local residential area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough water for irrigation during the dry season. She will use the 15,000 KES loan to buy seedling. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. In addition, Josephine does livestock farming which adds to her business income.

loans.use: to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Bathuu

texts.en: Mr.Bathuu is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ger in Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife Baigalmaa is currently unemployed and stays home. His sons Monhtulga, age 18; Anujin, age 14; and Hulan, age 5, go to local schools. Borrower has been running a welding service business at home for years and he is well-known in town. He is now requesting 4,500,000 MNT to purchase spare parts to start his auto repair business. He is a hardworking, well-experienced, and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to start his auto repair business

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
Tamer is 32 years old and from Nablus. He is married and has three children.

He owns a shop for electronics sales, installations, and maintenance. He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy more electronics and maintenance tools.

He hopes that this loan will help him increase his services and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy more electronics and maintenance tools

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 39-year-old married woman with four children. She describes herself as a determined and ambitious woman. She has sold household items in her retail store for four years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are the local residents. 

She will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy household items to sell. Her business goal is to restock her business and improve it within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business.

loans.use: to buy household items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mwangaza Group

texts.en:
Moses is a member of Mwangaza Group in Webuye District. He is pictured with 15 One Acre Fund farmers, 10 women and five men. Moses is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Moses is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and use increased profits to send his children to school.

Moses managed to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, he hopes to harvest even more. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and perhaps buy a cow. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Moses’ group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 7.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Badilika Group

texts.en:
Margaret is a member of Badilika Group, in Kakamega North District. The group is comprised of 15 One Acre Fund farmers, 12 women and 3 men. Margaret is standing on the right with her hand raised, in the photo. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of millet and sorghum cultivation. Margaret first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2009 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Margaret joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, and to use increased profits to send her children to school.

Margaret described her harvest as good last year, but she believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and buy a cow. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Badilika Group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 7.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells maize at Eguafo, near Elmina. She has been doing so for 40 years. She is married to a farmer and has seven children.  Adjoa uses her income to support her husband with the family's general expenses. Adjoa needs this loan to purchase an increased quantity of maize that can be sold. With the new profits, Adjoa wishes to expand her enterprise further, while ensuring that her children receive an education.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity of maize that she will resell

loans.name: Luba

texts.en:
Luba is 23 years old and lives in the town of Iganga, Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Luba has been working hard to manage her small clothing business.  

To help expand her business, Luba has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell, and will help Luba to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Luba hopes that in the future, she will be able to build a residential house. 

Luba is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 61 years old and happily married and living with his children. He still runs his retail shop, and with his previous loans, his business has improved. Jeremiah now earns 55,000 KES each month.

He borrowed 50,000 KES and will use the loan to purchase cooking fat, tea leaves, washing detergents and sugar for resale. He plans to use the anticipated profits for payment of school fees. He hopes for prosperity in his businesses.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, tea leaves, washing detergents and sugar to sell in his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts to service his vehicle

loans.name: Gulom

texts.ru: Гулом живет в сельской местности, в далёком от города селе. Женат и воспитывает троих детей. Он имеет двенадцатилетний  опыт в сфере животноводство. Его отец занимался разведением скота и Гулом с детство помогал отцу. У них был один теленок, за которым он должен был ухаживать. Он вырос и пошёл по стопам отца. Начал свое дело с двух голов барана. Поначалу ему было тяжело, особенно в зимнее время и приходилось тратить больше средств на корм скота. Но со временем опыт доказывал своё и Гулом стал находить пути решения препятствий и способы для лучшего продвижения своего дела. На сегодня он имеет более 50 голов скота. Его жена и трое детей также вовлечены в это дело. В связи с сезонностью он не хочет продавать своих коров сейчас, так как цены на них упали. Гулом нуждается в дополнительных средствах для покупки корма скота. С этой целью он обратился в МДО «Арванд» за кредитом. На полученный кредит планирует прикупить корм для скота.
texts.en: Gulom lives in an agricultural area, in a village far away from the city.  He is married and is raising three children.  He has twelve years of experience in raising livestock.  His father raised livestock and Gulom helped his father since his childhood.  They had one calf that he had to take care of.  He grew up and followed in his father's footsteps.  He started his business with two sheep.  At first he had a hard time, especially in wintertime he had to spend more for livestock feed.  But over time experience proved valuable and Gulom started finding ways to overcome barriers and ways to better expand his business.  Today he has more than 50 heads of livestock.  His wife and three children also take part in the business.  Due to the season he does not want to sell his cows right now, because their prices fell.  Gulom needs additional resources to buy livestock feed.  With this goal he turned to MDO Arvand for a loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy livestock feed.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Batbaatar is 26 years old and lives with his wife and daughter, in a ger in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. His wife, Enhsaihan, stays home taking care of their newborn baby daughter, Amin-Erdene, age 1.

Borrower has been working with his father to produce wooden furniture since 1999. He started his own wooden furniture manufacturing business at his home, in 2010. He has a lot of experience and regular customers. He is now requesting to borrow 500,000 MNT to purchase equipment that will increase his speed of production. He is hard-working and diligent.

loans.use: to purchase equipment that will increase his speed of production

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 29-year-old hardworking lady. She is married to David, who operates a motorcycle transport business. Faith is a mother of three children aged 9, 6, and 2 years, respectively. She learned about KADET LTD. from a credit officer.

Faith deals with the buying and selling of cereals in Narok county, Kenya, and has been in the business for the last three years. She makes a monthly income of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). She has been given a second loan of 40,000 KES, which will facilitate the purchase and transport of more bags of maize to the marketplace. She plans to use the proceeds to enlarge her store and educate her children.

Her hope is to have a large outlet that serves the whole county.

loans.use: to purchase and transport more bags of maize to the marketplace.

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es:
Alba es una joven emprendedora originaria de la Cuidad de Somotillo, se caracteriza por una persona honesta, trabajadora, social, responsable, dedicada a su trabajo y a su familia formada por su esposo y su pequeño hijo.

ha sabido salir adelante en sus estudios siendo una madre joven, actualmente esta  iniciando los módulos de titulación, para poder culminar su carrera de Administración de Empresas, por lo que se presentó a Ceprodel a solicitar un préstamo para suplir estos gastos y poder culminar su sueño de ser una profesional.
texts.en: Alba is a Young entrepreneur from the city of Somotillo.  She is characterized as an honest, hard-working, social, and responsible person.  She is dedicated to her family, comprised of her husband and her little son.  She has managed to succeed in her studies while being a young mother.  Currently, she is starting the course modules to complete her degree in Business Management.  She has come to Ceprodel to request a loan to cover these expenses and be able to fulfill her dream of being a professional.

loans.use: to pay for the course modules and process of completing her degree.

loans.name: Bokijon

texts.ru: Бокичон мужчина в возрасте 60 лет.  Женат имеет троих детей. Бокичон дома занимается откормом скота и также продажей молока. У него дома имеется дойная корова, которая каждый день дает по 12 литров молока. Его жена нигде не работает, она ухаживает за домашним скотом, производит молочные продукты и продает свои соседям и знакомым. Опыт ухода за скотом у Бокичона и его жены составляет более 20 лет и так как от этого получают дополнительно хорошую прибыль они хотят расширить свой  бизнес. Для этого Бокичон обратился в Арванд, чтобы получит кредит. Заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en: Bokijon is a 60 year old man.  He is married and has three children.  Bokijon raises livestock at home and also sells milk.  He has a milk cow at home that produces 12 liters of milk daily.  His wife does not have a job, she takes care of the livestock, makes dairy products and sells to her neighbors and acquaintances.  Bokijon and his wife have 20 years of experience raising livestock and since they earn an extra good profit from this they would like to expand their business.  This is why Bokijon turned to Arvand in order to get a loan.  He is grateful in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase one cow

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida is 16 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in Uganda. For the past two years, Rashida has worked hard managing her charcoal business. 

To help expand her business, Rashida has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal to sell, and will help Rashida earn greater profits and pay her school fees. Rashida hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a shoe business. 

Rashida is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Kotoine

texts.en:
Kotoine is a 46-year-old, hard-working farmer, married to Kimanyisho. They have three children, aged 15, 12 and 10 years. Kotoine farms, producing maize and beans. He has been in the business for the past five years, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000. He learned about KADET LTD from a colleague farmer who was already registered.

He has applied for a third loan, in the amount of KES 40,000, which will facilitate him acquiring seedlings and preparing the land for planting. He hopes to use the increased profits to lease a bigger acreage of land for planting various types of crops. He hopes to attain financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and prepare the land for planting

loans.name: Teresa Emiliana

texts.es:
TERESA tiene 60 años de edad es soltera tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y unos familiares en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

Pertenece a la VRC SAN JUAN BAUTISTA se encuentra formada y creada en la ciudad de Tambanal a una distancia de 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperatva, La actividad económica es la agricultura, crianza de animales.

TERESA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arveja, además se dedica a la crianza de ganado, cerdos, gallinas.
Solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado y un cerdo. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los animales. La compra la realizará en Chillanes.

El sueño es mejorar la situación económica para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la falta de recursos económicos para invertir.

En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear, salir a visitar a familiares.
texts.en:
Teresa is 60 years old. She is single and has two children. She lives with her children and some family members in Chillanes canton in Bolívar province.

She belongs to the San Juan Bautista (St. John the Baptist) communal bank, created in the city of Tambanal, 40 minutes away from the cooperative's office. The economic activity is agriculture and raising animals.

Teresa is a farmer and grows corn, beans, and peas. She also raises cattle, pigs, and chickens. She is asking for the loan to buy a cow and a pig. With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy the animals. She will make the purchase in Chillanes. 

Her dream is to improve her economic situation in order to have a better quality of life. The challenge she faces is the lack of economic resources to invest.

In her free time, she likes to go for walks and visit family.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a pig

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en:
Elvis, 25 years old, is single and lives in the southern part of Kosovo, with his entire family. He is a very hard worker and an ambitious person. Elvis is a mobile seller. He sells and distributes different beverages in big and small markets in his local area. To better support his family and earn more income, he works also during the night.

For the first time, he requests a loan to buy more beverages. This loan will help him to generate more income.  Without this opportunity it will be difficult for him to grow his business. He hopes in the future to expand his business and obtain an employee.

His goal is to have better living conditions. He thanks all KIVA lenders!

loans.use: To buy more beverages and grow his business

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en:
Mr.Batsaihan is 38 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a house in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife Byambatseren, 39, works as a hairdresser. His sons Torbat and Enhtor go to a local school, and Torbold goes to local kindergarten. 

The borrower has had a taxi service business in town for years, and also herds livestock. He is requesting loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase a special breed of livestock, and forage for his livestock. He is a hardworking, positive man.

loans.use: to purchase a special breed of livestock, and forage for his livestock.

loans.name: Los Vencedores De Carabayllo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Yulisa Mavila, tiene 36 años de edad, tiene un hijo pequeño de seis años de edad. Ella es socia del grupo "Los Vencedores de Carabayllo" formado por 6 integrantes, cada uno de ellos con sus propios sueños y metas se unieron para que conjuntamente adquieran prestamo y asi poder hacer crecer sus negocios. Este es un grupo responsable y puntual en sus pagos.
La Sra. Yulisa Mavila, inició su negocio de venta de juguetes hace aproximadamente 10 años, inició éste negocio vendiendo de forma ambulatoria en los mercados con poca mercadería, poco a poco y base de mucho esfuerzo ella ha ido aumentando su mercadería, le agradaría mucho poner una juguetería o un bazar en una ona comercial.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de juguetes para su negocio.
texts.en:
Yulisa Mavila is 36 years old. She has a small son who is six years old. She is a member of the "Los Vencedores de Carabayllo" ("The Victors of Carabayllo") group, which is composed of 6 members, each one of them with their own dreams and goals. They joined forces so that together they could obtain loans and thus be able to make their businesses grow. This is a responsible group that is punctual with its payments.

Yulisa Mavila started her business selling toys approximately 10 years ago. She started this business as a street vendor in the markets with a small amount of merchandise. Bit by bit and with a lot of effort, she has been increasing her merchandise. She would very much like to have a toy store or a stationery shop in a commercial area.

With the received loan, she will buy toys for her business.

loans.use: to buy toys

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 19 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the country of Uganda.  For the past two years, Halima has been working hard to manage her charcoal business. 

To help expand her business, Halima has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal for sell, and will help Halima generate greater profits and provide her family with basic needs. Halima hopes that in the future she will be able to start selling sweet potatoes. 

Halima is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah is 51-year-old shop keeper. He is married to Elizabeth, and they have four children. He has been running a retail shop for the past six years, with a monthly income of KES. 10,000. He also supplies gas cylinders to supplement his income. 

After being introduced by a KADET staff member, he is applying for his first loan term with KADET.  Isaiah will use the loan to purchase sugar, rice, tissue papers, sweets, green grams (a type of bean), etc... for his retail shop. 

He intends to invest the income earned from the loaned amount into his business, and start investing for his children’s future. 

His hopes and dreams are to own his own wholesale shop, and be able to provide his children with a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, tissue papers, sweets, and green grams to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in working capital and to supply her business buying and selling secondhand clothing such as a variety of clothing for adults and children such as shirts, skirts, shorts, and pants

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is a 31-year-old married man. He has two children with ages ranging from two years to six years. He describes himself as a warm man who is friendly to customers. He operates a van, which he uses to provide transportation services. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a local residential area and his primary customers are local residents. 

Cyrus' biggest business challenge is that he has insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use this 10,000 KES loan to purchase spare parts for his van. His business goal is to own many vans within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM, after previously paying back a loan of 10,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his van.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El Señor Carlos  vive en Playas, el tiene 64 años de edad. El cliente anteriormente trabajaba de cocinero en los barcos y desde  hace 5 años se jubilo, tiene una pequeña despensa y además es comerciante de mariscos.

El se dedica al comercio de mariscos, el traja de lunes a viernes de 9:00 de la mañana hasta las 5:00 de la tarde. El en su trabajo no ha tenido ninguna dificultad.

El es viudo su esposa fallecio hace algunos años,  si tiene hijos pero ya son todos  mayores de edad.
Con el préstamo va a comprar mariscos para su negocio. El desea para el futuro mejorar su negocio
texts.en:
Carlos lives in Playas, and he is 64 years old.  He used to work as a cook on boats, and he retired from this job 5 years ago.  He has a small store, and he also has a business selling seafood.

He works selling seafood Mondays through Fridays from 9am until 5pm.  He has not had any difficulties with his work.

Carlos is a widower whose wife died a number of years ago.  He has children, but they are all grown.

With this loan, Carlos will buy seafood for his business.  In the future, he wants to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy seafood to sell in his business

loans.name: Urumuri Cb Group

texts.en: Charlotte is a group leader of “Urumuri,” which means “Light” in English. The loan group consists of different members with different business types, and they all aim high to be a light to their community. Charlotte sells foodstuffs, and as a group member, she wants to buy maize flour, cassava and beans for sale. The profits will be used to reinvest in the business. In the picture, Charlotte has raised her hand to identify her from other group members.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, cassava and beans to sell.

loans.name: Hrach

texts.en:
Hrach is young farmer from Hovuni village. He is involved in cattle breeding and land cultivation.

Specifically he keeps 7 cows, 25 sheep, a pig, 30 chickens and 50 colonies of bees. Hrach also cultivates potato and wheat and sells the gathered harvest in the local markets. Knowing that the profit from this activity is very important for his family, he does his best to maximize his profits and ensure for them a better life. 

Hrach has applied for this loan to purchase seeds for cultivation. The loan is very important for him to be able to gather a good harvest and increase his income.

Hrach lives with his wife, son and daughter and does his best to ensure better living conditions for them.

loans.use: to buy seeds for cultivation

loans.name: Gianella Vanessa

texts.es:
La Sra. Gianella Vive en Playas, ella tiene 26 años de edad. Ella empezó con hace 7 años, con un préstamo familiar decidió establecer un pequeño negocio, poco a poco fue aumentando sus ventas hasta llegar a tener abundante clientela con la venta de su ropa.

La Clienta se levanta a las 6:00 de la mañana deja a sus hijos en la escuela y de ahí sale a recorrer con su mercadería. Ella no ha tenido ningún inconveniente en su trabajo y con la ayuda de Dios va progresando en su negocio día a día. Ella no tiene esposo es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, uno de 6 y 5 años de edad, y estudian en escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo ella va a comprar Sabanas, edredones, vitrina  para la venta de su ropa. Ella desea en el futuro que sus hijos terminen la universidad y sean profesionales, de esta forma todo el esfuerzo que ella realiza no sea en vano.
texts.en:
Gianella lives in Playas, and she is 26 years old.  She started her business 7 years ago, when she started up a small business with a loan from relatives.  She's been gradually increasing her sales, and now she has lots of customers in her clothing business.

Gianella gets up at 6am to take her children to school, and from there she goes out with her merchandise.  She has not had any problems with her work, and with the help of God she is making progress with the business each day.  She is not married; she is the single mother of 2 children, aged 6 and 5, who attend public school.

With this loan, Gianella will buy sheets, comforters, and a glass display case for the clothing she sells.  In the future, she wants her children to get a university degree and become professionals.  In this way, all of her efforts will not be in vain.

loans.use: to buy sheets, shirts, pants, comforters, and other merchandise

loans.name: Noe Cristobal

texts.es:
El Señor Noé vive en Playas, el tiene 45 años de edad. El Sr. Noé tiene aproximadamente 7 años en el negocio. Comenzó trabajando en una fábrica, hasta que decidió tener su propio negocio de venta de legumbres, poco a poco creció y con el pasar de los años fue adquiriendo buena clientela. El se levanta a las 6:00 de la mañana y se dirige a su puesto de trabajo en el mercado de playas donde es bien reconocido por sus productos.

El no posee dificultades en su trabajo y con la ayuda de Dios sigue avanzando. El no está casado es soltero,  y tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 7 años de edad, que estudian en escuela y colegio fiscal.

Con el préstamo el va a comprar: legumbres, un congelador para poner los productos, y varios.
Sus sueños para un futuro so poder crecer su negocio para tener más ingresos económicos, contar con el capital necesario para poner otro puesto de legumbres y de esta forma tener otra fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Noe lives in Playas, and he is 45 years old.  He has about 7 years of experience with his business.  He started out working in a factory until he decided to start his own business selling vegetables.  Gradually, over the years, he has been acquiring a good customer base.  He gets up at 6 each morning and goes to his sales post in a market in Playas that is well-known for its products.

Noe has no difficulties with his work, and with the help of God he will continue to make progress.  He is not married; he has 2 children aged 12 and 7 who attend a public middle and elementary school.

With this loan, Noe will buy: vegetables, a freezer to store his products, and other items.

Noe's dreams for the future include growing his business so that he can increase his income, and having the capital to set up another vegetable stand.  This way he could have another source of income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, a freezer, etc.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Esmeralda has been in this business for seven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Esmeralda aspires to save enough to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en: Solange is 34 years old. She works as a tailor and has been a tailor for 10 years. She is very appreciative of her business because has managed to provide for all the basic needs of her family. She wants this loan to inject into her sewing business by buying more fabric to make clothes. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fabric for making clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in avocados, bananas, papaya, and pineapple.

loans.name: Sakti Radharani Self Help Group

texts.en:
Rebati is a 35-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and two children in a small village in Odisha, India. All her children are attending school. She started a photo studio in a good location in the market in her village with the help of her husband 10 years ago. She earns 7,000 INR per month and has been trying to help her husband financially in managing the family's cash flow. 

She provides a variety of services like digital passport size photographs, full sized photographs and video shoots for various auspicious ceremonies like weddings and other functions in the village. She says that showing people beautiful, happy and being part of their happy moments to provide those memories is what she likes the most about her work. She has earned a good name for her studio through her quality work. She has requested a loan to purchase batteries, a tripod, and a camera for her shop.

Rebati, along with her group Sakti Radharani Self Help Group, has applied for a loan of 160,000 INR. She has eight members in her group and all are engaged in different kinds of activities.

loans.use: to purchase batteries, a tripod, and a camera for her photo studio.

loans.name: Katerin

texts.es:
