Katerin, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo pequeño con quien vive en su casa construida a base de adobe .Tiene como principal sustento económico la producción de cacao orgánico , desempeña esta labor gracias unas parcelas que le cedieron sus abuelos con la condición de brindarles un apoyo económico .Como toda labor comercial es necesario contar con capital de trabajo que le permita invertir en los diversos requerimientos que se necesita para extraer cacao de calidad tales como son el deshierbo y el  deschuponado del sembrío razón por la cual contrata a trabajadores del lugar que le ayudaran a realizar estas actividades.
Para complementar sus ingresos posee también plantaciones de plátano, naranja, pan de árbol , entre otros los cuales vende en una feria dominical en la capital de su distrito logrando captar ingresos adicionales a su actividad principal .Tiene como objetivo a largo plazo iniciar la construcción de su vivienda así como la apertura de un pequeño negocio consistente en la venta de diversa variedad de frutas que producen sus parcelas.Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva motivo y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .Katerin desea contar con S/.3,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico ya que de esta manera sus sembríos daran buenos frutos .
texts.en:
Katerin is 36 years old. She is a single mother and has a small son, with whom she lives in a house made of adobe. Her main financial support is the production of organic cacao. She does this work thanks to some parcels of land that her grandparents gave her on the condition that she provide them with some financial support. As with all commercial labor, it is necessary to have working capital that allows her to invest in the various things that are needed to extract quality cacao, such as weeding and suckering the crops. She contracts with day laborers who help her to do these activities.

To supplement her income, she also has, among others, banana, orange, and breadfruit plantings. She sells these at the Sunday fair in her district's capital, succeeding in gaining income in addition to her main activity. Her long-term goal is to start building her home as well as to open a small business selling the different varieties of fruit that her land produces. This is her first Kiva loan, and she promises to make her repayments in a punctual manner. Katerin would like to have 3,000 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizer, since this way her crops will yield good fruit.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Utulivu Group

texts.en:
Utulivu Group is located in Kakamega North District. It is a group of nine women and two men led by Beatrice who is pictured on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of millet and sorghum cultivation. Beatrice first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Beatrice joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and to use the increased profits to send her children to school.

Beatrice reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about one bag of maize per ½ acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested two bags per 1/2 acre! She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and save for the future. Beatrice’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for 5 1/2 acres of millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Leri

texts.en: Leri, 54 years old, is from the small village of Khashuri district. He is married and lives with his wife, two sons, a daughter-in-law and an infant granddaughter. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have three milk cows, whose milk is used in dairy products. In addition, they have 1.4 hectares of agricultural land where maize, potatoes and haricot are grown. The harvested products are sold locally at a good price. Leri is a very hard working man who has rich experience in his business. He requested a loan for cultivating the land and purchasing the seeds. After the land is cultivated, Leri will purchase seeds and sow haricot, maize and potatoes. He will be able to increase the income of the family. With the increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions. Leri awaits your support.

loans.use: to cultivate the land and purchase seeds for potatoes, haricot and maize

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Concepcion works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling natural medicines in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store, clothing and E-loading businesses. Concepcion is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of natural medicines to sell.

Concepcion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of natural medicines to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marlyn Edith

texts.es: Marlyn con su credikiva hizo compras de materias primas e inusmos y elaboró calzado en diversos diseños y aumentó sus ventas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo finaciamineto y comprará materiales porque planea impactar a su clientela en el mes de mayo, pues fabricará diseños ajustados a la medida de las madres, cuyos hijos o familiares regalaran ese detalle, comprado en el negocio de Marlyn. Por eso dice a sus financiadores :"Gracias por ese apoyo de la microempresa. "
texts.en: With her Kiva loan, Marlyn bought raw materials and supplies, produced shoes of many designs, and increased her sales. Now she is applying for a new loan. She will buy materials, because she plans to make an impression on her customers in the month of May by making designs tailored as gifts for mothers, gifts bought in Marlyn's business. For this reason, she says to her funders, "Thank you for this support of small business."

loans.use: To buy leather materials and by-products, as well as shoe accessories.

loans.name: Carolina Andrea

texts.es:
Carolina Andrea de 38 años de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos menores de edad, de 11,7 años. Es originaria de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central del país. En sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar de actividades recreativa con sus pequeños hijos, como jugar en el parque; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, por la pobreza extrema en la que vivía su familia. En la actualidad sus sueños y sus metas es poder formar a sus pequeños hijos, en profesionales, y brindarles un futuro mejor.
Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos para bebes como: baberos, edredones de cuna, jugos de sabana de cuna, lava pachas, ropa de bebe, mosquitero para cuna, protector de cuna, bolsos para bebe, mantillas, pachas. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en unos de los mercados de la localidad. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto ya que ha sido la forma de vida y sustento de sus hijos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos de bebe, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Carolina Andrea agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Carolina Andrea, age 38, is a single mother with two children, ages 11 and 7.  She is from Managua, which is located in the central part of the country.  In her free moments, she enjoys engaging in recreational activities with her small children, like playing in the park.  Unfortunately, for lack of economic resources, she could not attend university, and has felt obligated to work from a very young age, because of the extreme poverty in which her family lived.  Currently, her dreams and goals are to be able to enable her small children to become professionals and to offer them a better future.

Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and her desire to succeed, she has a job selling products for babies such as: bibs, baby blankets, cradles, toys, baby clothes, mosquito nets, crib sheets, baby bags, bottles and bottle cleaners.  Her business is located in one of the local markets. She works at her business about 12 hours every day, offering her products and she has worked with joy and gratitude since this has been her way of life and her way of providing for her children.  

The goal of this loan is to invest in capital to stock her business by purchasing and selling baby products, so that in the not too distant future, she can obtain a better income.  Carolina Andrea is grateful for the support that the Kiva investors have offered to people with scarce resources from poor countries like Nicaragua in order that they have a means of working with dignity.

loans.use: to invest in capital for her work by purchasing and selling baby products such as bibs, baby blankets, cradles, toys, baby clothes, mosquito nets, crib sheets, baby bags, bottles and bottle cleaners.

loans.name: Ngunya

texts.en:
Ngunya is a 64-year-old married mother of four children.  She is a farmer in Kangundo town.  There, she rears dairy cows for the sale of milk and plants cash crops for sale at the market (maize, beans, and vegetables).  She has been in this business for the past seven years and it has been profitable.

This is her first loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy farm inputs, including fertilizer and seedlings.  She anticipates generating more profits from the sale of her harvest and this will help her to pay school fees for her children.  She hopes to grow her farming business by buying more dairy cows.  This will enable her to make more income and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, seeds, and insecticide.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is married and works hard to support her family.  She has a charcoal business in the Philippines and earns additional income selling soft drinks.  Caridad is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Caridad has been sustaining her business activities through NWTF (past 19 loans) and, more recently, through Kiva.  She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of building and expanding her business for the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is 35 years. He grows cabbage and kale on his farm, and supplies them to his customers in Thika town. He is married to Alice; they are blessed with one child.  Nathan has been farming for the past four years, and has a monthly income of KES 13,500.

This is his fourth loan with KADET LTD, and he intends to use it to purchase cabbage seedlings and fertilizer.  He will use the profits to educate his child. 

His hopes and dreams are to have his own piece of land, and purchase a motorcycle to aid him in transporting his cabbages with ease.

loans.use: to purchase cabbage seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Batacoka

texts.en: Batacoka is 38 years old.  He is a father of four children between the ages of 9 and 12 years old.  Only two attend school, as the others are still young.  He runs a hair-cutting salon and has been in the business for five years.  With the loan, he wants to buy more hair cutting equipment to use in the salon. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy extra hair-cutting equipment.

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan, 28, is married with three children; he lives in Gaza.  He has owned a fruit and vegetable stall since 2011.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy a small automobile, and a balance (a scale to weigh the fruits and vegetables).

Marwan hopes this loan will help him decrease his transportation costs and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a small automobile and a balance.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 31-year-old married man. He has two children with ages ranging from 2 years to 8 years. He describes himself as an honest man. He operates a van to provide transportation services. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located within an urban area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to purchase spare parts for his van. His business goal is to own another van within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM after managing to repay previous loans of KES 10,000 and 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his van.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Madera, triplex, pintura, disolventes, clavos y accesorios, es lo que planea comprar Javier, con su crdikiva  al cual está aplicando y es el primer financiamineto que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual requiere para producir, juegos de sala, comedor, de alcobas, puertas y closets. Javier es un hombre casado padre de 3 hijos adultos que organizó su propio taller de ebanistería en el patio de su casa, donde tambien funciona un pequeño almacen tipo miscelanea de propiedad de su esposa. El aprendió el oficio de ebanisteria desde muy joven pues su padre tambien trabajó la carpinteria. En la actualidad no tien empleados pero en años anteriores logró tener 20 pues manejaba contratos con diversas construcciones. La superviviencia de su negocio, muy competido, ha sido gracias a la calidad con la cual trabaja, pues en su taller solo cuenta con los mejores materias primas e inusmos, lo que hace que su producto tenga un acabado de calidad y que la imagen de su negocio se extienda positivamente.
texts.en: Wood, plywood, paint, solvents, nails, and accessories are what Javier plans to buy with the Kiva credit which he is applying for.  It is the first funding he has sought with the Foundation of Mario Santo Domingo which he requires to be able to produce living room, dining room, and bedroom sets, as well as doors and closets.  Javier is a married man and father of three grown children that organized his own cabinet-making workshop in the patio of his home.  This also functions as a small storeroom for his wife's miscellaneous items.  He learned this cabinetry work when he was very young, as his father also did woodworking.  Currently, he has no employees, but in the past he managed to have up to 20 and managed contracts for various builds.  The survival of his business, which is highly competitive, has been thanks to the quality of his work.  In his workshop he only stocks the best materials and supplies which ensures that his products have a quality finish and that the image of his business is viewed positively.

loans.use: to buy wood, plywood, paint, solvents, nails, and accessories.

loans.name: Battsengel

texts.en: Battsengel is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Tosontsengel in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife, Erdenetsetseg, age 38, works as an interior designer in a local company but is temporarily unable to work because of a health condition. His daughters Uuganchimeg, age 15, and Odonchimeg, age 13, go to the local school. Battsengel has been running a taxi service business in town since 2000. He has a lot of experience in the business. His car has been broken down for a while and he is unable to provide a taxi service. He is now requesting a loan of 2,300,000 MNT to purchase spare parts for his car and also to pay for his wife's medical treatment. He is a hardworking, helpful and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his car and to pay for his wife's medical treatment

loans.name: Saida's Group

texts.en:
Saida's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Saida is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom currently attend school. For the past two years, Saida has been working hard to manage her small hotel, which sells meals. 

To help expand her business, Saida has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food for the hotel to sell, and will help Saida to generate greater profits and help in paying school fees for herself. Saida hopes that in the future she will be able to improve her small hotel to a very good standard. 

Saida is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy food to sell in her hotel.

loans.name: Safari Group

texts.en:
Justus is pictured on the right with his hand raised amongst his Safari Group members. The 12 of them, 10 women and 2 men, are farmers in Kakamega North District. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of millet and sorghum. Justus joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Justus joined One Acre Fund so that he could access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Justus was only able to harvest three bags of maize per acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, he was able to harvest five bags per acre! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and buy a cow. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Justus’ group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on six acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 44 years old, is married and has four children. She sells cereals such as maize, beans, wheat and sorghum in Tala town and has been in the business for the past six years. She also has a maize mill; selling the maize flour has been profitable, enabling her to provide for the needs of her family.

This being her sixth loan term, she plans to buy more stock of cereals to sell. These include maize and beans as well as wheat. She will also use part of the amount to repair her maize mill machine. She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to expand her business by opening another cereals business and thus make more income.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cereals and to repair her maize mill

loans.name: Ciriaca

texts.en: This time, Ciriaca is borrowing 15,000 PHP in order to buy more groceries for her general store business. The food production business that she previously funded through NWTF and Kiva continues to provide for Ciriaca and her family with an increased income to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her general store.

loans.name: Shamsiddin

texts.ru: Шамсиддин простой и отзывчивый молодой человек. Он  заботливый отец пятерых детей и любящий муж. С самого раннего детство занимается скотоводством. Его дедушка и отец были мясниками. Шамсиддин также продолжил дело своих отцов и стал мясником. Своим делом дополнительно зарабатывает на жизнь. Так как он имеет большую семью ему приходится одновременно заниматься несколькими делами. И он умело совмещает скотоводство, мясничество и также занимается дехканским хозяйством. Вот уже 25 лет Шамсиддин занимается скотоводством. В основном разводит, откармливает и продаёт крупнорогатый и мелкорогатый скот. Этим получает свой основной доход, которое тратит на жильё, учебу детей и проживание. Шамсиддин с женой стараются также отложить на поступление детей в ВУЗ. Пользуясь случаем и сезонностью он хочет приобрести дополнительно корову и корм для скота. Но не хочет трогать свои сбережения, так как  заново копить денег будет тяжело, а дети уже подросли. В надежде на помощь и поддержку Шамсиддин обратился в «Арванд» за кредитом. Он очень надеется, что сможет реализовать все свои планы.
texts.en: Shamsiddin is simple and helpful young man.  He is a caring father of five children and a loving husband.  For the last 25 years, from his early childhood, he has worked as a rancher.  His grandfather and father were butchers.  Shamsiddin continues on in the footsteps and also became a butcher.  This allows him to earn extra income.  Since he has a large family, he needs to have multiple sources of income.  He skillfully combines breeding, butchery, and farming activities. Basically, he breeds, raises and sells cattle.  This is his main source of income that provides for his family, his children's education and general living expenses.  Shamsiddin and his wife try also to set aside for their children's univeristy tuition.  Using his experience and seasoned skills, he would like to buy an additional cow and feed for his cattle.  But he doesn't not want to use his savings since it will be difficult to rebuild them.  He turned to Arvand for a loan to help.  He hopes his plans come to fruition.

loans.use: for the purchase of a cow and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: rebuild his capital by buying bed linens to resell.

loans.name: Jira

texts.en:
Jira lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and owns a cafe, which he has been running for a year. He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are competition and the effect of season changes. 

Jira is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenya shillings to buy food stock, such as rice, cereals, wheat flour and cooking fat. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay school fees for his child and improve on his living standard. His dream is to open another cafe.

loans.use: To buy food stock, such as rice, cereals, wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married lady aged 42 years. She is also a happy mother of three children who are aged between 21 and 12 years old. She sells both new and used clothing and has been in the business for a period of 13 years, earning an income of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings).

She is now seeking her second loan of 50,000 KES from KADET LTD., and wishes to use this amount to pay school fees for her child. The profits that she earns from her business will be used to repay the loan.

Her dream is educate her children and also develop her plot of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm fruit and palm kernel to extract more palm oil for sale.

loans.name: Neli

texts.en:
Neli is 49 years old. She lives in Tsablovana village, Khashuri district with husband, Suliko, and two children (21-year-old Mariam and 28-year-old Vazha). Neli requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. They have one milk cow and a plot of land, where wheat is grown. Neli is milking the cow to make cheese and sells it with the harvested wheat locally at the markets. In addition, Mariam and Vazha are getting social pensions from the government as they are invalids. Neli and Suliko are very hardworking people, trying to earn a monthly income to provide all the needed conditions for their children. 

Neli requested loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Neli will purchase seed for maize, haricot and barley and also fix their tractor. They have an unused plot of land which will be cultivated and used for planting the seeds. Harvested products will be sold locally at the markets. Neli hopes that developing her agricultural business will increase her monthly income. This will help the family to have better living conditions, and Neli and her husband will be able to look after their children better.

loans.use: To purchase seed for maize, haricot and barley and also fix the tractor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a concrete slab.

loans.name: Donatille

texts.en:
Donatille is a 45-year-old woman from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking a top-up loan of $50 to purchase an additional 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.

Donatille started selling lights in July 2012 and she has sold 50 lights to date, providing clean energy to 250 people. She is also a farmer and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri is 43 years old and from a small village of Kareli district. He is married and lives with his wife, two children, his sister and his father. His father is provided with a retirement pension. Badri has a minibus and serves local people in transport and earns money. Besides that, Badri is also involved in an agricultural business. In particular, he has a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. Badri’s wife is milking the cow and produces cheese for selling at local markets. Badri has 7.5 hectares of agricultural land, where different kinds of fruits and vegetables are grown. Badri cultivates the land by his tractor seasonally. They sell the harvested products locally. 

Badri is a very hardworking man and does his best to insure a good harvest. He requested a loan for purchasing a milking cow and two calves for expanding the cattle. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions. Badri awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow and two calves.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a married lady, aged 26 years, who is supporting three of her children aged between 3 and 8. 

She slaughters livestock and sells the meat in Kapsabet, and has been in operation for a period of four years while earning an income of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) monthly.

She is servicing her first loan of 30,000 KES with KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to purchase livestock for slaughter. The profits she earns from her business will be used to repay the loan and form the upkeep of her family.  

Her dream is to become successful in her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for slaughter.

loans.name: Aida Ibelia

texts.es:
AIDA  tiene 44 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los sobrinos en el Cantón Cjhillanes provincia de Bolívar.

Pertenece a la VRC SAN JUAN BAUTISTA se encuentra formada y creada en la ciudad de Tambanal a una distancia de 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperatva, La actividad económica es la agricultura, crianza de animales.

 AIDA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol,además se dedica a la crianza de ganado y cerdos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar ganado. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar el ganado. La compra la realizará en Chillanes.

El sueño es tener casa y terrenos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el mal clima y la producción. En el tiempo libre le gusta asear, ir al pueblo y visitar a los familiares.
texts.en:
Aida is 44 and single with no children. She lives with her nephews in the Chillanes canton of Bolívar province. 

She belongs to the communal bank San Juan Bautista, which is formed and created in the city of Tambanal, 40 minutes from the office of the cooperative. The economic activity is in agriculture, raising animals. 

Aida is a farmer who plants corn and beans, in addition to raising cattle and pigs. She is requesting the loan to purchase more livestock. With the support of the loan, she will be able to make the purchase. She will buy the livestock from Chillanes. 

Her dream is to have her own house and land. The obstacles she faces are the bad climate and production. In her free time, she likes to clean, go to town, and visit relatives.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Central Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CENTRAL” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta y producción de leche, tienda de barrio, crianza y venta de ganado, producción y venta de queso, tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que es el primer ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de papa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace años de su familia, actualmente lo sigue desarrollando como fuente de economía.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semilla) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “CENTRAL” communal bank will start its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Patacamaya regional office. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a Board with Virginia as the President. The businesses run by the members of the communal bank are varied. Among them are: sale and production of milk, corner shop, raising and selling cattle, production and sale of cheese, knitting blankets.

The loan they take out will benefit small micro businesses where Virginia is a member. She points out that it's her first cycle as a member of Pro Mujer. She joined by invitation from a promoter of the institution who visited her at home. Currently she has a potato production business; she says that she learned this business years ago from her family. At the moment she is continuing to develop it as a source of income.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase the capital (to buy seed) which she will get from the sellers of the city of La Paz, and after the production she will sell it to order. This type of work allows her to generate income to maintain her home as much as possible. She lives in a common law marriage and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training in health and loans.

loans.use: to buy seed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: replenish her capital by buying shoes and clothes for resale to continue to earn a living.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: replenish her capital by buying shoes and clothes for resale to continue to earn a living.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: replenish her capital by buying palm oil for resale, to continue to earn a living.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: replenish his capital by purchasing plumbing equipment (pipes), irons, stoves, ... for resale, to earn his living.

loans.name: Cresenciana

texts.en:
Cresenciana is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from hog raising. Cresenciana is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more items like soft drinks, frozen foods and other groceries for her general store business.

Cresenciana has been sustaining her business activities through the past 16 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like soft drinks, frozen foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as a good man. He operates a retail store where he sells timber. Antony has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located within a busy business environment, and his primary customers are local residents. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of timber. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy timber to sell. His business goal is to run another timber yard business within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. Previously he managed to pay a loan of KES 50,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy timber to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm fruit and palm kennel to extract.

loans.name: Temur

texts.en: Temur is 23 years old. He lives with his father in a small village in the Kareli district. Temur and his father are involved in agricultural activities. They have 1.5 hectare of agricultural land, where cherry trees are grown. They sell the harvested cherry locally. Temur is very hard working and works hard with his father to insure a good harvest. He requested a loan to purchase 8 calves. After purchasing the calves, they will raise them and sell the meat at local markets. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Temur awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase eight calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase palm fruit to extract oil and also bags of maize to produce kenkey.

loans.name: Eresi's Group

texts.en:
Eresi's group is comprised of two hard working women. Eresi is 25 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, two of which are currently in school. For the past 3 years, Eresi has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells rice, sugar and busiquetes.
To help expand her business, Eresi has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items such as rice to sell, and will help Eresi generate greater profits and provide her family with their basic needs. Eresi hopes that in the future she will be able to own a wholesale shop.
Eresi is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more items such as rice to sell.

loans.name: Sharambatsa Group

texts.en:
Jacob’s group has 12 farmers and is located in Kakamega North. Jacob is pictured on the right of the Shirambatsa Group with his hand raised. Jacob is pictured amongst the 2 men and 10 women of his group. He will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum and millet. Jacob joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2009, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Jacob joined One Acre Fund so that he could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for his family.

Jacob described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to buy a cow and send his children to school. Jacob’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 6 acres of millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of  millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 34 years old, married, and blessed with three children aged 16, 13 and 13 years. She buys and sells fruits and vegetables as her source of daily living.  She has been in the business for a period of five years now getting an income of KES 10,000.

She is now servicing her first loan of KES 30,000 with KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase varieties of fruits and vegetables to resell.  The profits she gets will be used to plough back business and repay the loan.

Her dream is to live happily with her family and also succeed in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with seven children, five of which go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grand children). She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,800,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT SACCO of buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from a food stall, a bar and also selling firewood. She works from her home seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to own a delivery van to ease in transportation, and hopes to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying for electricity and water, school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Leyli

texts.en:
Leyli is from Lusaghbyur village and is involved in agriculture. She lives with her husband and four children (three daughters and a son). Leyli, together with her husband, keeps livestock which currently includes six cows, 18 sheep, four pigs and 40 chickens. She also owns agricultural land where she cultivates wheat. Her husband Grigor sells the gathered harvest in the local markets and gets income, which is hardly enough for covering such a big family's daily costs.

Leyli has applied for this loan to purchase agricultural machinery for pressing the grass. As their agricultural machinery is very old, it is very important for Leyli to purchase new machinery and make the cultivation process more effective.

Leyli and Grigor do their best to ensure a better life for their children.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural machinery for pressing the grass.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her native delicacies.

Cristita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her native delicacies business.

NWTF is re-listing Cristita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Silvia Yadira

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una colonia de la ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Silvia tien un negocio de una pequeña pulperia en donde vende productos de granos basicos, golosinas, dulces.  Ademas como otro ingreso extra elabora pan para la venta.tiene un año de trabajar en este negocio,y de alli ha podido ayudar a su familia con los gastos.
esta solicitando un prestamo de 4,500 lempiras para comprar productos como harina, azucar, manteca, arroz, dulces para surtir el negocio, ademas comprara algunos insumos que necesita para la elaboracion del pan.
La meta a seguir es aumentar su negocio con los financiamientos de credito que adquiera,y tener mas ingresos para darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Silvia is 35 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives in a colony in the city of San Pedro Sula.
Silvia has a a small grocery store where she sells products such as basic grains and sweets. She also makes and sells bread to add to her income. She has had this business for a year and with it she has been able to help the family with household costs.
Silvia is applying for a loan of 4500 Lempira in order to buy products, such as sugar, butter, rice and sweets, to stock up her business. In addition she will buy some supplies that she needs for making bread.
Silvia's goal is to expand her business with the loans that she receives, and earn a high income so that she can provide a better quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to buy products, such as flour, rice, butter and sweets, to stock up her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to continue her first semester studying nursing with Campoalto.

loans.name: Edgar Manuel

texts.es:
EDGAR  tiene 22 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

EDGAR se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos porcinos. Solicita el crédito para comprar cerdos, polbillo, vacunas. Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar lo que necesita. 

Las compras las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes. El sueño es mejorar la crianza de cerdos y estabilizarce esconomicamente. Los deafíos a los que se enfrenta esa incrementar el negocio.

 En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar deportes.
texts.en:
Edgar is 22 years old. He is single and has no children. He lives with his parents in the district of Chillanes, in the Bolívar province.

Edgar makes a living raising and selling pigs. He is applying for this loan to buy pigs, leather and vaccinations and with it he will be able to buy what he needs. 

Edgar will make the purchases in the Chillanes district. Edgar's dream is improve the pig raising business and become financially stable. The challenge he is facing is trying to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy pigs, leather and vaccinations.

loans.name: Nuri

texts.es:
Nuri, de 32 años de edad, esta casada con Rildo y junto a él tiene 02 hijos de 07 y 04 años de edad respectivamente , vive a lado de ellos en su casa propia.
La actividad que realiza Nuri es la venta de abarrotes, por esta razón estableció su negocio en su propia casa en donde tiene instalado los muebles necesarios para exhibir todos los productos que pone a la venta como leche, huevos, enlatados, harinas, fideos, entre otros. Todos los días atiende a su clientela desde muy temprano con mucha cordialidad y amabilidad. Trabaja en éste negocio desde hace 04 años y algunas veces recibe el apoyo de su esposo.Le agrada sus actividades ya que le permiten tener una ocupación en casa y tener tiempo libre para poder atender a  sus hijos, se siente bien generando ingresos adicionales que le permiten apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Por otro lado, viendo que le está yendo bien con su negocio tiene planes de continuar desarrollándolo e incrementar la variedad de sus productos. Este es el crédito número 03 con Kiva, es por eso que agradece el apoyo financiero que se le brinda para continuar realizando su trabajo con mejores resultados , por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000 soles comprará los abarrotes que  tienen mayor demanda entre sus clientes como arroz, azúcar, huevos y leche.
texts.en:
Nuri is 32 years old and is married to Rildo, with whom she has two children aged seven and four.  She lives with them in her own home.

Nuri works selling groceries, and for this reason she set up a store in her own home with the necessary equipment to show off all the products for sale such as milk, eggs, canned goods, flour, and pasta. She serves customers every day from early in the morning in a friendly and polite manner. She has worked in the store for the past four years, and is sometimes helped out by her husband. 

She enjoys her job, as it allows her to work from home and gives her free time to look after her children. Making extra money so she can help her husband with household expenses makes her feel good. In addition, seeing as her business is going well, she plans to continue developing and selling a wider variety of products.

This is her third loan with Kiva, and she is grateful for the financial support provided so that she can keep working with better results. She is also committed to making her loan repayments on time. She will use the loan to buy best-selling groceries with her customers such as rice, sugar, eggs and milk.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as sugar, milk, rice and eggs.

loans.name: Janet Kaniki

texts.en:
Janet is a single woman. She has been operating a retail store where she provides M-pesa (mobile phone money transfer) services for the last four years as a Safaricom Agent. 

Previously, she took a loan of KES 20,000 which she managed to pay back successfully. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. She plan to use the loan of KES 40,000 as M-pesa float for the M-pesa services. Janet looks forward in the future to expanding her business.

loans.use: to add a float to her M-pesa service.

loans.name: La Dicha Group

texts.es:
Rebeca es una mujer de 60 años, es soltera y se esfuerza cada día por llevar el sustento a su hijo de 16 años que está cursando la secundaria. Rebeca nació en un hogar con escasos recursos económicos, por lo que se educó en la escuela primaria, nació en Macará – Ecuador, por circunstancias ajenas a su voluntad,  ahora reside junto con su pareja e hijo en el Cantón Los Bancos en la zona rural de la Provincia de Pichincha en el Ecuador. En este cantón se puede encontrar varios lugares para visitar como ríos y bosques que son visitados por varios turistas, quienes al coincidir en las fiestas del cantón pueden experimentar las exposiciones de artesanías y las ferias donde se exponen productos agrícolas y también ganado que son animales que conforman la riqueza de muchos habitantes. Estas actividades combinadas con el comercio han dado la oportunidad a la empresa privada para construir hoteles, hosterías y varias ofertas de servicios para turistas. Sin embargo la principal actividad de este pueblo es la agricultura y ganadería que cada año permiten que el índice de rendimiento económico suba cada año a pesar de la poca transferencia de tecnología al lugar. En medio de llanuras, paisajes y montañas, los habitantes de este lugar aprovechan cada oportunidad o necesidad de los visitantes y de quienes les rodean para llevar a cabo sus ideas de negocio que cada día crecen y aportan al crecimiento del sector. 
Rebeca trabaja desde hace varios años en su tienda de artículos de primera necesidad. Aprendió con la experiencia de su familia y ahora quiere incrementar su negocio comprando productos que surtan su oferta. Ella sueña con algún día poder comprar un terreno que le permita dedicarse a la crianza de pollos. Para esto ella trabaja cada día atendiendo su tienda hasta 14 horas diarias desde que sale el sol hasta la noche. Aunque la competencia es grande, Rebeca espera que sus ingresos aumenten y así mejorar el estilo de vida de su hogar. Conjuntamente con Rebeca se han unido familiares amigos quienes poseen el mismo espíritu emprendedor de ella y desean sobresalir en sus actividades de negocio. Así se describe a Alba y Florinda; quienes se dedican a la crianza de pollos para su posterior comercialización y cada una espera incrementar sus ingresos comprando pollos, balanceado y mejorando los criaderos. Florinda tiene 2 hijos que estudian y es soltera, tiene 37 años.  Alba en cambio tiene ya 56 años y no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar y ha atravesado muchos obstáculos por su analfabetismo, tiene 2 hijos adolescentes que estudian. Otra de las integrantes de este grupo es Laura de 31 años que tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 6 años, es soltera y se dedica a la venta de plátanos y choclos asados en un puesto que instala en medio de la calle. La dificultad más grande que tiene cada día es trasladar su parrilla, mesa y recipientes desde el lugar de venta hasta su casa. Utilizará el préstamo para comprar herramientas e insumos que mejoren su trabajo.  Estas mujeres se han unido para conseguir un crédito en Fundación Alternativa en donde aparte de confianza y agilidad, recibieron de su ejecutivo herramientas importantes para el crecimiento de sus negocios. Agradecen la intervención de Kiva para que alrededor del mundo se sumen personas para hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 60 years old, is not married, and works hard every day to support her 16 year old child who is in high school. Rebeca was born to a poor family, and so she left education after primary school, for reasons beyond her control. She was born in Macará, Ecuador, and now lives with her partner and son in Los Bancos Cantón in a rural area of the Province of Pichincha. There are many places to visit in this Canton, such as rivers and forests, which attract many tourists. If these tourists visit during the regional festivals, they can see handicraft exhibitions and fairs with agricultural produce and livestock, which contribute to the livelihoods of many inhabitants. These activities, combined with trade, have provided private business opportunities in the form of hotels, hostels, and various tourism services.

However, the principal activity of this area is agriculture and livestock, which allow the rate of economic performance to increase every year, despite the lack of technology in the region. In the midst of meadows, countryside and mountains, the inhabitants of this place make the most of every opportunity or the needs of visitors and neighbors to turn their continuous business ideas into reality, which contributes to the growth of the sector. 

Rebeca has worked for several years in her grocery store. She learned this trade from her family and now wants to grow her business, buying new stock. She has a dream that, one day, she will be able to buy a plot of land to raise chickens. It is for this reason that she works in her store every for up to 14 hours at a time, from sunrise to night. Although there is a lot of competition, Rebeca hopes to increase her profits and improve her family's standard of living. 

Friends with the same enterprising spirit who want to succeed in their business activities have joined her. Their names are Alba and Florinda, and they work raising chickens to sell and hope to increase their earnings buying chickens and chicken feed, and making improvements to their cages. Florinda has two children who study, is single, and is 37 years old. Alba, meanwhile, is 56, never had the chance to study, and has overcome many hurdles due to her illiteracy. She has two teenage children who study. 

Another member of this group is Laura, who is 31 years old and has two children aged 17 and six. She is single and makes a living selling bananas and corn on a stall in the street. The biggest challenge she faces every day is to transport her barbeque, table and containers from her stall to her home. She will use the loan to buy tools and supplies to improve her work. 

These women have come together to request a loan from Fundación Alternativa, where, apart from trust and flexibility, they have received important tools to grow their businesses. They are grateful for Kiva's help enabling people around the world to make their dreams reality.

loans.use: to increase the stock of products in their business.

loans.name: Gil Roberto

texts.es:
El Señor Gil vive en Playas, el tiene 54 años de edad. El  cliente lleva emprendiendo  esta labor  desde hace 33 años, comenzó como ayudante de su  vecino el cual era  mecánico eso le ayudo mucho para luego poder independizarse, y así tener un trabajo para el sustento de su familia.

El se dedica al servicio mecanico, de lunes a Sábado de las 9:00 de la mañana hasta las 5:00 de la tarde, el nos cuenta que no ha tenido ninguna dificultad en su negocio. El cliente está casado, su esposa es ama de casa, tiene una hija que estudia en una escuela fiscal.
 
El préstamo el lo va a utilizar para poder comprar repuestos para uso de su negocio. Sus sueño son mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Gil is 54 years old and lives in Playas. He started in this line of work at the age of 33 when he took a job as an assistant for a neighbor who was a mechanic. Gil learned a great deal and later became independent. He now works in order to support his family.

Gil works as a service mechanic Monday through Saturday from 9:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. He says that he has not experienced any difficulties in his business. Gil is married and his wife is a homemaker. They have a daughter who is attending a state school.

His loan will be used to buy spare parts that he can use in his business. His dream is to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Santa Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: La Sra. Santa Teresa tiene 40 años, es esposa, madre y abuela. Junto con la ayuda de su esposo han podido salir adelante; los dos aportan dinero para cubrir sus necesidades y ambos se apoyan para cualquier cosa que emprendan. Ella siempre le ha importado el bienestar de sus hijos y sus nietos, por eso le ayuda a su hija a vender  ropa usada para poder cubrir los gastos escolares de sus nietos. Ella es una persona que ama a su familia y siempre quiere brindarle seguridad sobre todo a sus nietos, es por eso que necesita ayuda por medio de kiva para poder cambiar cables eléctricos en su vivienda; ya que están muy dañados y no le gustaría que ocurriera alguna tragedia a sus hijos o sus nietos cuando van de visita.
texts.en:
Sra. Santa Teresa is 40 years old. She is a wife, a mother, and a grandmother. Santa Teresa and her husband have been able to help one another get ahead. The two of them earn money to provide for their needs and to fund any venture they wish to undertake. The welfare of her children and grandchildren has always been important to her. For this reason, she helps her daughter sell used clothing so that they can pay for the school expenses of her grandchildren.

Santa Teresa is a woman who loves her family and always wants to provide security for all of her grandchildren. For this reason, she needs assistance from Kiva so that she can replace the electrical cables in her home. They have been severely damaged and she would like to avoid an accident from happening whenever her children or grandchildren visit.

loans.use: to replace the electrical cables in her home.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge de 35 años de edad , esta casado y tiene un pequeño hijo con quienes reside en una pequeña vivienda construida a base de adobe .Jorge se dedica al servicio de taxi aunque inicialmente se desempeñaba en diversas labores eventuales ya que no encontraba un trabajo estable , pero despues optó por incursionar en el rubro del transporte iniciándose como chofer de unidades diversas empresas hasta que logró adquirir su primer vehículo y dedicarse integramente a transportas personas a diversos puntos fuera de su localidad .Considera su labor una buena oportunidad para generar ingresos económicos para el sustento de su familia aparte de tener buenas amistades del mismo rubro.
A comienzos le era muy complicado tener que soportar varias horas de trabajo constante pero con el tiempo logró hacerlo muy divertido puesto que suele entablar buenas amistades con sus pasajeros logrando así sentirse muy a gusto con su trabajo.Este es su primer crédito con MFP, motivo por el cual muestra su agradecimiento comprometiéndose a ser un cliente muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Jorge Desea contar en esta ocasión con s/.3,000 nuevos soles y realizar un mantenimiento técnico a su vehiculo ya que ha tiene fallas en el motor.
texts.en:
Jorge is 35 years old, married, and has a young child. He lives with his wife and child in a small house built of adobe. Jorge makes a living as a taxi driver. Initially, however, he worked in various temporary jobs as he couldn't find stable work. He later decided to work in transport, starting out as a driver for different businesses until he managed to buy his first car and make a living transporting people to various locations.

He believes that his job provides good opportunities to make money and support his family, and he also has many friends in this business. To begin with, he found it very hard to cope with long working hours but over time, he managed to make it fun, forming solid friendships with his passengers and finally enjoying his job. 

This is his first loan with MFP, and he has shown his gratitude by promising to be a customer who makes his loan repayments on time. On this occasion, Jorge wants 3,000 soles for technical maintenance for his car, because it has engine problems.

loans.use: with car maintenance.

loans.name: Dominga Julia

texts.es:
Doña Dominga tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una colonia de la ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Doña Dominga es muy trabajadora, ya tiene 2 años de tener un negocio de venta de ropa, calzado, carteras. Además como otro ingreso extra ella vende comidas como baleadas y pollo frito con tajadas. Inicio este negocio con fondos propios para obtener los ingresos necesarios para su familia.
Esta solicitando un préstamo de 7,000 lempiras para surtir el negocio, comprara sandalias, ropa, como short, camisetas, aprovechando la temporada veraniega. Con esta inversión aumentara las ventas y sus ingresos serán mejores.
La meta es ayudar a su hijo a finalizar sus estudios, ya que no cuenta con una ayuda paterna.
texts.en:
Doña Dominga is 54 years old and a single mother with three children. She lives in a neighborhood in the city of San Pedro Sula.

Doña Dominga is a hardworking woman. For the past two years, she has managed a business of selling clothes, shoes, and purses. She also earns extra income by selling food, such as “baleadas” (the Honduran version of a burrito) and fried chicken with plantains. Dominga started her business with her own funds so that she could generate needed income for her family.

She is requesting a loan of 7,000 HNL so that she can restock her business. Dominga will buy sandals and clothing, such as shorts and T-shirts, so that she can take advantage of the summer season. With this investment, she will increase her sales and improve her income. Her goal is to help her son finish his studies since she does not receive assistance from the child’s father.

loans.use: to buy shorts, T-shirts, and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Qobiljon

texts.ru: Кобилчон мастер на все руки. Он отлично ладит как с людьми, так и со стройматериалами. Леса под ногами, а шпатель и щетка с краской в руках – он творит красоту. Также Кобилчону легко даётся скотоводство, ведь у него двадцать лет опыта в этом деле. У него жена и двое детей. Как когда то сам не смог получить хорошее образование, теперь хочет, чтобы его дети выросли грамотными. Преследуя эти цели он работает не жалея сил, трудится и зарабатывает на жизнь и на хорошее будущее своих детей и семьи. Он имеет несколько голов баранов. Каждый раз продав одну большую взамен покупал маленького барана и так получал доход. На данный момент в связи с сезонностью не хочет продавать своих овец, так как цены на скот немного упали. Для осуществления своих планов он хочет получить кредит  и приобрести корм и дополнительный скот. Кобилчон очень надеется на помощь со стороны «Кива» и заранее благодарит за содействие.
texts.en: Qobiljon is a jack of all trades. He is as adept at dealing with people as he is with building materials. With the forest at his feet and a palette and paintbrush in his hands, he creates beauty. He is also very skilled in the field of animal husbandry, as he has 20 years of experience raising livestock. He is married and has 2 children. Because he himself was unable to get a good education when he was younger, he now wants his kids to grow up educated.  To achieve his goal, he works very hard, sparing no effort to earn a living and to save for a brighter future for his children and family. He has several head of sheep. Every time he sells an adult sheep, he buys a young one, and in this way, he earns an income. Currently at this point in the season, he does not want to sell his sheep since the prices for livestock have fallen slightly. In order to realise his plans, Qobiljon is seeking a loan to buy livestock and feed. He is really hoping for assistance from Kiva and is thankful in advance for the support.

loans.use: for the purchase of livestock and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to fry and sell.

loans.name: Olivo Floresmilo

texts.es:
Olivo tiene 62 años de edad es casado tiene 8 hijos vive en el cantón de Chillanes de la Provincia Bolívar. 

Olivo pertenecia a la ventanilla rural Progreso Comunitario pero por motivos de desintegración del grupo realiza el crédito solo. 

Olivo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y cacao. Solicita el credito para comprar insumos, urea, insecticidas, plaguisidas. 

Con el apoyo del préstamo podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. Las compras las realizará en Chillanes.El sueño que los cultivos en este año sean buenos. En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el boli.

"Esta muy agradecido por el credito anterior".
texts.en:
Olivo is 62 years old, married, and has eight children. He lives in the canton of Chillanes, which is in Bolívar Province.

Olivo was a member of the Communal Bank “Progreso Comunitario” (Community Progress). However, the group disbanded, so he is requesting a loan on his own. Olivo is a farmer who grows corn and cacao. His loan will be used to buy urea, insecticides, pesticides, and other farming supplies.

With the support of this loan, he will be able to buy what he needs for his farming activities. His purchases are conducted in Chillanes. His dream is to have good crops this year.

In his free time, Olivo enjoys practicing sports, especially volleyball. He says, “I am very grateful for the previous loan.”

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticides, pesticides, and other farming supplies.

loans.name: La Esperanza (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Esperanza esta integrado por 4 mujeres alegres y emprendedoras, que siempre han trabajado fuerte para sacar adelante a sus familias. Ellas decidieron dar este nombre a su grupo ya que tienen la esperanza de que por medio de este credito sus negocios prosperen y puedan ofrecer una mejor vida a sus seres queridos. En la comunidad que se encuentra ubicado este grupo es una region cañera y la principal fuente de trabajo se encuentra en el campo, en la siembra y recoleccion de caña de azucar. 

Maria Luisa es uno de los integrantes de este grupo, solo tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar primaria y esta casada con vicente, ellos tienen un hijos que ya trabaja en el campo como jornalero junto a su padre,  Maria luisa desde hace mas de 11 años con el apoyo de su familia tiene en su hogar una tienda de abarrotes, platica que cuando inicio con su negocio era mas pequeño y solo vendia algunas cosas lo que mas vendia eran refrescos y dulces, con el paso de los años su negocio ha crecido, actualmente vende abarrotes, pollo destazado.

Ella dijo "lo que mas me gusta de mi tienda es que me hace sentir que estoy ayudando a mi familia ha estar mejor economicamente a ir comprando lo que hace falta y tener un ahoro, Gracias a Vision Fund por el prestamo que dara sus frutos con los dias"

un prestamo de Vision Fund le ayudara a comprar  Arroz, Frijo, aceite, sopa, azucar, sal, galletas, arinas, papel de baño, pasta dental, frituras, dulces, productos enlatados, jabon, refrescos, pollo, frutas y verduras para resurtir su negocio.

A futuro le gustaria a doña maria luisa ver mas grande y surtida su tienda con mas clientes para tener mas ganancias.

los demas integrantes del grupo son:
Maura venta de ropa,
Maria del rosario venta de calzado,
Eusebia venta de cosmeticos.
texts.en:
The La Esperanza (Hope) group is made up of four friendly, enterprising women, who have always worked hard to support their families. They decided to give the group this name because they hope that through this loan, their businesses will prosper and they will be able to offer their loved ones a better life. This group lives in a community in a sugar-growing region and the main source of work is in the countryside, planting and harvesting sugar cane.

Maria Luisa is one of the members of this group. She left education after primary school and is married to Vicente. They have a son who works in the countryside as a laborer with his father. With the support of her family, Maria Luisa has run a grocery store for over 11 years. She explains that when she began her business it was smaller and sold just a few items, such as soda and sweets. Over time, her business has grown, and she now sells groceries and chicken.

Ella says that "my favorite thing about the store is that it makes me feel like I'm helping my family financially and we can buy what we need and save. Thank you Vision Fund for the loan that will give results over time".

A loan from Vision Fund will help her to buy rice, beans, oil, soup, salt, biscuits, flour, toilet paper, toothpaste, fried goods, sweets, canned goods, soap, soda, chicken, fruits and vegetables to restock her business. In the future, Maria Luisa wants to grow her store, stock more products, and serve more customers to increase profits.  

The other members of the group are Maura, who sells clothing, Maria Del Rosario, who sells shoes, and Eusebia, who sells cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, soup, salt, biscuits, flour, toilet paper, toothpaste, fried goods, sweets, canned goods, soap, soda, chicken, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Las Malvinas Group

texts.es: Les presento al grupo “LAS MALVINAS” conformado por 10 personas dedicadas a diversas actividades del comercio. Carina  tiene 41 años es conviviente tiene cuatro hijos. Ofrece servicios de sellado de bolsas a una  pequeña empresa llamado Gastón. Actividad que viene realizándolo en su vivienda hace más de un año y medio. Su mayor deseo tener su propio  taller de sellado de bolsas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo que les dio.
texts.en:
The "Las Malvinas" group is made up of ten people who work in various business areas.

Carina 41, is in a common-law marriage and has four children. She offers her bag sealing services to a small company called Gastón. She has been performing this work in her house for more than a year and a half. Her greatest dream is to have her own bag sealing workshop. 

The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan which they have been granted.

loans.use: to buy a bag sealing machine.

loans.name: Eustequia

texts.en:
As a married mother of 6 children, Eustiquia works hard to support her family. She has a food production business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. in order to buy ingredients for her food production business. 

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is a 40-year-old man from Kayonza District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Elias started selling lights in March, 2012, and he has sold 80 lights to date, providing clean energy to 400 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Nathaniel

texts.en:
Nathaniel is a 35-year-old man from Kisumu town center in Kisumu county, which is located in the western part of Kenya. He supports a family of five people. He is married to Evelyn who also provides additional income for the family, and they are blessed with three children who are 10, 5 and 2 years old respectively.

He has been in the transport  business for the last 10 years and makes a monthly income of about KES 10,000. He is taking his first loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle. He will plow the anticipated profit back into the business.

He dreams of having a big business so as to better provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Zula

texts.en:
Zula is a single mother of three children and all three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. 
					 
She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for eight years. She generates additional income through selling piped water. She works from home and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis six days out of every week.  

She has applied for a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to build rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en:
Jovia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom attends school. She is also looking after her sister. She stays with her husband in a rented house with access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent. 

She has been selling green bananas from door to door at retail for the last year, working six days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested for a loan of UGX 200,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more bunches of green bananas for sale. 

Her challenges include seasonality and thieves. Her dream is to be able to own a place where she sells all types of raw food and also to become a wholesaler. She joined MCDT because it helps women who earn low incomes.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like school supplies, snack foods and other groceries.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further improve her business.

Lina has been in this business for 11 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Lina aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like school supplies, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 36 years old and married with two children. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain the business. Flordeliza is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 22-year-old married woman with one daughter who lives in Haja, Yemen. She oversees the financial issues and responsibilities for her daughter. Over time, her house has become very old and needs a quick renovation. The house is vulnerable to falling down at any time. 

It is known that a renovation needs a lot of money. She has started renovating her house, but now she is short of money. She needs to complete the renovation task, so she asked for a youth loan of 100,000 YER to buy construction supplies for her house. She hopes that after the completion of the house renovation, she will feel safe in her house with her family.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Maame Ekua

texts.en:
Maame Ekua is married and has 3 children. She specializes in extracting palm oil which she subsequently sells at Eguafo (near Elmina). She has been doing so for some time now. Her husband is a tailor. Maame Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in caring for their 3 children. 

She will use her loan to buy an increased quantity of palm fruit and palm kernel, allowing her to extract more oil to sell. With the new profits, Maame Ekua plans to expand her business further as well as ensuring that all her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit, allowing her to extract more palm oil.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Agrey

texts.en:
Agrey is a cattle fattener. He began this business because of his background. He was born in a cattle-herding family and therefore gained experience over time and could also easily get clients. 

His clients are people from around the area where he grazes the cattle. 

He is taking the loan to buy more cattle so that he can expand his business. 

His challenges are weather and diseases that affect the cattle during certain seasons. However, he is a hard-working young man who dreams of opening a diary farm in future.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 32 years old from Ramallah. He is married and has four children.

He has owned a car wash place since 2009 and has two employees in the project.

He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy more goods and improve the ground floor of the project. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income and increase his customers.

loans.use: to buy more goods and improve his car-washing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an increased quantity of second-hand cloth.

loans.name: Valijon

texts.ru: Валижон предприниматель, живет в сельской местности. Он занимается откармливанием крупнорогатого скота и имеет большой опыт в этом бизнесе. Кроме этого он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственной продукции. Валижон женат, имеет четверых детей. Дети учатся в школе. Жена  работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Доход, который он и его жена  получают хватает только для семейных расходов. Дети стали взрослыми и они должны учиться в высших учебных заведениях. Надо проводить свадебные мероприятия. Для этого нужны большие деньги и поэтому Валижон обратился в "Арванд" за кредитом. Валижон хочет взять  кредит для покупки скота для дальнейшего расширения поголовья, это даст ему возможность увеличитьь свои доходы и осуществить свои планы.
texts.en: Valijon is a businessman and lives in a rural area. He fattens cattle for a living and has a lot of experience in this field. He also grows agricultural crops. He is married and has 4 children who are in school. His wife works in the farming sector. The combined incomes of Valijon and his wife are only sufficient to cover the family's expenses. The children are growing up, and there will be post-secondary education to be paid for and weddings to be hosted. Covering these costs will require a large outlay of money, and for this reason, Valijon has approached Arvand for a loan. He wants to purchase cattle for the further expansion of his herd which will give him an opportunity to increase his income, and to realise his plans.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Murman

texts.en:
Murman is 56-year-old man living in Kvemo Khvedureti village in the Kareli district with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and an infant grandchild. The main income for the family is from agricultural activities. They own a plot of land where fruits and vegetables are grown. Also they have a milk cow, which is milked to make cheese. Harvested products, along with the cheese, are sold locally at the markets. 

With part of the received loan, Murman wants to purchase fertilizers and all the needed products for cultivating the land. With another part of the loan he will pay the workers for cultivating the land. Later he will plant more fruits and vegetables to develop his agricultural business. This will increase the family income, and Murman will be able to provide better living conditions for his big family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other needed products for cultivating the land.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is 34 years old. He lives with his wife, two children (5 and 13 years old) and father, who is provided with a retirement pension. Zaza serves local people as a taxi driver and earns income. 

The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milking cow. Zaza’s wife milks the cow and produces cheese for selling locally. Besides that, they have a hectare of agricultural land, where cherry trees and apple trees are grown. The harvested products are sold locally at a good price. Zaza is very hard-working young man and he does his best to insure a good harvest. 

He requested a loan for purchasing a plot of agricultural land. After the land is bought, he will be able to grow tomatoes and sell them at a good price. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Zaza awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land and sow tomatoes.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a single man, age 21, and he supports one of his siblings who is in secondary school.

Josphat owns a retail shop in Kapsabet and has been in operation for a period of two years, earning an income of KES 9,000.

He has borrowed a first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Ltd., and he intends to purchase stock of sugar, cooking fat, salt, wheat and maize flour for his shop.  

The profits he earns will be used to repay the loan and expand his current business. His dream is to see his business grow.

loans.use: To purchase stock of sugar, cooking fat, salt, wheat and maize flour.

loans.name: Watsaji Group

texts.en:
Watsaji Group is located in Kakamega North District. It is a group of 11 women and three men led by Gerald, pictured on the right with his hand raised. 

He is receiving an input loan for a half acre of millet and sorghum cultivation. Gerald first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2009 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Gerald joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.
