Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Gerald was only able to harvest seven bags of maize per 3/4 acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, he was able to harvest 13 bags per 3/4 acre! 

He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and buy a cow. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive half an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Gerald’s group will receive seven acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the floor of her porch.

loans.name: El Ayle Group

texts.es: Iván es originario de una comunidad indígena, donde la  mayoría de las personas se dedican al cultivo de flor de noche buena la cual venden en todo el país, ya que es flor de muy buena calidad. Iván es parte en un grupo llamado El Ayle dice que le pusieron ese nombre porque donde se reúnen hay un gran árbol de Ayle y para que no se les olvidara el nombre del grupo le pusieron así, platica que aproximadamente tiene trabajando con el grupo tres años y medio y que poco a poco ha mejorado su negocio, dice que antes nada mas compraba y vendía frutas y legumbres las cuales las compraba en su comunidad y las vendía en la población de Tuxpan y ahorita el cultiva su propios frutos ya que su padre le regalo un terreno amplio y que aproximadamente tiene 80 árboles de aguacate, 20 de durazno y zarzamoras, dice que le va bien con su venta  de fruto ya  que el vende los aguacates por toneladas y van hasta su huerto a comprarle el dice “ya me estoy dando a conocer porque vendo fruto de muy buena calidad y eso le gusta a mis clientes, le doy muchas gracias a VisionFund por ayudarme con créditos porque así compro lo necesario para mejorar mis arbolitos”. Ahorita Iván está pidiendo un crédito para comprar insumos ya que sus árboles tienen fruto pequeño y en el mes de mayo y junio se dedica a la cosecha, dice que cuando es temporada de corta le paga a personas de su localidad ayudándoles a tener un trabajo temporal para que le ayuden a cortar el fruto tanto de aguacate como de durazno, su sueño de Iván es seguir haciendo crecer su huerto ya  que con mucho esfuerzo lo ha sacado adelante dice que el quisiera hacerle a su mama una casa de material por que donde viven es muy pequeño y que le gustaría seguir estudiando ya que nada mas termino la preparatoria y no continuo sus estudios por falta de capital. Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Imelda, Ausencio y Ma. Julia ellos invertirán sus créditos en plantas de aguacate e insumos para estos como abonos orgánicos, insecticidas, calidra, fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Iván comes from an indigenous community in which the majority of people make a living growing Poinsettia flowers, which they sell throughout the country because it is a high-quality flower. Iván is a member of the El Ayle group. He explains that they chose this name because at the place where they meet there is a large Ayle tree, and this way, they wouldn't forget the group name. He says that he has worked with the group for around three and a half years, and that little by little, his business has improved. 

Previously, he explains, he just bought and sold fruit and vegetables, which he purchased from his community and sold in the town of Tuxpan. Now, he grows his own fruit because his father gave him a large plot which has roughly 80 avocado trees, 20 peach trees and blackberries. He says that his fruit sells well, as he sells avocados by the tonne and people visit his orchard to buy them. He says, “My name is becoming known as I sell very high-quality fruit and this pleases my customers. I am very grateful to VisionFund for helping me with the loans, because it means I can buy what I need to improve my trees”. 

Today, Iván is requesting a loan to buy supplies, as his trees have small fruit and May and June are harvest season. He recounts that during harvest time, he pays local people to help him gather the avocados and peaches. Iván's dream is to continue expanding his orchard because through large amounts of effort he has managed to make it succeed. He comments that he wants to build a home out of high-quality materials for his mother, because she lives in a small house at the moment. He also wants to continue studying since he left school after high school due to a lack of money. 

The other group members are Imelda, Ausencio and Ma. Julia. They will invest their loans in avocado trees and supplies for them such as organic compost, pesticides, lime and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy avocado trees, pesticides, lime, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Nelly Del Carmen

texts.es: Nelly compró productos de tocador ropa, adornos, dulces, planes de minutos recargas ropa de cama y su negocio ahora ofrece un mejor servicio y esto fue gracias a su anterior credikiva. En a actualidad planea su nuevo financiamiento y será ´para aplicarlo a la compra de mercancías variadas como ropa y productos de tocador, además de que hará mejoras locativas. Su inversión mejorará los inventarios y estará mucho más confortable. Ella dice a sus financiadores: “Dios continúe bendiciéndolos a todos ustedes y continúen con ese interés de seguir ayudando a la gente mas necesitada. “
texts.en:
Thanks to her previous Kiva loan, Nelly purchased toiletries, clothing, ornaments, candies, phone minute reloading plans and bedding. Her business now offers better service. 

She is currently planning her new loan. She will use it to purchase a variety of merchandise such as clothing and toiletries, in addition to making rental improvements. Her investment will improve her inventory and will make the place more comfortable.

She says to her lenders: "May God continue to bless all of you and may you continue to help the people who most need it."

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise such as clothing and toiletries. She will also make rental improvements.

loans.name: Mujeres Hacendosas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Hacendosas está en su ciclo 11º donde gracias al esfuerzo de todas las integrantes y gracias a la ayuda y capacitación de la fundación y con el apoyo de las asesoras pudieron mejorar sus economías y hoy ninguna está por debajo de la línea de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Silvina, ella se desempeña como tesorera del grupo; ella en su última encuesta aunque haya arrojado un resultado del nivel tres o sea verde sigue trabajando incansablemente para día a día ir superando todo tipo de obstáculos que se le presentan, pues cabe mencionar que ella es viuda y gracias a su esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa ha logrado hacer estudiar a sus hijos que hoy día algunos ya son profesionales mientras otros siguen con sus respectivas carreras.
La Sra. solicita  este crédito para la compra de   carnes, bebidas, enlatados, leche y demás insumos para su despensa, ya que tiene un negocio bien surtido y estos productos  le ayudarán  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a aumentar sus ingresos y de esa manera mejorar la calidad de vida de los integrantes de su familia.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Hacendosas ("Hardworking Women") group is in its eleventh cycle. Thanks to the efforts of all of its members and to the help and training given by the foundation, as well as the support of the consultants, they were able to improve their finances. Today, none of the members are below the poverty line.

One of the members is Silvina, who acts as the group's treasurer. In her last survey, she came out with a result in the third level, or green on the program scale. However, she still continues to work tirelessly day after day to overcome all kinds of obstacles. It should be mentioned that she is a widow, and through her effort and continuous work, as well as applying the vital behaviors of a successful woman, she has managed to have all of her children study. Today, some of them are already professionals while some continue with their respective degrees.

Silvina has applied for this loan to buy meat, drinks, canned goods, milk, and other goods for her grocery store. She has a well-stocked business and these products will help her to firm up her business plan, which in turn will help her to increase her earnings and thus improve the quality of life of her family members.

loans.use: to buy meat, drinks, canned goods, milk, and other goods.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 33-year-old single mother of 3 children between the ages of 15 and 8 years old. She owns a retail shop in Kapsabet and has been in operation for a period of four years, earning an income of approximately KES 10,000 a month.

She is now servicing a third loan of KES 25,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to purchase more stock of fruits and vegetables for resale. The profits she earns from her business will be used to pay school fees for her children who are in school.

Her dream in life is to have a prosperous business and live happily.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two school-going children. She owns a clothing shop that she has been operating for two years. She also runs a retail shop.

She learned about Milango through friends, with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is competition.

Matilda is applying for a loan of 15,900 Kenya shillings to buy more clothes for the business. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the business operation and expand it. She hopes to expand to the wholesale level.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her stationery store.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Valientes está en su sexto ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde dos de las miembros del comité están por debajo de la línea de la pobreza, y ellas están luchando por mejorar su economía y crecer.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cirila,  quien en su última encuesta mostró estar en el nivel uno. Es por eso que ella está solicitando de este crédito, para poder emprender un nuevo negocio, que es la venta de comidas, y desea poder comprar  ingredientes para empezar a vender empanadas milanesas entre otras cosas y con eso empezar a generar ingresos  A parte de las capacitaciones correspondientes y de los seguimientos también hemos hacen un plan de negocio así para que puedan tener un mejor control de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
The group named “Mujeres Valientes” (Valiant Women) is in its sixth loan cycle as part of the Women’s Committee Program. Two members of this group are below the poverty line, so they are striving to grow and improve their economic situation.

One of the members is Sra. Cirila. Her latest survey indicated that she is at Level 1. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can establish a new business of selling food. Cirila wants to buy ingredients so that she can make meat-filled pastries and other items in order to generate income. With the appropriate training and tracking, she will develop a business plan that will help her take better control over her earnings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is a 26-year-old woman from Kayonza District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Sophia started selling lights in August, 2012 and has sold 40 lights to date, providing clean energy to 200 people. She is also a farmer and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself and her husband.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: El Eucalipto Group

texts.es: Doña Santa es originaria de la unidad de Emiliano Zapata, plática que ya tiene varios ciclos trabajando con VisionFund en el grupo llamado El Eucalipto y que le gusta cómo trabaja la financiera ella dice “no se me han hecho los pagos pesados aparte que tengo la oportunidad de ir ahorrando y de ir surtiendo mi tienda de abarrotes”. Dice que tiene una tiendita de abarrotes en su comunidad desde hace 20 años y que fue unas de las primeras que hubo en su pueblo. Platica que ella pide créditos para mejorar su changarro aunque es pequeño lo tiene muy bien surtido, dice que está en su casa y que su esposo le hizo un cuartito de madera para que lo pusiera su negocio y que puso ese tipo de negocio porque no tenía un trabajo estable ya que ella nada mas había estudiado la primaria y no le querían dar trabajo entonces como vio que no había tiendas cerca de su casa decidió poner una. Ella surte sus productos en diferentes tiendas de la población de Zitacuaro donde le dan precios bajos, ahorita ella quiere surtir con el préstamo que está pidiendo artículos de abarrotes como huevo, cloro, azúcar, leche, frijol, papel higiénico, pañales, focos, servilletas, refrescos, sabritas, pan, galletas, chiles enlatados, atún, sardinas, mayonesa, crema y ahorita quiere invertir jitomate, cebolla y chiles serranos y chiles manzanos, dice que esos los ira a comprar a la central de abastos de Zitacuaro. La meta de Doña Santa es poder hacer su local de material para que no se le eche a perder nada con las inclemencias del clima. Las demás integrantes del grupo se llaman María Margarita, Elvira, Lilia, Fausto, Ma. de los Ángeles, Cleotilde, Virginia, Camerina, María Guadalupe ellas invertirán en sus negocios de venta y compra de frutas y legumbres de la región, en artículos de abarrotes, en la compra de bisutería para su venta.
texts.en:
Santa is from the residential unit of Emiliano Zapata. She says that she has already completed several loan cycles with VisionFund in the group called "El Eucalipto" (The Eucalyptus), and that she likes how the lending agency works. She says, "The payments have not been hard to make, and apart from that, I have the opportunity to save and to stock my grocery store."

She says that she has had a small grocery store in her community for 20 years and that it was one of the first that existed in her town. She is asking for this loan to improve her shop. Although it is small, she keeps it very well stocked. It is in her home and her spouse built a little room out of wood so that she could put her business there. She wanted to start this type of business because she didn't have a stable job since she hadn't studied beyond primary school, and she couldn't find work elsewhere. Since she saw that there weren't any shops close to her home, she decided to start one. 

She buys her products in different shops in the town of Zitacuaro, where they give her low prices. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to stock her shop with items like eggs, bleach, sugar, milk, beans, toilet paper, tissues, lightbulbs, napkins, soft drinks, snacks, bread, cookies, canned chiles, tuna, sardines, mayonnaise and cream. She also wants to get tomatoes, onions, serrano chiles and manzano chiles, which she says she will buy at the wholesale food market in Zitacuaro.

Santa's goal is to be able to build her shop out of a material that won't get ruined by the weather. The other group members are named María Margarita, Elvira, Lilia, Fausto, Ma. de los Ángeles, Cleotilde, Virginia, Camerina and María Guadalupe. They will invest in their businesses and buy fruits and legumes from the region, items for grocery stores, and jewelry items to re-sell.

loans.use: to invest in items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to his floor

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is widowed and works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Ma. Gina is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items such as canned goods, soft-drinks and other groceries .

Ma. Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she may continue to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items such as canned goods, soft-drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits in wholesale and some bags of sugar and flour.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio con su anterior credikiva compró un carro para distribuir los jugos, adquirió también una vitrina calentadora y hasta le alcanzó para comprar materias primas e insumos con los que aumentó su producción. Hoy su negocio tiene una mejor presentación y las ventas se incrementaron. Julio envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva: Le doy gracias y que continúen con esa hermosa labor que es la de ayudar a los pequeños empresarios” En la actualidad aplicó a un credikiva mediante el cual compró una carpa para protegerse del sol y del agua lluvia, para poder extender su jornada de trabajo hasta mas tarde.
texts.en:
With his previous Kiva loan Julio bought a cart to distribute juice.  He also got a heated cabinet.  He even had enough to buy raw materials and supplies with which he increased his production.  Now his business has a better presentation and the sales have increased.

Julio sends the following message to his Kiva lenders.  “I thank you, and may you continue with this beautiful work of helping small business people.”

He currently applied for a Kiva loan with which he bought a canopy to protect himself from the sun and the rain.  This way he is able to extend his working day until much later.

loans.use: to buy a canopy to protect himself from the sun and the rain.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Sandra, de 32 años de edad, es una fami-empresaria que se ha caracterizado por sacar adelante a su familia y buscar mejores oportunidades para generar ingresos y colaborarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que por situaciones ajenas a su voluntad, el empleo ha escaseado y sólo trabaja por días. Sandra asegura que mientras pueda ella hará todo lo posible por brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y garantizarle a su hijo educación. 
“La familia, el amor y los sueños son como un cuerda de tres hilos que enlazados jamás pueden ser destruidos, por esta razón busco la manera de colaborarle a mi esposo en tiempos de necesidad por que somos uno solo” Con estas palabras Sandra manifiesta el gran amor hacia su familia.
En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa desde su casa con el fin de cuidar de su hijo de diez años de edad. Asegura que las ventas han sido su mejor aliado en tiempos de crisis y gracias a su buena atención las ventas se han aumentado, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía. Espera poder mejorar su condición económica y motar su negocio en un local cerca a su casa.
texts.en:
Sandra is 32 years old. She is a family business woman who is getting her family ahead and seeking better opportunities to generate income and help her husband with the household expenses. Due to circumstances beyond her control, employment has grown scarce and she only works sporadically. Sandra says that as long as she can, she will do everything possible to offer her family a better quality of life and guarantee her child and education.  

“Family, love and dreams are like a three fibered rope that woven together can never be destroyed. That is why I seek a way to help my husband during times of need, because we are one". With these words, Sandra expresses the great love she has for her family.

At this time, she is selling clothes from her home so she can care for her ten year old son. She assures us that the sales have been her best ally in times of crisis and thanks to her good service, her sales have increased. That is why she is asking for a loan that she will invest in buying merchandise. She hopes to improve her financial situation and set up her business in a local close to her home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothing)

loans.name: Lununi Group

texts.en:
Lununi, represented by Lindison, is a group of 12 farmers in Kakamega North District. The group has 10 women and 2 men. Lindison is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of millet and sorghum. Lindison first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2009 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Lindison joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Lindison reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about 6 bags of maize per ½ acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 10 bags per 1/2 acre! He plans on using future profits from the harvest to buy a cow and send his children to school. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Lindison’s group will receive 6 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Saher

texts.en:
Saher is 33 years old from Hebron. He is married and has one child.

Sahar has owned an internet cafe since 2001 and has one employee. He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy computers and tables. He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy computers and tables.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna (with her child) is a married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 3 months to 18 years. She describes herself to be good woman. Lorna operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a slum area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to pay school fees for her children. Her business goal is to run another beauty salon within 5 years. Lorna took a previous loan of 50,000 KES from SMEP DTM which she managed to pay successfully.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Las Tres Marias Group

texts.es: Les presento al grupo “LAS TRES MARIAS” grupo conformado por 6 mujeres empeñosas  se encuentran pasando el octavo ciclo. Rebeca es una de las integrantes del grupo. Es soltera tiene 32 años tiene dos hijos menos. Trabaja en la bodega que puso en su casa hace dos años. Su mayor deseo es tener una bodega más grande y darles una profesión a sus hijos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Rebeca es la ultima del lado izquierdo viste con polo negro y pantalón negro.
texts.en: Meet the "Las Tres Marias" ("The Three Marias") group, composed of 6 persevering women. They are in their eighth loan cycle. Rebeca is one of the members of the group. She is single, 32 years old, and has two small children. She works in the grocery store she put in her house two years ago. Her greatest dream is to have a bigger store and give her children a profession. The group is thankful to the Kiva lenders for the loan provided. Rebeca is the last one on the left, dressed in a black polo shirt and black pants.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and oil for her grocery store

loans.name: Álvaro De Jesús

texts.es:
Álvaro de 55 años de edad inició su vida como comerciante en el municipio de Santa Bárbara, Colombia a la edad de 18 años, gracias  al apoyo de su padre montó su tienda en donde se dedicó a la comercialización de productos de la canasta familiar.  Después de casarse, decidió radicarse en el municipio de Itagüí en donde reside actualmente con su esposa y sus dos hijos. Trasladó su negocio y labora diariamente de ocho de  la mañana a ocho de la noche. Gracias a su actividad ha podido garantizarles a su familia una vida digna y educación a sus  hijos.
En la actualidad desea ampliar su portafolio de productos por la alta demanda en el sector, y para ello se encuentra solicitando un crédito ya que no cuenta con el capital para realizar dicha inversión. 
Su mayor sueño es poder convertir su tienda en un mercado autoservicio y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Álvaro is 55 years old. He started his life as a merchant in the town of Santa Bárbara, Colombia when he was 18 years old.  Thanks to his father's support, he set up a store where he sold basic family basket products. After marrying, he decided to live in the town of Itagüí where he lives now with his wife and two children. He transferred his business and works every day from eight in the morning until eight at night. Thanks to this activity, he has been able to guarantee his family a dignified life and an education for his children.

At this time, he wants to expand his portfolio due to the high demand in the area. That is why he is asking for a loan, since he doesn't have the capital to make the investment. 
 
His biggest dream is to be able to convert his store into a self serve market and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy basic family basket products.
